palestinian authority becomes 123rd member of the international criminal court. the move gives the court jurisdiction over alleged crimes in palestinian territories. israel and the united states opposed the palestinians' efforts to join the body. the court opened a preliminary examination into the situation in palestine in january.
a stray dog in washington state was hit by a car and buried in a field. she was found four days later, emaciated and covered in dirt. the dog, a bully breed mix, suffered a dislocated jaw, leg injuries and a caved-in sinus cavity. a fundraising page has been set up to help pay for the dog's medical care.
mohammad javad zarif is the iranian foreign minister. he has been john kerry's opposite number in securing a breakthrough in nuclear talks. he is known for being "polished" and "jovial"   his official biography says he was born in 1959, but his ministry's website is unclear on the date of birth. he was outside the country during the revolution.

amnesty international releases its annual report on the death penalty. at least 607 people were executed worldwide in 2014, compared to 778 in 2013. the number of executions worldwide is down 22% on the previous year. amnesty says governments are using the threat of terrorism to advance executions. the report finds "positive developments" worldwide, with most regions showing reductions in executions. but it also highlights a marked increase in the numbers of people sentenced to death worldwide.

maysak is a tropical storm. it's expected to make landfall sunday morning on the southeastern coast of isabela province. authorities warn of flash floods and landslides. maysak gained super typhoon status just a few days ago. it has steady winds of 70 mph and gusts up to 90 mph.

amnesty international releases annual review of the death penalty worldwide. governments using death penalty in misguided attempt to tackle crime and terrorism, authors say. executions recorded in 22 countries, down by half from 20 years ago, but up by 500 in 2014. authors say governments are using the penalty as an easy way out when times are tough. there is no evidence death penalty is a deterrent to crime.

the total lunar eclipse will only last four minutes and 43 seconds. people west of the mississippi river will have the best view. parts of south america, india, china and russia also will be able to see the eclipse. it's the shortest total eclipse of the century. nasa says it will be visible from western north america.

yazidi women and girls are being sold as sex slaves by isis. isis justifies the enslavement of yazidis in its online magazine. hanan, 19, was held as a sex slave for a week. she was one of 25 yazidi girls and women held as slaves.   she and others escaped by crawling out of a window and evading capture.

the red sunsets are the result of raging wildfires in parts of siberia. the smoke from the fires was picked up by atmospheric winds. the winds carried the smoke across the pacific ocean and brought it to parts of washington and oregon. the red sunset is a result of smoke particles filtering out shorter wavelengths of light.

sabra hummus was recalled because of possible listeria contamination. there is no way to know if your food is safe to eat after a product recall. go to the food and drug administration's website and find the official report for the recalled product. the consumer can't do anything before learning about the recall.
new line cinema is planning a mariah carey christmas movie. producer jonathan shestack confirmed that he is working on the yet-untitled project. carey's good friend director brett ratner is co-producing. the diva was the queen of the 1990s.
saudi arabia executes a second indonesian domestic worker without warning. indonesia summons saudi ambassador to foreign ministry. government says it has taken "over a hundred steps" to save its citizens from the death penalty. rights groups say execution of a domestic worker with mental illness smacks of "a lack of humanity"
a grass fire in miami-dade county has burned nearly 2,000 acres. the fire is 50% contained, the fire department says. high temperatures and gusty winds helped the fire spread, a state forester says. one school was evacuated as a precaution.
the pope's ipad sold for $30,500 at an auction house in uruguay. it came with a keyboard and a certificate signed by his personal secretary. the proceeds will go to a school in montevideo. last year, the pope donated a harley-davidson motorcycle to charity.
pope francis played a key role in the re-establishment of diplomatic relations between cuba and the u.s. the vatican says the pope has considered the idea of visiting cuba this september. he helped negotiate a diplomatic thaw between the two nations. the pope is expected to visit washington, new york and philadelphia.
polish prince challenges british politician nigel farage to a duel in london's hyde park over immigration policy. prince jan zylinski says he is fed up with discrimination against poles living in britain. farage says he does not intend to accept the challenge.
a small boat carrying about 50 migrants hit a reef and sank off the northern coast of haiti. at least 12 people have been rescued. haiti's civil protection directorate says 11 victims have been identified. the boat was carrying migrants from le borgne, west of cap-haitien.
cyclist wang pingan's mountain bike was stolen just days before completing 460-day trip around china. he had covered 29,200 kilometers on his bike. police tracked down and returned the bike to wang. wang had been cycling through every major province in china for the past year.
carlberg city is a new neighborhood set to emerge on the historic grounds of the famous carlsberg brewery in copenhagen, danish capital. the area has been home to the famous beer-maker since 1847. the new neighborhood will be home to residential, business, sporting, cultural and educational space. investors have been renting out apartments in the area since 2008.
six attackers are killed by cameroonian forces, a military spokesman says. the last attack in cameroon was march 10. boko haram has been waging a years-long campaign of terror in nigeria. the attackers torched a village in the far north region.

"what pet should i get?" is the first new, original dr. seuss book since "oh, the places you'll go!" in 1990. the book's first printing was increased from 500,000 to 1 million copies to keep up with demand. it debuts july 28.
italians have the highest number of unesco world heritage sites in the world -- 50. italy doesn't know what to do with its cultural heritage. many of the sites risk crumbling to the ground due to neglect and lack of public resources. travel writer says italians lack a sense of national belonging. culture and art could generate a turnover of 214 billion euros a year.
many believe syringe exchange programs promote and encourage drug use, authors say. authors: scientific evidence shows they are effective in reducing hiv and hepatitis c transmission. they say syringe services programs save millions of dollars in hiv treatment costs. authors say a ban on federal funds for these programs was imposed in 1988.

scientists found a new species of glassfrog on the caribbean slopes of costa rica. it looks a lot like diane's bare-hearted glassfrog. the last time a new glassfrog was found in costa-rica was in 1973. the species is called hyalinobatrachium dianae.

tristan da cunha is the most isolated human settlement on earth. uk overseas territory is holding international competition to improve infrastructure and make island self-sustainable. island is only accessible by sea 60-days-a-year and home to just under 270 people. only seven family names on the island.
the blob is a huge area of unusually warm water in the pacific. scientists say a high-pressure ridge over the west coast has calmed ocean waters for two winters. some marine species are exploring the warmer waters, leading some fish to migrate. the blob could be playing a factor in the drought in california.

the mass killings of armenians in the ottoman empire began 100 years ago friday. the word "genocide" was not even a word at the time. estimates range from 300,000 to 2 million deaths between 1914 and 1923. some scholars say it was the first genocide of the 20th century.
40 years ago today, the khmer rouge regime killed 1.7 million cambodians in one of the worst genocides of the modern era. cambody's traumatized society is beginning to reckoning with its history. for decades, speaking of the regime's crimes was a taboo. a tv show has reunited members of 54 families shattered by the genocide.

scientists say yellowstone's magma reserves are many magnitudes greater than previously thought. there is enough hot rock under the national park to fill the grand canyon nearly 14 times over. an eruption in the next few thousand years is extremely unlikely, the scientists say. the discovery may help scientists better understand the effects of previous eruptions at yellowstone.

matyas gutai's water house is a house built with water. hungarian architect believes water is the perfect material for keeping a house at a comfortable temperature. the house can produce its own energy and is independent of energy suppliers. gutai built a prototype house after years of research and development.

in 2013, turkish archaeologists found a piece of the true cross of jesus' cross in a stone chest in a church. but the box was later found to be empty. the "true cross" phenomenon is symbolic of the pitfalls in the hunt for relics of the crucifixion. to say something is a " true cross" can mean it's divine certainty or fraud.

james webb space telescope is a successor to the hubble telescope that has been operating in space for 25 years. new telescope is as big as a tennis court and requires a golf ball of gold. scientists hope to study the first galaxies formed after the big bang and search for signs of life on other planets. mission will cost $8.5 billion.

the red cross opens a blood bank in kathmandu. india sends 10 more aid flights and 10 helicopters to assist in search-and-rescue efforts. google india launches a person finder website to help locate missing people. more than 1,800 people have been killed in the earthquake.

over 4,400 dead, 8,000 injured and 8 million people affected in nepal earthquake. nepal still trying to come to terms with the scale of the disaster. government and army trying to coordinate and organize aid distribution. airport management is still chaotic. access to remote areas is still difficult.

noelle velentzas and asia siddiqui, a u.s. citizen, are accused of planning to build an explosive device for attacks in the united states. a federal criminal complaint says they expressed support for violent jihad. the women did not enter pleas in federal court. they are held without bond.

"he was outgoing," his brother anthony scott says. a lawyer for scott's family says scott owed over $18,000 in back payments for two children.

brynn duncan, 21, was diagnosed with mast cell disease after having her first serious allergic reaction. she has mast cell syndrome, which is a rare form of immune system disease. mast cells are the cells that regulate the immune system and are known as mast cells. scientists don't know what causes the disease, but scientists are starting to recognize it.

turk's government's heavy-handed repression of public dissent and censorship of the media has contributed to a hyper-polarized and deeply mistrustful political atmosphere. turks are confused and confused after the power outage and court house siege. the country is tense after years of back-to-back political crises.
mcdonald's announced it will raise wages for 90,000 of its employees, but only for 10% of the company's restaurants. isaiah is a fast-food worker and a member of a union. she says the raise is a small step forward, but not enough for all mcdonald's workers. she and other workers are fighting for a living wage of $15 per hour.
gov. jerry brown imposes mandatory water restrictions for the first time on residents, businesses and farms in california. cities and towns are ordered to reduce water usage by 25%. the reduction does not apply to agriculture. agriculture uses about 80% of the state's water supply. the entire state faces at least a moderate drought.
uk voters go to the polls to elect a new prime minister. queen elizabeth ii is officially britain's head of state, but she's only nominally in charge. british elections are run on a "first-past-the-post" basis. the election could result in the handing of power to the labour party. uk elections are similar to a two-horse race, but with fewer horses.

this page includes the show transcript. use the transcript to help students with reading comprehension and vocabulary. at the bottom of the page, comment for a chance to be mentioned on cnn student news.   you must be a teacher or a student age 13 or older to request a mention on the cnnstudent news roll call. the weekly newsquiz tests students' knowledge of events in the news.
misao okawa was born on march 5, 1898. according to guiness world records, she was the world's oldest person. okawa passed away wednesday morning in osaka, japan. she left behind three children, four grandchildren and six great grandchildren. the oldest person ever was jeanne louise calment.
the missouri national guard used highly militarized words to refer to protesters, documents show. the guard was concerned about perceptions of its deployment to help quell riots in ferguson, missouri. a national guard spokesman defended the language as standard for the planning process ahead of deployment. the national guard's language is intensifying concerns of some.
four somali soldiers and eight civilians are killed in the attack, officials say. a suicide car bombing and five gunmen attack the education ministry headquarters in mogadishu. the islamist militant group al-shabaab says it is responsible for the attack. soldiers from the african union teamed up with somali security forces to shoot and kill the five attackers.
gregory margolin fought in the soviet red army during world war ii. his family fled to israel after the war. margolin was one of 600 jews who have moved to isisrael since december. many jews in eastern ukraine are holocaust survivors or children of holocaust victims.
more than 200 nigerian schoolgirls are still missing a year after they were abducted. malala malala says we should all feel shame that the world has allowed this to happen.    the world is rallying around the hashtag #bringbackourgirls to help find the missing girls. but the world's silence on the issue is shameful.
fm radio in norway will be phased out region by region starting in 2017. half the country already listens digitally. officials say the move will save $25 million. the country's radio waves won't be cut off entirely, but will be replaced by digital. the nation's culture minister says half the nation already listens to digital radio.
a new study suggests the brontosaurus belongs to its own genera. o.c. marsh first named the dinosaur in 1879. a paleontologist at the nova university of lisbon, portugal, led the study. it took five years to collect the data.
al qaeda offers a reward for the death or capture of houthi leader abdelmalik bedrudin al-houthi and former yemeni president. aqap is one of several factions fighting to control yemen. at least 540 people have died as a result of the conflict.
"my flight is not a secret," doug hughes wrote on a website. hughes' friend michael shanahan says hughes told him to check out the website. "the point of the flight is to spotlight corruption in dc," he wrote. one of hughes's sons committed suicide 2 ½ years ago, a newspaper reports.
rio de janeiro officials launch an investigation into the causes of dead fish in the lagoon. the city hosts the 2016 olympics and has pledged to reduce pollution in the fetid bay. officials believe recent rains caused a temperature change of the water and the excess of decaying organic matter.
anthony ray hinton spent nearly 30 years on alabama's death row. he was convicted of killing two men in 1985. the charges against him were dismissed after a new trial. hinton was freed one week after his murder convictions were wiped clean. he says he has to pinch himself to tell himself he's free.
david cameron says there was no clear winner in the uk election debate between seven party leaders. ed miliband is a capable debater and ed cameron is short on passion, says author.    but nicola sturgeon's high score in post-debate polls shows she was sharp and sassy.  miliband's ratings as a leader have already improved.
a brooklyn woman has been trying to divorce her husband for several years. justice matthew cooper said social media sites like facebook are the "next frontier" for serving divorce papers. ellanora arthur baidoo's husband has refused to be served with the papers.
italian physician dr. sergio canavero says the first human whole head transplant could take place in 2017. he says he has research that supports the idea. he needs a major academic medical center to host the procedure. he has identified the first patient and is working to secure funding for the project.

a decade ago, "sustainable farming" was considered fringe; now it's a movement, says chef and food policy action founder. he says factory farms reap huge profits but produce subpar meat and harm the environment and public health. he wants congress to promote sustainable farming, not factory farms.
dan swangard joined a california lawsuit seeking to let doctors prescribe lethal medications to certain patients. three states already have laws allowing physician-assisted deaths. historically, doctors have been some of the most vocal critics of assisted suicide. a recent survey shows 54 percent of american doctors support assisted suicide, up from 46 percent.

south africa marks the anniversary of the first post-apartheid elections on april 27. attacks against african migrants are often reduced to attitudes of hate and resentment towards other black africans, say authors. they say the label "xenophobia" fails to convey the reality of violence against migrants in south africa.
like the war, iran's defiance to halt its nuclear program has defined ayatollah ali khamenei's era. he has defied the west in the face of increasing economic pressure. the deal with the west marks a new chapter in the history of iran.
the idea of sustainable development is that raw capitalism is the economics of greed.    it's a doctrine that says economic growth must be combined with social fairness and environmental sustainability. sustainable development calls for a holistic approach that combines economic, social, and environmental objectives.  it is a way out of the crisis of growing inequality and environmental destruction.
the u.s. is too reliant on russian technology to meet national security obligations, authors say. it is time to end america's reliance on russia's rocket engine, they say. authors: we rely on the russian-made rd-180 rocket engine to launch national security satellites.

florida's everglades represent the folly of man and the cost of redemption. half of florida is dead and the other half is on life support after a century of development. american dreamers decided to drain the swamp a century ago. the army corps of engineers are now working to restore the wetlands.
yarmouk is the largest palestinian refugee camp in syria. an estimated 18,000 refugees are trapped inside the camp. the camp has been besieged and bombed by syrian regime forces for more than two years. isis militants seized yarmouk in april. as many as 5,000 people have tried to flee the camp since.

the sleep health foundation report that 30 percent of australians complain about their lack of sleep on a daily basis. the average adult needs around eight hours of sleep per night with a range of seven to nine. professor david hillman advises 20 minute power naps to avoid falling into deep sleep. our sleep pattern is influenced by how much we compromise from the work week.

england drew 1-1 with italy at the juventus stadium on tuesday night. graziano pelle opened the scoring for italy in the first half. andros townsend equalised for roy hodgson's side during a much-improved second half. wayne rooney said the england players were upset by their first half performance.
dundee united board hit back at criticism from supporters' groups arabtrust and the federation of dundee united supporters clubs. some supporters were angered by the amount of commission paid from transfer fees received. the board have defended their record by pointing to their on-field success. the supporters groups claim 25 per cent of £6.3million worth of transfer fees was paid in commission to unnamed parties.
gary locke will be confirmed as kilmarnock's new permanent manager on friday morning. locke replaced allan johnston on a caretaker basis until the end of the season. the former hearts boss will be given a three-year deal at rugby park. the club went unbeaten during locke's first six games in charge of the club.
the five-year-old child is called mai zizhuo and he has been shooting hoops since he was two and a half years old. his incredible skills have won him legions of fans across basketball-mad china. the pint-sized player shows his outstanding basketball skills in a viral video.
david alaba was injured while playing for austria in their 1-1 draw against bosnia-herzegovina. he has been ruled out for seven weeks with a torn knee ligament. alaba has been in excellent form for bayern munich this season. the 22-year-old was out for three months earlier this season with a partial ligament tear.
dane tilse will move from canberra raiders to hull kr on a two-and-a-half-year deal. the raiders have agreed to release the australian forward. tilse has made 200 appearances for canberra and will link up with former raiders team-mate terry campese. michael weyman and ryan bailey have both retired from super league.
mark burchill believes darren cole wants to play in livingston's petrofac cup final on sunday. cole was left heartbroken after the death of his cousin, shaun, from a suspected hit-and-run. shaun cole, 22, was found dead in a miami street last weekend. livingston face alloa in the national final at mcdiarmid park.
alan smith has denied claims that liverpool fans attacked the ambulance he was travelling to hospital in during manchester united's fa cup fifth round exit nine years ago. smith suffered a broken leg and a dislocated ankle while attempting to block a john arne riise free-kick at anfield in 2006. at the time, it was claimed that fans threw bottles, beer glasses and stones at the ambulance.
heart captain danny wilson is a summer transfer target for celtic and could be signed for £400,000. the defender is out of contract at the end of the season but hearts are in no rush to sell. john denayer is expected to return to manchester city after a loan spell at hearts.    managerronny deila is battling to keep hold of virgil van dijk and jason denayer at the club.
ronny deila says celtic won't be travelling as much in pre-season as they did last year. champions league champions lost to legia warsaw 4-1 in champions league qualifying. deila has the blessing of chief executive peter lawwell to scale down this summer's commitments.
kevin de bruyne has been linked with bayern munich as a potential replacement for franck ribery and arjen robben. the wolfsburg forward has scored nine goals and has 16 assists this season. but bayern's franck ribbery says de bruyny is the wrong type of player for pep guardiola. the former france international says his counter-attacking skills don't mesh with munich's style. eden hazard would be an ideal fit with guardiola and the allianz arena, but expensive.
davon durant, a promising linebacker at asu, was arrested on domestic violence charges after his girlfriend of 18 months, kelsi langley, claimed he hit her in the face and grabbed her neck during an argument march 7. durant was suspended from the football team indefinitely and could be facing expulsion. on tuesday, langley publicly recanted her story and said that she lied about the assault because she was jealous. according to a police report, durant's girlfriend suffered a bruise and finger marks around her neck but langley said the bruises were love bites and her eyes were red from crying.
detroit tigers pitcher justin verlander snapped a selfie in front a little boy wearing a dark blue shirt with verlander's name and jersey number, 35, on the back. the pitcher uploaded the selfie to his more than 150,000 instagram followers. in january, former philadelphia phillies pitcher roy halladay tweeted a photo of himself in front of a fan.
eden hazard was substituted with 28 minutes to go in belgium's 1-0 win over israel on tuesday. eden hazard has played 48 games this season for club and country. the 24-year-old playmaker has played all but five of chelsea's premier league games. hazard has admitted an intense campaign may have left him too tired to perform at his best. manager marc wilmots said he felt that hazard looked tired after the game.
police discovered 20 grams of marijuana hidden within a leg of lamb in the northern territory. the slab of meat was found by officers after something smelled suspicious . it is believed the lamb had been shipped to a company at darwin airport. police said the stash would have been worth $2000 if it had been sold.
clarke carlisle says he has'moved out of the marital home' in yorkshire that he shared with wife of 14 years, gemma. the former premier league defender tried to kill himself in december, two days after being arrested on suspicion of drink-driving. the 35-year-old father-of-three stepped in front of a 12-ton truck on the a64 near york in attempt to commit suicide. he said the scars he still bears from the incident are a 'constant reminder' of his good fortune in surviving.
paul merson criticised andros townsend's call up to the england squad last week. the sky sports pundit said townsend should not have been in the squad. townsend scored the equaliser in england's 1-1 friendly draw with italy in turin on tuesday. merson admitted he was wrong to criticise townsend in his sky sports column.
cesc fabregas captained spain in their 2-0 defeat by holland on tuesday. the chelsea midfielder has struggled to make an impact in midfield this season. the spaniard has struggled during the second half of the premier league season. he has just one assist in five games since mid-january. jose mourinho will be demanding more from his star man in the run-in.

fa chairman greg dyke wants to increase the number of homegrown players in a premier league squad from eight to 12. arsene wenger believes clubs should produce the best players in the world. fa chairman dyke's proposals could be detrimental to the quality of the premier league. but wenger's transfer record shows he has signed a number of good players.
charlie austin signed for queens park rangers on his premier league debut season. joey barton ignored him on his first day at the club before realising his mistake. the duo have since become good friends. austin says qpr can't afford to lose their next two games and must pick up four points.
the black pooch was filmed in action as he took a rescue rope out to his owner at the clarence j. brown dam and reservoir in springfield, ohio, on saturday afternoon. footage shows the unidentified man then being hauled to shore by firefighters after spending almost two hours in waters hovering around zero degrees celsius. he apparently got stuck waist-deep in mud while recovering some duck hunting gear.

michael mcindoe played for bristol city and wolverhampton wanderers and was declared bankrupt in october last year with £2.4m debts. he fronted a £30million investment scheme and lived a millionaire's lifestyle. the former winger lured fellow players into the scheme with promises of a 20 per cent return. but the scheme collapsed amid mounting debts and he is now surviving on handouts. the 35-year-old told a court he has received £9,000 from friends and family but has no income.

juventus beat empoli 2-0 at home to maintain 14-point lead at the top of the serie a table. carlos tevez and roberto pereyra scored for the turin giants. inter milan were held to a 1-1 draw by rock-bottom parma at the san siro. roma beat napoli 1-0 and lazio beat cagliari 3-1 at home.
kevin de bruyne is wanted by a host of clubs but no transfer away from wolfsburg has been agreed. patrick de koster's agent has denied a deal is in place for the midfielder to leave wolfsburg. manchester city and bayern munich and manchester united are also interested. the belgian is one of the hottest prospects in european football after starring in the bundesliga.
swansea are yet to pick up a point after an international break this season. garry monk's side face hull at liberty stadium on saturday. swansea boss is out to claim a season-first against hull by picking up some points after the break. hull are currently bottom of the premier league table.
ronaldo says he 'would pay out of his own pocket' to sign lionel messi for his united states football team. the former brazil striker is a co-owner of second tier united states side, fort lauderdale strikers. ronaldo is also a target to sign ex-barcelona and real madrid striker.
northampton wing george north will miss saturday's european champions cup quarter-final at clermont auvergne. north has been knocked unconscious three times in recent months. the wales wing was knocked out against wasps on friday night. north is being assessed by a neurologist and will await expert opinion before deciding when he will play again.
cesar azpilicueta is counting down the games until chelsea win the barclays premier league title. jose mourinho's team sit top of the table ahead of facing stoke city at stamford bridge on saturday. the spanish defender believes chelsea have shown their strength since 'day one'    the blues have only briefly relinquished the title lead since their opening 3-1 win over burnley.
mohamed diame has been out for four months with a knee injury. hull boss steve bruce confirms the midfielder will return for visit to swansea city on saturday. hull are currently 15th in the premier league and face a relegation battle. the £3.5m midfielder signed from west ham in the summer.
toby alderweireld will return to atletico madrid when his loan spell at southampton ends. the belgian defender has impressed on the south coast this season. atletico's sporting director jose luis perez caminero says the defender will be returning to the club. oliver torres will also return to la liga once his loan at porto ends.
tom carroll was injured during england under 21s' 1-0 victory over czech republic on friday. the midfielder is on loan at swansea from tottenham. carroll has ankle ligament damage and faces up to six weeks on the sidelines. the 22-year-old midfielder has made 18 appearances for the swans this season.
franck ribery says he has no chance of playing against borussia dortmund this week. the bayern munich winger limped off against shakhtar donetsk with an injury last month. the french ace admits he 'can't even run' and hopes to be back for german cup quarter-finals.
philipp lahm has made a full recovery from a broken ankle. captain could make his first bundesliga start for bayern munich against borussia dortmund on saturday. pep guardiola will be without franck ribery, arjen robben, javi martinez and david alaba. defender alaba is likely to be out for the rest of the season with a knee injury.
burnley defender michael duff believes sean dyche could one day take charge of england. duff has backed his manager to be a top manager. dyche has improved burnley's fortunes since he took over at turf moor in october 2012. burnley host tottenham in the premier league on sunday.
roy hodgson confirms harry kane will be in gareth southgate's squad for european under 21 championships. tottenham striker made his senior england debut last week. mauricio pochettino has given kane his blessing to play in the tournament. kane is also set to travel to australia and malaysia this summer.
alvaro morata is happy at juventus and has no interest in joining real madrid, according to his agent beppe bozzo. the 22-year-old joined the italian giants for £15.8million last summer. morata started just three games in la liga for real last season. the forward signed a five-year deal at the juventus stadium and wants to continue his development.
more than 30 premiership and championship games are set to be affected by the long weekend disruption. all routes to and from london euston will be closed for maintenance work. labour accuses the government of failing to learn from boxing day chaos. the government has refused to step in to stop large parts of the rail network shut down.
brentford beat local rivals fulham 4-1 in the west london derby at craven cottage on saturday. mark warburton's side move up to fifth in the championship after the win. stuart dallas scored twice, with alan judge and jota also on target for the bees. fulham boss kit symons admits his side aren't yet safe from relegation.
sky sports and bt sport have announced the final set of televised premier league fixtures for the 2014-15 season. chelsea vs liverpool and manchester united vs arsenal will be shown live on may 10 and may 17. the tv schedule for the final day of the season will be announced at a later date.
the quick silver p-51d mustang was reconstructed from more than 200 parts by father-and-son team bill and scooter yoak. it is a tribute to american servicemen who have died in combat. originally built in 1945, the plane is flown by scooter at air shows around the country.
natal's dunas arena is being sold by owner grupo oas. the company is suffering from cash flow problems following a corruption scandal. grupo is also trying to sell the 50 percent share of the fonte nova arena in salvador. the world cup stadium in natal is up for sale.
13 democratic and republican u.s. senators have written to fifa calling for russia to be removed as host of the 2018 world cup. fa president sepp blatter announced russia as the host nation for the tournament. the fa are planning a bid to host eur 2028 but are unlikely to bid for 2026.
the helicopter came down on a house in the carapicuiba area of sao paulo killing five people. one of the victims was reportedly thomaz alckmin, son of the city governor. the aircraft came down in a residential neighborhood of the brazilian city. it is believed three mechanics and the pilot were also killed in the crash.

the renault 16 was the world’s first ever hatchback and was unveiled in april 1965. it was designed to help french farmers transport their sheep to market. now it accounts for two in every three cars sold in the uk and two thirds of all new cars in britain. the ford focus is the world's best selling hatchback as well as the best selling nameplate.
venezuela captain juan arango bit rival jesus zavala on the shoulder in the mexican league game. arango's side were losing 4-3 to monterrey when he bit the opponent. the tijuana midfielder apologised after the game and exchanged shirts. the referee did not take action against arango.

real madrid star cristiano ronaldo scored five goals against granada in 9-1 win at the bernabeu. his tally for the season is now 36 goals in la liga. he has scored more goals than 53 of the 98 teams in europe's top five leagues this season. nine teams in the premier league have fewer goals than him. the portuguese forward has now overtook lionel messi's record of 32 league goals.

christians across american observed good friday, which commemorates the crucifixion and death of jesus christ. 'way of the cross' walks took place in ohio, pennsylvania and over the brooklyn bridge to commemorate the events of the day. good fridays is observed as a national holiday in a number of countries and is not a government holiday in the united states.

residents of beckley club estates in dallas, texas, say that they saw a man approach a male peacock, who was in the middle of its mating ritual. the man grabbed the bird by both its claws before shoving it in his black chevy tahoe and driving off. peacocks have lived in the neighborhood for 20 years.
the male tortoise was trying to mate with a female at kiev zoo when it lost its balance and fell on its back. the tortoise had to spend 15 minutes crawling around in the mud before getting up. the hilarious moment was captured by ukranian photographer, vadym shevchenko.
farmer captured the moment a duckling groomed a lamb's woollen coat in a 'heartwarming sign of trust and friendship' the lamb was a lamb named winter and was enjoying the sunshine outside. the duckling began to peck away at the lamb's head and neck as it groomed its coat. the lamb’s owner said the pecking is a'sign of friendship' for the lamb.
the glass house was designed and built as a secret cold war bunker for government officials in the event of a nuclear attack. it took two years to renovate the property in chislehurst, south east london, and is now up for sale for £3.5million. the property boasts five bedrooms, a swimming pool, a games room, games room and a roof terrace. the bunker was built in 1951 and was abandoned after the cold war and fell into disrepair.

alliss, 84, has said legislation designed to stop golf clubs discriminating against female members has prompted a decline in women's membership. he claims ladies' golf union has lost 150,000 members since equality for women came in. but the union says there has only been a decline of 30,000 since the law came into force.

charllie sumner, 20, staged a one-man pitch invasion at reading's madejski stadium during fa cup quarter final replay last month. he did four front flips on the pitch, landing on his back each time, before being tackled by stewards. he is now facing a potential three-year ban for carrying out the stunt. sumner said he has no regrets and that his family had'seen the funny side' of the incident.

fifa chairman greg dyke was given a parmigiani watch as a gift at the world cup last summer. dyke initially refused to return the watch and promised to donate it to the fa's official charity partner, breast cancer care. after six months of legal wrangling, dyke has returned the watch.

john daniel tohill, 37, was last heard from by family in 2005 after he left nelson on the tasman bay to travel north. john's brother tobias received a call from john saying he would be visiting his family in coming weeks. john was missing for 10 years and had never left the country. his family has hired investigators and police but he called his brother this week.
youtube videos show four-month-old noah monte perfectly balancing on the palm of his father's hand as he's lifted through the air. noah apparently started performing the 'circus act' when he was just one-month old. as he whizzes up and down, the infant manages to keep his legs and body upright.
lucy garrod, 27, was left partially blind in her right eye after bacteria began growing underneath her contact lens. she had worn contact lenses for 12 years with no problems. woke up one day with an itchy and irritable right eye, the size of a golf ball. tests showed she had an ulcer known as a corneal abrasion, caused by a bacterial infection. miss garrod spent a week in hospital and was told she was still partially blind. feared she would not be able to complete her photography degree, but learned to take photographs with her left eye and passed with honours.
critters were filmed at indiana's indianapolis zoo after getting a makeshift backboard and hoop installed in their pen. however, instead of an even-surfaced court, they're forced to contend with the hilly floor of their enclosure. the zoo put on a range of final four activities ahead of tonight's ncaa championship game.
a video uploaded by youtube user shkesi shows a baby girl mesmerized by a toy mothering hen. as the motorized plush bird bounces up and down and pops out an egg. when the first egg emerges she cries for joy and with the third she lets out a shriek. the video clip has been watched more than one million times.
video maker captured the storm engulfing a bridge and then a river in siberia's third largest city, krasnoyarsk. the snowstorm moved at a speed of 45mph and engulfed the yenisei river in a matter of seconds. warm weather is thought to have caused the freak weather event.
fritz the golden retriever from california appears to lack any eye-mouth co-ordination skills. the pooch was filmed wearing bunny ears trying to catch a hard-boiled egg between his teeth. the egg narrowly misses his jaw, bounces off his chest and hits the grass instead.
loushanna and shawn craig had gone to tenerife for three-day holiday but her biometric id card was stolen. she was refused to fly home over fears she was an illegal immigrant. mother-of-four was marooned on the island for up to two weeks after returning home. mrs craig was meant to return to the uk on march 9 but only returned on march 24. she claims budget airline ryanair staff refused to let her fly home because she had the right documentation.

tv presenter lisa oldfield decided she had to make a change to tackle her weight after her son drew an unflattering portrait of her. the 40-year-old former channel 9 host said she barely recognised herself in the drawing. oldfield was motivated to lose weight by her two children, harry, 4, and bert, 2. she underwent liposuction surgery to remove 5.5 litres of fat from her body. the mum-of-two said she hated looking at pictures of herself due to the weight she gained since having children.

francis bakvis discovered a dead scrub python which contained the remains of his pet cat tiger. the 16-year-old cat tiger had been missing for three days. the three metre long snake was found in the yard of his home in clifton beach, northern queensland. the family pet was discovered in the stomach of a 3.5 metre long python.
celebrity chef momin hopur spent five hours cooking the camel at the apricot tourism festival in jining, northwest china. the roast was prepared by the fourth-generation grill master and took five days to build the special kiln. the camel was coated in a yellow marinade before being roasted in a six-metre-tall tandoor kiln . hopur is to transport 20 more camels to the festival to feed the crowd.

playing video games may not only improve the ability to perform visual tasks, but also the learning ability for those skills. research was carried out by scientists at brown university in rhode island. research found that gaming boosts the ability of people to learn a number of tasks more accurately. but the researchers note they are not quite sure if gaming makes people learn skills better.

jack johnson beat tommy burns to win the world heavyweight title in 1908. johnson was the first ever black world heavyweight champion. it took six years for white america to find a challenger to unseat johnson. jess willard defeated johnson over 26 rounds in april 1915.

lauren hill, 19, was diagnosed with dipg (diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma), a rare form of brain cancer with a survival rate of less than 10 percent during her senior year of high school. her doctor told her she would not live past december. she made it through a full season with mount st. joseph university's women's basketball team while raising more than $1.5 million for cancer research. hill has a new goal of raising $2.2 million for treatment and research.

the 5.45 acre estate in san clemente, california was bought by the former commander in chief in 1969. nixon entertained 17 heads of state at the home, which was built in 1926 and overlooks pacific ocean. he bought the home for $1.4million in 1969 and moved out in 1980. the house was then bought by political ally gavin s. herbert, the founder of the allergan pharmaceuticals company. it is now on sale for $75million.
newcastle host sunderland in the tyne-wear derby at st james' park on sunday. newcastle have lost the last four derbies at the stadium of light. ryan taylor says this could be his last derby. the 30-year-old has been a fan in the crowd during three of the last 4 defeats. taylor's current contract at newcastle is set to expire this summer.

the 18-year-old inmate was booked into lower buckeye jail in phoenix, arizona, two weeks ago. he was in a psychiatric ward area of the jail where he was not authorized to be. officers approached the inmate and told him to go back to his cell. the inmate attacked two officers, one of whom was taken to the intensive care unit with brain bleeding and broken bones in his face. the unidentified inmate was eventually subdued by a group of officers.

cape verde beat portugal 2-0 in a friendly on tuesday night. cape verde are a tiny island off the west coast of africa with a population of just 500,000 people. every member of the squad plays club football outside of the island. they are the smallest nation ever to play in the africa cup of nations. nani and henrik larsson are among the star players of capeverde.
swimmer was in the water in florida when she was filmed screaming out in horror as a manatee floated past. the girl was filmed by friends on a nearby boat as she begged for help to escape the harmless sea cow. the video was taken with the help of a selfie-stick by a friend of the girl.
chinese man, known only as xu, bought a wife for his son, who has learning difficulties. he was desperate for a grandchild and tried to impregnate her himself. after six months, he realised she was likely to be infertile and sold her to another family. xu is currently under arrest for human trafficking by police in eastern china.
radamel falcao has only scored four goals for manchester united this season. the colombian striker will consider his old trafford future at the end of this season . the striker has admitted to being upset by his lack of game time at the club. but he has scored three goals in two games for his country since the international break.

stephen john docherty, 66, pleaded guilty to wounding with intent when he appeared at in the whakatane district court. mr docherty hired the victim to complete concrete works at his property. he was agitated when he returned to find the work wasn’t carried out to his specifications. he told the contractor he would rip the man’s penis off. the victim's scrotum was torn and he required surgery after the attack.

treasurer joe hockey said the states had agreed to work toward applying the 10 per cent gst to movies and music downloaded from streaming services. it could reel in billions of dollars in revenue for the federal government. tech-savvy consumers might be able to avoid the tax by concealing their location through virtual private networks. each states and territories' treasurer has agreed to the tax.

analysts watch clips of beheadings, violent attacks and pornography to gain clues about terrorists. intelligence agencies employ psychiatrists and therapists to help the analysts cope with the emotional trauma. analysts watch graphic content and look at violent photos to gain information. the cia, nsa, and national counterterrorism center hire therapists to deal with analysts' trauma.

the broward state attorney's office has already dropped 12 felony cases, 19 criminal misdemeanor cases and one juvenile case connected to four former fort lauderdale police officers. jason holding, james wells and christopher sousa were fired in march for 'department misconduct' after an investigation into a racist video and text messages sent by the cops. all of the four officers committed misconduct involving racist texts 'exchanged among themselves and former police officers'   the officers sent each other 'racial, sexist and ethically inappropriate' images and other content, including offensive comments about black men.
jia binhui, 25, cannot afford hospital treatment and hopes his alternative treatment will fight the deadly disease. he built a human barbecue in his garden and lies on top of the coals. claims experts told him temperatures higher than 42 degrees celsius can kill cancer cells. he was diagnosed with blood cancer in 2013 and has had a bone marrow transplant.
kunaratnam kunanatha, 36, owned pizza plus fried chicken business in gillingham, medway. council inspectors found mouldy tomato puree and mouse droppings in the takeaway's pizza boxes. he admitted seven offences under food safety and hygiene regulations. the business was closed down by medway council and closed for good in may.

richie benaud has died aged 84 in a sydney hospice after battling skin cancer. the cricket commentator had been receiving radiation treatment for skin cancer since november. benaud died peacefully in his sleep overnight surrounded by his wife daphne and family members. a veteran of 63 test matches, benaud played a pivotal role in the formation of world series cricket in the 1970s.    he was one of the world's most recognised commentators and anchored the nine network's cricket coverage in australia for decades.
