aston villa beat liverpool 2-1 in the fa cup semi-final at wembley stadium. philippe coutinho and christian benteke scored for liverpool. tim sherwood's side reached the final to take on arsenal in may. jack grealish impressed on his debut for the england side.
barcelona midfielder xavi made his 148th champions league appearance against psg on tuesday night. iker casillas can equal xavi's total - all time and in the knockout phase - if he plays against atletico on wednesday night. real madrid goalkeeper can also draw level with the former spain international. xavi set the record for most appearances in the champions league knockout phase.
jose mourinho has started 20 of his settled back seven in 33 premier league games this season. mario balotelli failed to impress on his first start for liverpool against west brom. louis van gaal blamed a lack of sharpness for manchester united's defeat at everton. robert huth has played a major role in leicester's recent run of results.
watford beat brighton 2-0 at the amex on saturday to secure promotion back to the premier league. slavisa jokanovic's side will return to the top flight for the first time since the 2006-07 season. middlesbrough lost to norwich and norwich failed to win at craven cottage. players celebrate wildly on the team-bus as other results come through.
ea sports' new game ea sports rory mcilroy pga tour is due out on july 16 for xbox one and ps4. the game features various gameplay styles and enhanced ball physics. courses, such as tpc sawgrass, also affect how your shots are played.
steel gate at border field state park in california was unlocked by officials in honor of children's day, a mexican holiday that celebrates youngsters and family. many of the families were separated when relatives were deported to mexico after living in the u.s. without documentation. gate had only been opened to those affected once before, in 2013.
manchester city defender jason denayer has been on loan at celtic for a season. the 19-year-old is set to return to the etihad to fight for a first-team place. but celtics want him to spend a season in the english championship next season. john guidetti faces disciplinary action after singing an offensive song about rivals rangers.
f1 world champion was spotted on the rome set for the comedy sequel with olivia munn and ben stiller. hamilton is making his first live-action cameo on the big screen. he was seen in a scene with ben and owen wilson in a fashion show.
bridesmaids star chris o'dowd expressed his frustration with staff at gatwick airport. the actor's three-month-old son was frisked and his bottle was thrown out. incident occurred a day after he and his wife, dawn o'porter, attended an event in london. the 35-year-old actor posted the tweet on his verified twitter account.
some 43% of voters think ed miliband 'comes across as wanting to win the most' when compared to prime minister. but only 25% of people think he wants to win most, compared to 43% for cameron. more people think miliband is hungriest for a win and appears to be enjoying the campaign more than cameron .
karen danczuk said women were turned off politics because there was no-one in parliament like them. labour councillor said parliament needed people like her ‘to bring it back down to reality’    she said she had rebuilt her life after being ‘shattered’ as a child and had confidence to go into politics. she revealed earlier this year that she had suffered sexual abuse.
motherwell will go to battle with the spfl over free entry to the premiership play-offs for season-ticket holders. spfl are entitled to take 50 per cent of the gate proceeds but motherwell want to offer free tickets. motherwell general manager alan burrows told sportsmail his club will make a stand if they finish 11th.
london borough of barking and dagenham wants dog owners to submit a dna sample from the inside of their cheek. council wants to match dog mess to owners and issue a £80 fine. similar schemes in the us have reduced dog fouling by up to 90 per cent.
philip dunning 44, from bo'ness, west lothian, made the decision to give notice as shift manager at a food plant in the town. he went in for his 4am shift at caledonia produce the next day and told his boss he was quitting. he kept the winning ticket in his wallet during the shift.
real madrid host almeria at the bernabeu in la liga. james rodriguez opens the scoring for the hosts in the first half. cristiano ronaldo and javier hernandez come on for carlo ancelotti. both sets of players wear 'todos con nepal' t-shirts in support of the nepal victims.
football fan boyfriend made his girlfriend take a test quizzing her about his favourite football club. she scored 87 per cent and scored 43.5 out of 50 in the test. her boyfriend didn't dump her and commented 'well done saskia' after she scored a grade of 'a'   he was impressed with her knowledge and said she 'could have performed better on q17' and 'learned all player positions'
ousamn jatta, 45, married wife beryl, 88, in gambia 13 years ago and moved back to the uk with her. he took her to a care home while he went to africa for three weeks for respite. but when he returned he was not allowed to take her home with him by social services. mr jatta had threatened to go on hunger strike unless bristol city council hand over his wife.
ronald butcher left his entire £500,000 fortune to daniel sharp after he died in march 2013. mr butcher became friends with builder after he cleared his gutters for free six years before his death. his body was not discovered for almost two months after his death in enfield, north london. his family and friends insist that the will is invalid and that mr sharp is lying about his friendship with the builder.
indonesian attorney-general h.m. prasetyo said that 'all the shots were done perfectly' at the bali nine pair's execution. he applauded chan and sukumaran's executioners for the good job they did.    he dismissed australia's withdrawal of its ambassador as a'momentary reaction' to the executions. prime minister tony abbott slammed the executions as 'cruel and unnecessary' and withdrew its ambassador to indonesia.
g goncalo amaral had been on trial over claims he was involved in couple's daughter madeleine's disappearance. police chief claimed in a book and a documentary that couple were involved in her disappearance. he claimed    that the three-year-old had not been abducted, but had died in an accident in 2007. court ordered him to pay €250,000 (£179,000) each in damages and banned further sales of his book.
ronaldo brown has signed for oldham athletic after being released by liverpool. the 16-year-old is named after brazil's former striker ronaldo. he has a twin brother called rivaldo and a younger sister called trezeguet. the latics are currently in league one and play at boundary park.
lib dem minister danny alexander releases details of what he claims are secret plans to cut child benefit and child tax credits. prime minister 'flatly rejected' the plans, claiming they were drawn up by civil servants. mr cameron himself asked officials to examine ways to curb access to benefits. conservatives angrily denied the specific proposals set out in the document. lib dem leader nick clegg expressed outrage that the tories could not be 'bothered' to reveal plans. vince cable claims the tory party has a 'nasty streak' and warns of 'unfinished agenda'
rodrigo gularte, 42, asked 'am i being executed?' as he was being chained up to be executed. the convicted drug trafficker was confused about his fate and complained about hearing voices. father charlie burrows said he talked to gularte for an hour and a half late on tuesday night to prepare him for the executions. gularte was arrested in 2004 for attempting to smuggle six kilograms of cocaine into indonesia. the brazilian national was a paranoid schizophrenic who didn't realise he was executed until his last moments.
arshdeep kaur, 14, and her mother shinder, were travelling from home in punjab, northern india, to visit relatives. a group of men began harassing the pair on a bus and tried to'molest' them. when mother tried to stop bus, passengers and bus staff joined in the sexual assault. arshdeep died in hospital after being thrown off the bus and mother was seriously injured.
14 soldiers have been accused of abusing children as young as nine in exchange for food in central african republic. french president francois hollande has vowed to'show no mercy' if soldiers are found guilty. the french defence ministry has vehemently denied covering up the scandal. the investigation has been underway since last year but only made public yesterday.
ba van nguyen piloted a military helicopter on his own to save his family during the fall of saigon on april 30, 1975. he managed to fly a ch-47 chinook with his three young children and wife and wife to safety. he flew towards the uss kirk which was too small to land, and so he hoovered over as his family jumped out. he then flew back out to sea and jumped from the helicopter and managed to pilot the helicopter while getting out of his flight suit and jumping into the ocean just seconds before it crashed. nguyen was awarded an air medal for his bravery.
pema lama, 15, was pulled from the rubble of a guesthouse in kathmandu after he became 'pancaked' between two floors when the quake hit on saturday. his astonishing tale of survival came as a four-month-old baby was reunited with his mother after being rescued from rubble of his family home.
jeffrey okafor, 24, is accused of stabbing carl beatson-asiedu to death outside a nightclub in london in 2009. the 19-year-old was known as dj charmz and appeared in cbbc spy show mi high. court heard he confessed to his girlfriend before fleeing to nigeria on his brother's passport .
javier hernandez has scored five goals in his last six games for manchester united. but real madrid failed to activate their first option to buy the striker outright. the midnight deadline passed without madrid making a formal offer to buy him. west ham, southampton, newcastle and lazio are interested in the 26-year-old.
carl thompson, 32, has gained 30 stone in just three years and is now bed-bound at 65 stone.    he is too heavy to walk or wash himself and spends £200 a week on takeaways and online shopping. he was caught raiding his neighbours fridges when he was three and has always had a problem with food. after the death of his mother in 2012 he turned to food as a way of coping with his grief. he is now facing death unless he drastically changes his diet.
five-month-old sonit awal was asleep upstairs in the family home when the earthquake struck. he was saved from death by a cupboard that fell on top of him protecting him from the rubble. his mother rasmila awal, 35, could hear her baby crying from the wreckage of his flattened home. the baby boy was trapped under rubble for 22 hours before he was finally rescued. his parents and older sister were outside trying to free him with their bare hands.
liz clark, 34, from san diego, california, promised to document her travels on a cal 40 sailboat. she was given the boat by a retired professor who wanted to sail around the world. liz has travelled 25,000 nautical miles and documented her travels in a series of photos.
darren stanton has become the uk's top human leading human lie detector and body expert. appeared on itv's this morning and caught philip schofield and amanda holden fibbing. has background in psychology, micro expression training and neuro linguistic programming.
rangers manager stuart mccall has had to get used to his players being booed by supporters. lee mcculloch was booed for an error that led to a raith rovers goal last weekend. the rangers captain was the object of frustration from the ibrox stands. mccalls hopes lee will be the last player to get booed as a player.
ukip leader said he would accept the result and rejected claims his party would become'redundant' as a result. appeared on special question time-style programme filmed in birmingham today. claimed party could enjoy snp-style surge in support in the wake of a vote to remain in the eu. came after david cameron, ed miliband and nick clegg faced live-tv grilling over plans for five years in power. all three leaders insisted they would not give voters a say on european referendum.

scottish first minister talked up her chances of being westminster's king-maker following next week's election. ed miliband insists he would not do any deals with the snp - but a vote-by-vote deal is on the table. mr miliband said he would rather not be prime minister than make a deal with snp. but polls still point to another hung parliament after the election.
home secretary said new legislation was urgently needed to update powers of mi5 and gchq. based on current polling, parliament would be left deadlocked - with balance of power held by scottish nationalists. michael fallon said labour might be unable to renew trident nuclear deterrent if reliant on snp.
scientist bionerd has visited the chernobyl exclusion zone six times since the disaster 29 years ago. she measures the high levels of radiation in the area and uploads videos to her youtube channel. but she says she has exposed herself to more radiation swimming in the sea and visiting hospital - and is more likely to develop cancer from swimming.    she says the most scared she's felt was getting dangerously close to a rabid fox and walking by abandoned buildings. the area was devastated by a nuclear explosion at the power plant on april 26, 1986.
charlie patino, 11, and his family must weigh up offers from arsenal, chelsea and tottenham. the midfielder has been spotted at luton town's academy. he analyses spanish football and his style of play has been influenced by favourite team barcelona. charlie would cost £10,000 and is a season ticket holder at the club.
emma giffard, 36, and ollie halls, 37, from somerset, bought the mobile cinema for just £1,200 in 2005. they spent five years restoring it and spent years touring the country with it. it was rescued from a field in essex where it sat rotting in a field for 14 years. but now the couple want to sell it so they can concentrate on being parents to their two children. it's one of just seven mobile cinemas originally commissioned by the ministry of technology in 1967.

only nine per cent of germans now consider the end of the conflict a defeat - a 25 per cent drop in a decade. attitudes are reportedly changing among the younger generation. research carried out 70 years after hitler committed suicide in a bunker in berlin. germans think of themselves as the victims of hitler and his nazi regime.

research led by a scientist at the new jersey institute of technology has revealed the first high-resolution footage of a solar flux 'rope' on the sun. in the video, twisting groups of magnetic fields can be seen writhing around. solar flux ropes are common structures in the solar corona and are thought to be the main cause of solar flares and coronal mass ejections. it is hoped the study could help increase understanding on how they form - and how they cause space weather.
addison russell, 21, was batting for the chicago cubs in the seventh inning during his first game at wrigley field. he was trying to catch up to a fastball and accidentally let his bat slip out of his fingers. the bat went flying and struck a fan sitting several rows behind the cubs' on-deck circle in the face. the fan suffered 'wounds' but was conscious and communicative after being hit.   the rookie, 21-year-old said the bat 'just slipped' from his fingers and is batting.160 in six big league games.

floyd mayweather fights manny pacquiao in las vegas on may 2 but no tickets are on sale for the mega-fight. bob arum said tickets would be on sale in the first week of april. but 11 days before the fight, no one has a ticket in their hands. mayweather's promoter has blamed mayweather for the lack of tickets. the venue, mgm grand arena, says tickets are not yet available for purchase.
audi claims to have created the fuel of the future - diesel made from water and carbon dioxide. experts used renewable energy to convert the carbon dioxide and water into a form of crude oil known as 'blue crude'   audi has already begun using the new e-diesel to power the official car of german minister of education .
the revolutionary system is being commercialised by french company pixium vision, with clinical trials scheduled for 2016. electricity from a chip stimulates the nervous system to restore sight. the technology is based on a technique known as 'neuromodulation'   it claims it has been able to restore the sight of rats to a level equivalent to 20/250.
denim designer bettina liano is being pursued for almost $130,000 by the australian tax office. she cannot afford to pay the taxes withheld between march and december 2012. the denim designer relaunched her label last year after going into liquidation in 2013. she is the sister of real housewives of melbourne's gina.
patrick priebe created a working iron man-style arm and hand that fires beams from the back of the wrist or from the wearer's palm. the gadget was created by wuppertal-based inventor, who designs and builds metal laser gadgets. the laser glove can be fired continuously for up to three minutes. it was inspired by iron man, also known as tony stark. earlier this year, the same inventor built a laser weapon, inspired by the gatling gun.
chelsea are champions of the barclays premier league after winning the league title. manchester city and manchester united are likely to join chelsea in the champions league. bournemouth were crowned sky bet league one champions and automatic promotion to the vanarama conference.
the robots were originally created by british artist giles walker for a show called 'peepshow' and cost £2,500 to hire. they were made out of old car parts and are controlled by a computer. the robots were hired by dutch hosting company transip for an event in shoreditch.
packets of ‘beef masala’ were sent by pakistan as part of relief aid to nepal after april 25 earthquake. majority-hindu country treats cows as sacred and there is a blanket ban on slaughtering the animal. indian doctors at kathmandu’s bir hospital told mail that packets of the food were sent. the development has the potential to trigger diplomatic acrimony.
floyd mayweather faces manny pacquiao at the mgm grand on may 2 in las vegas. mayweather has defended his claim to be the best ever ahead of the mega-fight. there were no apologies for claiming to be greater than muhammad ali. but mayweather was soft-spoken on a conference call for the fight. he also showed sympathy for freddie roach's battle with parkinson's.
researchers from university college london subjected lithium-ion batteries to heat and used thermal imaging. copper inside the battery reached temperatures of at least 1,085°c (1,985°f), causing molten material to stream from the vent. li-ion battery cells are known to overheat and are vulnerable to a condition known as thermal runaway. the footage is the first time the failure of a battery due to overheating has been recorded.
fireball was captured on camera on sunday by the united kingdom meteor observing network in portadown, county armagh. experts believe rare and valuable pieces of meteorite may have fallen to earth from fireball. pieces could potentially be worth thousands of pounds and are believed to have landed in the irish sea. it comes after astronomers believe meteor triggered conversion of biblical figure paul.
photographer jessica fulford-dobson took pictures of young girls skateboarding in kabul, afghanistan. 40 per cent of skateistan's students are female, and skateboarding is the top sport for girls in the country. skateistan is a non-profit organization that aims to connect youth with education through skateboarding. most girls are not allowed to ride bicycles, but skateboarding isn't against the rules.
nasa has been testing a flexible wing on a plane in california. the wing can bend from -2 degrees up to 30 degrees. it means that regular flaps aren't needed - and it is much lighter. nasa has been testing a flexible wing  on a plane - and it could increase fuel efficiency up to 12 per cent, and reduce noise at take-off and landing.
ian merrett, 28, was accused of sexual harassment for wolf-whistling poppy smart, 23, every day for a month. marketing co-ordinator claimed she was harassed at worcester construction site. mr merrett said she should take it as a compliment and said she was 'lucky' to have received attention. he was jailed for 12 months in 2009 for affray and said he has'snogged loads of girls' in the past. miss smart filmed the whistles and asked west mercia police to investigate alleged sexual harassment. but he admits it was probably him and called her a'silly little girl' who should not have gone to police.

amanda oleander, 25, is one of the stars of periscope, twitter's new live broadcasting platform. she has been 'loved' over 7.5 million times in less than a month since it launched. she broadcasts live from her bedroom and has only been online for 29 days.
the eshima ohashi bridge in japan is the third largest of its kind in the world. the concrete road bridge spans a mile across lake nakaumi, linking the cities of matsue and sakaiminato. it rises sharply so ships can pass underneath and has a gradient of 6.1 per cent.
matthew selt fought back from 7-2 down to beat jimmy white 10-8 in qualifying in sheffield. white's bid to qualify for the world snooker championship ended on monday. six-time world champion steve davis also lost 10-1 to kurt maflin.
government’s listening post unlawfully intercepted telephone calls and emails from sami al-saadi, it has been ruled. gchq, the government's listening post, intercepted confidential conversations between dissident and his lawyer. the legally-privileged material was protected by strict rules. investigatory powers tribunal ordered spies to destroy two copies of the sensitive communications. mr al-saadi has fought a legal battle against the british government claiming it was complicit in kidnapping him.
celtic are interested in signing dundee united midfielder john souttar and striker nadir ciftci. jackie mcnamara's side sold stuart armstrong and gary mackay-steven to celtic on deadline day in january. united have won just three of their 14 games this season. the club are considering a second double raid for the pair.
two window cleaners working at a skyscraper in shanghai were blown around by high winds. incident occurred at the 91st floor of the 101-storey shan shanghai world financial centre. the platform was repeatedly slammed into the side of the building. luckily, the two workers only suffered minor injuries.
the research has been hailed a 'tour de force' by scientists at stanford university school of medicine. lab-engineered antibodies could eradicate not only primary tumours, but also distant metastases that have spread through the body. it raises hopes the body's immune system could be trained to attack melanoma, pancreatic, lung and breast cancer.
five men aged between 90 and 99 are among the first of 2,800 living veterans to receive france's highest honour. the legion d'honneur is awarded to those who played a vital role in the liberation of france. two were teenagers, one was a rookie tank driver and the last was a veteran of jungle warfare.
british artist johanna basford, 32, created one of the first colouring books for grown-ups in 2013. her book secret garden has sold over 1.5million copies since then. her second book enchanted forest has sold 226,000 copies in one month. enchanted forest reached number one on the uk amazon book chart at the start of april.
inverness reached the william hill scottish cup final with a 2-1 win over celtic . david raven scored a late extra-time winner to win the game at celtic park . john hughes' side will face falkirk in the final of the competition on may 30.    the standard of refereeing remains an ongoing embarrassment for celtics.
manny pacquiao has his own sitcom show me da manny and quiz show manny many prizes. the boxer is the people's champion in the philippines. he pays 64 per cent more tax than any other citizen in the country. his birthday is a national holiday and his fight with floyd mayweather has been declared a holiday.
chelsea beat manchester city 3-1 in the youth cup final at the etihad stadium. tammy abraham scored twice in the first half to put chelsea in the lead. dominic solanke scored late on to put a gloss on the scoreline for city.
marc albrighton opened the scoring for leicester in the 45th minute at the king power stadium. didier drogba equalised for chelsea after 48 minutes with a fine solo effort. john terry made it 2-1 to the visitors just after the hour mark with a close-range finish. ramires scored a stunning goal in the 83rd minute to make it 3-1 for the hosts at leicester.
terminal 1 at beijing international airport will cover 700,000 square metres, and is set to handle 45million passengers a year. opening in 2018, the gigantic terminal 1 will be the largest in the world. british-iraqi architect, zaha hadid, has collaborated with airport developers to create the design. the new terminal is designed to cope with the surge in chinese tourist numbers.
manchester city play chelsea in the first leg of the fa youth cup final at manchester city's academy stadium on monday night. the match kicks off at 7.45pm and the second leg takes place next monday at stamford bridge. manchester have twice lifted the youth cup in recent years.
the reddit thread focuses on brides from russia and the philippines and has so far garnered more than 10,000 comments. it asked users to spill the beans on what'surprised' them the most about their mail-order brides. many of the men ordered their brides because they struggled socially.
floyd mayweather and manny pacquiao face off in las vegas on saturday. the mega-fight is billed as the $300million fight of the century. pay-per-view figures for the bout are set to eclipse the highest grossing bouts to date. mike tyson features in four of the top 10 highest-grossing bouts of all-time. mayweather has featured in three of the ten highest-earning bouts.
bayern munich beat wolfsburg 1-0 at borussia monchengladbach in the bundesliga on sunday. max kruse scored a last-minute winner to secure the title for bayern. wolfsburg's nearest rivals were beaten 1- 0 at bourussia moencheng gladbach. pep guardiola's side have been crowned champions for the 25th time in the league.
heather mack, 19, avoided the death penalty after brutally killing her mother with the help of her boyfriend in bali in august. muyran sukumaran and andrew chan were executed on wednesday after they were convicted of trying to smuggle heroin from bali to australia in 2005. the two australians have spent the past decade on death row . the bali nine ringleaders spent 10 years in kerobokan prison working to reform themselves.
floyd mayweather jnr's personal chef quiana jeffries has helped the boxer with his strict organic food diet. the champ insists on eating organic food before his $300m mega-fight with manny pacquiao. chef q has revealed that mayweather's favourite food is fried hot dogs with barbecue sauce. but finding organic food stores in the early hours of the morning is difficult for chef q.
castello baronale, situated just 31 miles from rome, is a 12th century castle that was once used as a fortress by napoleon. the castle includes nine en-suite bedrooms, a ballroom, library, gym, gym and theatre. the property was owned by the barberini family for 400 years, until it was sacked by the french revolutionary troops.
celtic beat rangers 2-0 to win the glasgow cup at hampden park on tuesday evening. josh kerr and mark hill scored the goals for tommy mcintyre's side. rangers keeper robby mccrorie made two mistakes to hand celtic the win. it was the fourth time in eight seasons that celts have won the cup.
at least five women got into a large-scale brawl at a zara clothing store in philly's rittenhouse square neighborhood on friday afternoon. the women pulled hair, slapped, yanked each other's clothes and knocked over store displays. the police were called, but all of the women fled the scene. no arrests were made.

the tags belonged to world war ii veteran cpl. william benn, who lost them in 1939 at a coastal artillery placement on salisbury beach. metal detector enthusiast bill ladd found the dog tags after a storm last year and returned them to the vet's son.

brenna happy cloud of salem, oregon, found herself locked out of her facebook account last week. for five days she received the same message every time she attempted to log in. facebook's helpdesk asked for proof of identity and a copy of her social security card. happy cloud has accused facebook of discrimination after she was prevented from continuing to use her unusual name.

new drug oxaliplatin, carried out in combination with chemotherapy drugs, achieved almost complete remission in mice. each year in the uk around 41,000 men are diagnosed with prostate cancer and 11,000 die from the disease. there are currently few options for men with aggressive drug-resistant prostate cancer.

pilots give their insider tips on where passengers should sit to get the best views of their destination. sit on the right side of the plane for views of sydney harbour and cape town and table mountain. opt for a seat on the left side to see the grand canyon and bora bora.

the riot erupted in february 2012 when supporters of home team al-masry and cairo's al-ahly clashed. an appeals court ordered the retrial of 73 defendants last year after rejecting a lower court's verdict, which sentenced 21 people to death. the clashes sparked days of violent protests in cairo, which left 74 people dead. eleven of the fans were again sentenced to death today, with their verdicts referred to egypt's supreme court. the riot was the deadliest ever seen in egypt, when fans clashed with security forces and police.

andrew chan, then aged 21, and myuran sukumaran, 24, were the ringleaders of the infamous bali nine. both men were convicted of drug smuggling in 2005 after being caught trying to smuggle eight kilograms of heroin out of indonesia. they were both disillusioned by their jobs and believed they were stuck in dead-end jobs. the two men were attracted to drug smuggling by the promised riches and lifestyle of the gang.    chan was a university drop-out and the son of chinese immigrants who lived with his parents while working in a mail room. the death penalty has never left the table for both men.
scientists at haverford college in pennsylvania say they have spotted x-ray emissions consistent with thousands of white dwarf stars at the galaxy's centre. these are stars left behind after larger stars run out of fuel and die. but why there are so many of these stars remains a mystery. they are thought to be leaving a'mass grave' of white dwarfs near the centre of the milky way.

lucian faggiano bought the building in lecce, puglia in the south of italy and had planned to turn it into a trattoria. but his dream was put on hold when he discovered a toilet on the site was blocked. he and his sons dug a trench to find a blocked sewage pipe to fix it. the search for the pipe led to the discovery of a messapian tomb, a roman granary, a franciscan chapel and etchings from the knights templar. eight years after it was meant to open as a restaurant, the building has been turned into a museum.
bruno smartcan is said to be the first internet connected combined kitchen bin and vacuum cleaner. it uses sensors to detect when the lid opens or dirt is swept close to it. the bin can be used to activate its integrated vacuum to suck up dust and debris. it comes with an integrated bag dispenser and can send alerts to a smartphone. the bruno can run for 30 days on a single charge and comes in five colours.
the american chemical society in washington explained the science behind the avengers in a video. it looks at the composition of iron man's suit, super-healing abilities and captain america’s shield. the video also explains the science of tony stark's arc reactor and his own nuclear power station.
some owners of the apple watch have found that it malfunctions if worn on tattooed wrists. some dark, vibrant ink seems to cause the watch’s heart sensor to lose connection and give inaccurate readings. tests suggest tattoos in dark and solid colours interfere with the device the most. apple has yet to comment on the problem.
all three planets in the system orbit the star, hd 7924, at a distance closer than mercury orbits the sun. they have masses 7-8 times the mass of earth and orbits of 24 days. discovery shows the capabilities of the automated planet finder in california. it is hoped to help in the search for earth-like planets in other solar systems.

image shows one of saturn's outer moons, measuring 255 by 161 miles (410 by 260km) named hyperion. it is one of the largest bodies in the solar system known to be so irregular. it has a very low density for its size and is made up of water ice with only a small amount of rock. the moon's porous surface was captured by cassini as it performed a flyby of the satellite. during the flyby it unleashed a burst of charged particles towards the spacecraft.

everything that’s unpleasant about male behaviour is ascribed to testosterone. joe herbert explains that testosterone is at the heart of human life. having sex increases testosterone levels, as does watching porn and supporting a winning team. testosterone is also important for sexual behaviour in women, but as a metaphor for masculinity.

the usa freedom act would end the national security agency's collection of domestic phone records. senate majority leader mitch mcconnell, a republican, is trying to reauthorize the patriot act without changes. the measure faces an uncertain future in the senate. the bill was passed by a 25-2 vote by the house judiciary committee.
angelika graswald, 35, has been charged with second-degree murder in the death of her 46-year-old fiance vincent viafore. she was kayaking with him on the hudson river april 19 when his kayak capsized. initially, police believed she tried to help her fiance and fell into the water. she called 911 telling the dispatcher she had fallen out of her own kayak. prosecutors allege that she intentionally caused viafore's death - but they wouldn't say how. last monday, she asked friends on facebook to keep praying for her partner's safe return.

fossils from an extinct pygmy sperm whale that died seven million years ago have shed new light on the evolution of modern day whales. the remains, which were discovered in panama, indicate that the organ involved in sound generation and echolocation got smaller throughout the whale’s evolution. the fossils were found at a sea cliff along the caribbean coast of panama. the find will help experts fill in gaps in the evolution of cetaceans.
the messenger spacecraft is expected to smash into the planet's surface on thursday 30 april after a four-year mission. nasa has released an image taken by the probe's visual and infrared spectrometer. it reveals distinct features such as volcanic vents and fresh craters. messenger will pass behind mercury, and hidden from earth, after a final orbit.

the study says animals are most at risk in south america, australia, and new zealand. scientists from the university of connecticut warned that one in six species of animals are at risk of extinction. if future temperatures increase by only two degrees compared to pre-industrial levels, the extinction risk could increase to 16 per cent. marine animals near north america,. antarctica and new zealand are most likely to die out.
instagram users try to search for the aubergine, or eggplant, emoji hashtag no posts appear - even if there are posts tagged with it. it is believed to be because the emoji is commonly used to represent male genitalia. the emoji could be tagged onto images that contain nudity. but searches for emojis such as the gun and needle and syringe are allowed on the app.
some 1,200 people were stranded on the east grinstead to victoria train for up to five hours. 321 trains were delayed for a total of more than 600 hours after power failure at clapham junction station. at least 338 cancellations and 138 part cancellations were made across the network. british transport police officers began evacuating passengers to waiting buses at 10am.

nancy perry will no longer teach students at dublin middle school and will retire at the end of the year. perry is alleged to have told students that obama is a muslim and that any parent who support him couldn't be christian. a 12-year-old boy in perry's class brought the matter to the attention of his father, jimmie scott, who complained to the school. scott said he requested a parent-teacher conference, but nancy brought along her husband bill, who sits on the board of education.
the scientists say the experiment that what some people believe to be a ghostly presence is just a trick of the brain. artificial 'ghosts' have been conjured up by scientists in an experiment at the swiss federal institute of technology. by having signals mixed up in their brains, volunteers were made to feel that a creepy 'presence' was behind them.

greek researchers created the algorithm, which determines a person’s state of intoxication by looking at the temperature of their face - especially the forehead and nose. researchers from the university of patras took thermal infrared photographs of 41 volunteers’ faces, before and after drinking alcohol. they used artificial neural networks to compare the sober and drunken images pixel-by-pixel. temperature of the forehead is the best indication of a person's drunken state and could be used to recognise intoxication with 90% accuracy. the technology could one day be installed in cars to spot drink drivers and stop them starting the ignition.
how old do i look allows people to analyse any image found on bing or upload their own. allows users to search for celebrities - and see what microsoft thinks their real ages are. wrongly thought helen mirren, 69, was 55, and president obama is 53.

collection of pictures of christina o'gorman posing for her father, electrical engineer and photographer mervyn o' gorman, back in 1913 have been revealed as some of the earliest surviving colour photographs. the images were taken on the beach at lulworth cove, dorset, when malcolm was 42. they are on display at the national media museum, bradford, and are among the world's oldest surviving photographs.

dulwich picture gallery challenged public to'spot the fake' at the beginning of february. only 10 per cent of the 3,000 people who visited the gallery guessed correctly. only jean-honoré fragonard's 18th-century work young woman was replaced by a replica. replica was produced in china and ordered over the internet for £70. visitors were challenged to spot the replica among 270 old master paintings at the dulwich gallery. chief curator, xavier bray, said visitor numbers quadrupled after the experiment.

researchers at the university of washington studied the telerobot raven ii. they found that robots designed for surgery could be 'easily' hacked in to. this is because they are operated over public networks which allowed the researchers to access them and stop them working. experts were able to take control of a robot by exploiting a simple programming trick .

nagoya university and the university of tokyo in japan studied stone tools used by people in the early ahmarian culture 40,000 years ago. they found human tools were no more effective than neanderthal-created tools of the same era . researchers say the discovery means we may need to rethink the reasons humans survived neanderthals. traditionally, scientists believed innovation in weapons enabled humans to spread to europe.

the salt card is designed to end the tiresome task of manually unlocking a smartphone or tablet. it locks devices again as soon as a user moves out of range at a distance of 10 feet (three metres)   the credit card-sized gadget connects to an app on a user’s android handset or iphone via bluetooth. salt was created by joel paglione and niko zistakis from chicago, illinois. they claim it will save people around 53 hours over a year, based on the average phone user unlocking their phone 150 times a day. the card costs $20 (£13) and can be ordered from the company's website.

the rubber bowl in akron, ohio, was built in 1939 and it served as the home for the university of akron's football team for 68 years. the stadium hosted acts like the rolling stones, black sabbath, simon & garfunkel and van halen. it was closed in 2009 when the zips moved into infocision stadium and has sat empty ever since. the university purchased the title to the stadium for $1 in 1971.

ap mccoy rode his final ever ride at sandown on saturday. the 20-time champion jockey will be a spectator at the punchestown festival this week. he has a bucket list of things he wants to do after retiring from racing. the former jockey has challenged channel 4 presenter and tennis fan emma spencer to a match.
the cute calf had been taking a stroll through the bush with his mother at idube game reserve in south africa. when he rushed to catch up with her he appeared to get his leg caught in the grass. eventually he fell over and landed - trunk first - down in the mud.
peter scudamore rode 1,678 winners but ap mccoy has ridden more winners than any other jockey. the jockey retired on saturday after 20 straight jump jockey titles. ap has won his 4,000th winner at towcester in 2013. he has also won the conditional jockeys championship and bbc sports personality of the year.
the custom-built boeing 747 is believed to have cost a mystery billionaire £400million after it was customised to fit his specifications over a three-year period. the jumbo jet can hold up to 600 passengers - but this version was built for just a single tycoon. it contains bedrooms, a dining room, a state room and multiple lounges for the owner.
portland timbers defender liam ridgewell writes his second column for sportsmail with the 2015 major league soccer season well under way in the states. the 30-year-old discusses his family's visits to portland and coming up against orlando city's kaka. the timbers face seattle sounders on monday morning at 2:30am uk time.
the footage was captured on camera by a visitor to the abq biopark zoo in albuquerque. the youngster named jazmine approaches its mother rozie and starts clambering over her. the baby elephant then lunges forward with both its back legs and tramples all over the 22-year-old asian elephant.
alexia christian, 25, was killed by police after she allegedly opened fire on them while sitting in the back of a patrol car in downtown atlanta. the incident happened on thursday afternoon near the fulton county courthouse. police were investigating a call about a stolen car when the two officers took her into custody. at one point she fired at least two shots at the officers, and they returned fire, critically wounding her. she was taken to grady memorial hospital but died from her injuries.
lada's 4x4 niva is a robust and chunky car that has won fans around the world. it is available in a compact van format and costs £13,395 on the road. the land rover defender's demise could lead to a boom in sales of the lada niva.
alpha male kangaroo roger was gifted a soft toy bunny by a fan at the alice springs sanctuary in the northern territory. sanctuary manager chris barnes said he tried to take the bunny off roger but was met with hostility. roger is an alpha male at the sanctuary and is very protective of his women.
lacey mccarty, six-year-old phillip and five-month-old christopher swist were killed in palm bay, florida, on march 20. their mother, jessica mccarty, called 911 on herself and told police she'd killed her three children. she still faces three counts of first-degree murder for the incident. her partner chris swist, the father of the youngest child, christopher, had nicknames for all of the children and coached the two oldest in little league baseball. swist said he had a close bond with all three children and gave them all nicknames to go by.
hector morejon was shot by a long beach, california, police officer, who allegedly thought the 19-year-old was pointing a gun at him during a trespassing and vandalism incident. his mother, lucia morejon, was at home when she heard the shots. she went to an alley to see what happened and realized it was her son in an ambulance . he was shot dead by a police officer on thursday while in a vacant apartment.
the 79th masters takes place at augusta national golf club on sunday. sportsmail counts down the 20 greatest shots ever seen at the masters. phil mickelson's birdie putt on the 18th green in 2010 tops the list. arnold palmer was the first man to birdie both the final two holes to win the masters in 1960.
stella maxwell, 24, was born to irish parents stella maynes and maurice maxwell. she was born in belgium but now lives in los angeles and new york. was unveiled as one of ten new victoria's secret angels this week. loves to travel and spends her time with best friend barbara palvin and miley cyrus.
report claims freddie gray broke his neck when he fell head-first into the back of the police van as it was moving. it is believed he was standing in the van, bent over, with his head facing the door. police sources said gray's 'catastrophic' head injuries were consistent with hitting a bolt 'in the back door of the van'   it comes hours after baltimore police admitted the van transporting gray made a previously unreported stop. six officers have been suspended with pay over the incident on april 12.
fly captured on camera trying to get free of frozen beef steak after becoming stuck to the frozen food. the fly tries to set itself free by beating its legs and twisting its body to try and free itself. eventually the video maker intervenes and sets the fly free. the video was recorded in auckland, new zealand.
saige, five, from the us, has been living with her mother for five years. she tells her mother about the'mess' in the house and her brother's bad behaviour. she says she will move out and stay with her mum's best friend. her mother refuses to take the threat seriously and just laughs at her daughter.
shanghai circuit held the inaugural chinese grand prix in 2004 and has been home to the race since. the track is known for its challenging design and track layout. renault's fernando alonso won the first race at the track in 2006. jacques villeneuve and michael schumacher among the drivers to have driven at the circuit.
bahrain was the first country in the middle east to hold a formula one world championship grand prix. the inaugural bahrain race was held at the desert circuit of sakhir in 2004. sportsmail takes a look back at some of the best images from the inaugural race. jenson button and fernando alonso among the drivers to have won at the venue.
lewis hamilton won the bahrain grand prix to extend his lead in the formula one championship to 27 points. the briton claimed his third victory in four races so far this season. kimi raikkonen finished second with sebastian vettel and nico rosberg in third and fourth.
mark o'meara's hole-in-one is one of the greatest shots ever seen at the masters. billy joe patton's double-bogey on the 13th hole cost him victory in 1954. the 79th edition of the masters takes place at augusta national golf club on sunday. sportsmail counts down the 20 greatest shots of all time.
lewis hamilton won the chinese grand prix and extended his lead at the top of the drivers' championship to 13 points. nico rosberg finished second with sebastian vettel third in his ferrari. hamilton is now 13 points clear in the race for the title after three races.

family were at omaha's henry doorley zoo in nebraska when a little girl started beating her chest at a gorilla. the gorilla at the back of the enclosure was not amused and ran at the glass pane of glass. the glass cracked on impact - and the family fled to safety. the incident took place at the zoo yesterday at the start of the day.
bournemouth will not look to increase the capacity of their 12,000-seater goldsands stadium. premier league rules state clubs must give away fans 10 per cent of their overall allocation of tickets. manager eddie howe is reluctant to change the position of the away fans to behind the goal.

manchester united will have to wear nike kit during their summer tour of the us. club are expected to jet across the atlantic in july for a trip of around 12 days. but there is no buy-out clause in their existing deal with nike that runs until the end of july. louis van gaal has restricted the us tour to the west coast. united signed a world-record £750million deal with adidas for 10 years.

bon apetit have revealed the best way to revive a stale loaf of bread. it involves running it under water before baking it in the oven. the water turns to steam and rehydrates the bread and firms up the crust. but make sure to eat the bread the same day.

tim sherwood has to keep his emotions in check at white hart lane on saturday. the aston villa boss is a passionate man but he can’t afford to let things get personal. sherwood returns to face tottenham at villa park in the premier league. he is talented but has to be careful not to let his emotions get the better of him. les ferdinand told me tim needed a calming influence at spurs.
tony mccoy says the response to his retirement announcement has made his final months easier. the 20-times champion jockey announced his retirement in february. he has enjoyed a farewell tour up and down the country to say goodbye to fans. northern irishman said he thought he could retire quietly on his final day at sandown park.
leicester have won three successive games in the premier league. nigel pearson's side were bottom of the table at the end of march. the manager has managed to create a positive attitude in his squad. qpr and burnley have shown fantastic spirit. but sunderland and hull look paralysed by fear.
charles piutau rejected a new deal with the blues and nzru in favour of a season in belfast. nathan hughes was clumsy rather than reckless and didn't deserve a three-game ban. we are in the cost-cutting age of the world cup.
ap mccoy finished third in the final race of his career on box office at sandown park. the 40-year-old was presented with the champion jockey trophy after finishing third. the irish jockey finished his career with 4,358 winners in his illustrious career.    the jockey was joined by his wife channelle, daughter eve and son archie on his final day.
orlando city beat portland timbers 2-0 at providence park. former real madrid ace kaka and canadian international cyle larin scored for the hosts. kaka scored a second-half penalty to seal the win. it was orlando's second away win of the season.
adam gemili says usain bolt is a joker on the circuit and gives him great advice. the young british sprinter says bolt likes to make jokes of him. gemili is nowhere near bolt's standard at the moment but he could be his time soon.
british road to rio cyclist becky james has been out injured for a whole year. james is in her last week of rehab and is on the verge of returning to regular training. the british cyclist supported boyfriend george north during wales' six nations campaign.
ap mccoy has two rides at sandown on saturday before he retires from professional racing. the 20-time champion jockey will race for the last time at the racecourse. andrew thornton says it is 'like watching lionel messi' on a horse .
bournemouth's promotion means arsenal will start season in second place for the first time in 100 years. the gunners have started each season at the summit of england's top-flight since 1915/16. eddie howe's bournemouth promoted to the premier league on monday.
ap mccoy finished third on box office in last-ever race at sandown park on saturday night. the 20-time champion jockey was reduced to tears after finishing third in the bet365 handicap hurdle. the jocket predicted someone will ultimately break his multitude of records. mccoys described the final day of his career as 'the hardest day' of his life.
ap mccoy will end his 20th and final champion jockey's career at sandown on saturday. the 15-year-old jockey will be crowned champion after two decades at the top of his sport. exactly 25 years ago, ap left his home as an apprentice jockey at the stable of jim bolger. claire mccoy says she was 'heartbroken' when he left to go to bolger's academy.
ap mccoy will ride his last two races at sandown park racecourse on saturday. the 20-time champion jockey insists he will never return to professional racing after sunday's farewell. the 40-year-old rider has two final rides at the track. jockey has borrowed a phrase from great olympian sir steve redgrave. redgrave famously returned to success despite vowing never to return to action.
palermo president maurizio zamparini has slapped a €50million (£36m) price tag on paulo dybala. manchester united, chelsea, arsenal, inter milan, juventus and paris saint-germain are all interested. roberto mancini was spotted at palermo's game against parma on sunday.
samantha cameron, justine miliband and miriam clegg proved they are the ones who wear the trousers. samantha and justine marched out in almost identical uniforms.    sam cam put her best foot forward on the campaign trail in west london. she looked every inch the groomed and polished loyal conservative wife. justine resolutely wore the same outfit she wore last week.
74 passengers and seven crew members believed to be on board asiana airlines flight oz162 at hiroshima airport. it is believed to have made a tailstrike and skidded off the runway. local media report that the plane spun 180 degrees after impact and was facing the wrong way. the airport has been closed as a result of the crash.
olivier giroud believes arsenal will challenge chelsea for the premier league next season. the gunners forward admits he gets annoyed with people commenting on his slick appearance. arsene wenger's side drew 0-0 with chlsea at the emirates on sunday.
royal bank of scotland posted a £446million loss in the first three months of the year. it was forced to put aside £856million to cover lawsuits and fines still to be decided. chief executive ross mcewan warned of another 'tough year' for the state-backed bank.
arsenal drew 0-0 at chelsea in the premier league on sunday. theo walcott believes arsenal have been the 'best team in europe' in the second half of the season. the gunners could lift the title next season if everyone stays fit. walcott has struggled to maintain a first team place under arsene wenger.
thierry henry said arsenal need a 'top quality striker' to win the premier league next season. sky sports pundit questioned whether arsene wenger's side can win the title with olivier giroud. francis coquelin has defended team-mate giroud after criticism from henry. the french midfielder believes arsenal 'can win titles' with giroud as their main striker.
mario gomez scored the opening goal of the game in the 43rd minute to put fiorentina ahead. dynamo kiev's jeremain lens was sent off shortly before the interval for an apparent dive. substitute juan vargas came off the bench to score a late goal in the closing stages of the europa league clash. fiorentina qualified for the semi-finals of the competition.
chief medical officer dame sally davies has ordered a cost review into giving all under-fours free vitamin d supplements. she is concerned at rise in the number of children suffering from the condition. rickets is caused by a deficiency in vitamin d and is a scourge of victorian britain. the disease was virtually eradicated after the second world war but is returning. experts say it is due to a lack of sun exposure and overuse of sunscreen.
manchester city are interested in signing jack wilshere. the england international has been out of action since november with an ankle injury. manchester are looking to increase their homegrown quota at the etihad stadium. but arsenal boss arsene wenger has told manchester not to waste their time. wenger's side face burnley at burnley on saturday.
boliva’s cal orcko paleontological site is the result of tectonic activity, forcing earth upwards. the attraction, at fancesa limestone quarry in sucre, bolivia, comprises some 462 trails made up of 5,055 prints. the wall is the largest dinosaur trackway in the world, is approximately 390 feet (120 metres) tall and features tracks made by at least eight species of dinosaurs.
ravel morrison was released from his last contract at west ham following a series of disciplinary problems. the 22-year-old has signed a pre-contract agreement with lazio ahead of next season. morrison posted a picture of himself posing in his new lazio bathrobe on his instagram account.
the snaps of a cat playing with a mouse on a roof in shepton mallet, somerset, illustrate the perils the tiny rodents face in the town. the pictures were taken by the cat's owner jason bryant who confirmed the inevitable outcome of the game.
researchers from cornell university, ebay and the university of california plotted prices of goods listed on ebay. they found exact prices attract higher offers than round numbers. sellers who end their price with ‘00’ typically receive offers that are five to eight per cent lower than those with more specific prices. sellers with round numbers are more likely to sell quickly, but may not attract the best counter offers.
yevhen shakhov scored in the 82nd minute to earn dnipro a place in the europa league semi-finals. the ukrainian midfielder scored a late winner after 170 minutes of play. brugge had held to a 0-0 draw in the quarter-final clash at the dnepro-arena.
lee joon-seok had been ordered to serve 36 years in prison for negligence and abandoning passengers. but he was convicted of homicide by account of his 'willful negligence'    he fled the ship without making any evacuation order, as required by law. the sewol sank off the southwest coast on april 16 last year, killing 304 people.
lindy klim, yogi and instagram star sjana earp, former commonwealth games pole vaulter amanda bisk, and australian ballet star juliette burnett starred in the we are handsome activewear show at fashion week australia. the show was held at white city tennis club in sydney on tuesday night. the'models' modelled the brand's new activewear range.
defending champions sevilla beat zenit 2-1 on aggregate to reach the last four of the europa league. carlos bacca opened the scoring from the penalty spot after five minutes. salomon rondon and hulk scored for the hosts before hulk equalised for the visitors in the second half. kevin gameiro scored a late equaliser for the holders but it wasn't enough to send the game to extra time.
palaeontologists in china say the new dinosaur, named yi qi, had unusual bristle-like feathers and bat-like wings that were covered in a membrane. the dinosaur may have been able to glide and even flap . the fossil was discovered by a farmer in mutoudeng, china, 160 million years ago. the discovery has shed new light on the evolution of flight .
the visa restrictions index analyses countries ability to travel visa-free. finland, germany, sweden, the uk and the us are the top five countries for travel freedom. afghanistan, iraq, pakistan and somalia are the least restricted countries. citizens of iraq are barred from visiting 28 countries and can only visit 31.
jaysh al-islam - or army of islam - was formed when up to 60 rebel factions in syria merged to fight the syrian regime.    group reportedly command as many as 25,000 loyal fighters and is reportedly being funded by saudi arabia.  group claims it is the 'largest military parade witnessed' since the dawn of the revolution in 2011. its leaders and soldiers march in perfect unison at graduation ceremony for recruits in damascus.
serena williams beat carla suarez navarro 6-2 6-0 in the miami open final on saturday night. world no 1 claimed her eighth title in 14 years. serena dedicated the title to her father. the american won the final 10 games in a straight-sets victory.

leading data mining firm claims that between 20 to 50 social media accounts active in baltimore on monday were also used some 825 miles away in ferguson during peak of last summer's violence. experts have linked presence of 'professional protesters' or anarchists to both events. one account tweeted photos of freddie gray's funeral and used language anticipating monday's rioting. flier circulated online calling for a 'purge' prior to rioting and looting in the city.
a man smacked a wolf spider with a broom in hallett cove, south australia. hundreds of baby spiders came crawling out of the spider's body and spread across the kitchen floor. the house owner was shocked to see the baby spiders in the middle of the floor.
bird was spotted swimming in the grand union canal after apparently flying into london along the thames. puffin was spotted near the a4 flyover at brentford and handed to swan sanctuary to recuperate. more commonly seen in iceland and the north atlantic, the bird was given fish and wrapped in blanket.

charllie bothuell iv and monique dillard-bothuell took the stand against father and stepmother in court on tuesday. charlie, now 13, was found in basement of detroit townhouse last june after 11-day search. said he was often beaten with plastic pipe, forced to rise before dawn for workouts and isolated from other children. he attempted suicide in a bid to escape his parents' torture. hearing is meant to determine if charlie iv and his partner will face charges of torture and child abuse.

a newborn baby girl was found dead inside a garbage can outside the delta gamma theta sorority house at muskingum university campus last wednesday. it has now emerged the baby was born alive and then suffocated. the child's mother is a student at the school. it is the second time an abandoned baby has died at the university campus in eastern ohio. in 2002, the body of a baby boy was found in a dumpster and his mother served seven months in prison.
chad geyen of ramsey, minnesota was found dead on sunday of a self-inflicted gunshot wound. the 45-year-old married father of two was charged with multiple counts of sexual abuse against young boys. he had been accused of assaulting at least six boys hundreds of times, including his own foster son, between 1990 and 2013. all of the boys were under the age of 13 at the time of the alleged abuse. he was set to stand trial on five counts of first-degree and two counts of criminal sexual conduct.

fire departments were called to a fire  just west of grand valley state university in michigan after an april fools prank involving fireworks sent one apartment unit up in smoke. fire officials said one of the apartment building's residents threw a lit firework at a roommate; the firework landed in a laundry hamper, setting the contents on fire. no one was hurt and the girl is not expected to face charges.
military leaders in norway are growing concerned after three russian warships spent the winter docked in closed naval base. they are worried about presence on'strategically important' coastline and perceived show of strength from moscow. the olavsvern naval base has been closed since 2009 and is buried in mountainous terrain. experts have criticised the shutting down of the base which was once a heavily guarded military facility.

stephen mcdonald, of newcastle university business school, analysed pay-by-job system. he found car insurance costs have plunged for young dental nurses and social workers. but insurers have pushed up bills for young drivers who have male-dominated jobs. gender equality rules came into effect from december 2012.
delrea good of portage, indiana was charged with resisting arrest after she didn't immediately pull over for a cop on a dark county road. good was driving at 54 mph in a 35 mph zone and was speeding. she was driving by herself on the dark country road and didn't think it was a safe place to stop. good is a nurse with no criminal history and says she was arrested because she hit the brakes a half a mile down the road from the cop. good said the cop was enraged with her and charged her with a felony. good has no previous criminal record and says her lawyer is representing her free of charge because he feels her arrest was a 'travesty of
e customers will be able to pick up free portable chargers from shops to keep their phones charged. ee says 60 per cent of smartphone users found their battery would not last a full day. the chargers will be free to ee customers and other smartphone owners.
astronomers have used a telescope in new mexico to watch a star take shape over eight years. two images were taken 18 years apart, the first in 1996 and the other in 2014. the star is 300 times brighter and eight times bigger than our sun. the images show the change in shape of a hot wind from the star as it takes shape.
binge drinking as a teenager can cause long-lasting damage to the brain, putting young people at risk of anxiety disorders and alcoholism. alcohol causes changes in the dna in brain cells, causing changes in behaviour. but researchers discovered a cancer drug may be able to reverse the changes.
bill and hillary clinton spent $104,000 in taxpayer money on hotel rooms for secret service agents when they vacationed in the dominican republic over the new year's holiday. the power couple stayed with sugar barons alfy and pepe fanjul at casa de campo, a private dominican resort they own. new jersey sen. bob menendez and his wealthy donor dr. salomon melgen are both accused of corruption. the clintons spent the first part of their holiday at punta cana, a different resort, but later shifted to the same one. the former president and his wife were photographed at both resorts.

u.s. coffee giant is being probed by european commission over methods it used to lower tax bills. it paid just £1.9million in tax to dutch government, from a reported £300million profit. starbucks ran its europeans division through netherlands - including uk - but paid no tax on profits. it is now claimed the company may have used a british company to put money into the uk.

dash-cam footage shows red dodge durango hurtling at 60 mph towards the school bus in tulsa, oklahoma. 36 7th grade students on board were driving to school at 8.20am on monday. five of the pupils were hospitalized with minor injuries and 11 were treated at the scene. the 44-year-old driver of the suv, a man with a history of seizures, had to be cut out of the wreckage. he is in a serious condition in hospital.
steven allison, 37, was on the run for a year after being jailed for sexually assaulting two women. he fled to australia after failing to appear in court for the attacks. he was uploading pictures of himself in australian and writing about his former life in yorkshire. police and colleagues in australsia and canberra tracked him down through his facebook posts. allison was serving a 30 month jail sentence for the crimes and had been living in sydney, canberra.
some 5,000 people die from asbestos-related diseases each year, making it a bigger killer than road accidents. 20 tradespeople die each week as a result of past exposure to the substance. award-winning artist joe joiner, from east london, has created a moving art installation. over 50 families have contributed heartfelt messages to the installation. created as part of hse's beware asbestos campaign.

dan bilzerian was forced into making a short film about responsible gun ownership to avoid jail. he was arrested after being accused of placing homemade explosives in a tractor and shooting them. bureau of land management agreed not to jail him, but fined him $10,000 for making the film. he spoke from a desk in his lavish home, complete with gun candle holder and action figurine of himself. he warned people to 'be responsible' when shooting exploding targets and warned of the dangers of 'jail'    he has a following of 7million people on instagram where he is known for posting images of supermodels, cars, and wild parties.
teachers warn schools are struggling to cope with influx of children arriving unable to speak english. union conference heard schools are forced to use google translate to make lesson plans in other languages. english-speaking children are not getting their ‘fair share’ of attention from teachers. one in six primary school pupils do not have english as their first language.
barbaric terror group released photos show crates of chicken being set alight in a field near the city of aleppo. the meat was slaughtered according to islamic law and was perfectly fit for consumption. it is believed the chicken was destined for the thousands of starving refugees in war-torn syria. the food was burned after the jihadis noticed labels on the boxes suggested it was produced in the u.s.

kyle knox, 23, from london, was last seen at 10am on monday at the start of the route for the 4409-ft high ben nevis. he failed to return to his accommodation in the fort william area of the scottish highlands. officers believe he set off on the mountain alone, despite 70mph winds and rain. searches of the area were called off in darkness last night but have resumed today.
kansas republican gov. sam brownback signed the 'kansas unborn child protection from dismemberment abortion act' on tuesday. the law bans the so-called 'dilation and evacuation' procedure and redefines it as 'dismemberment abortions'   it takes effect july 1. the governor has signed at least 20 laws restricting the practice of abortion.

hagrid the lamb is thought to be the biggest ever lamb born in the uk, measuring 14inches tall and weighing 25lbs. he was born on tuesday at a farm in gelston near grantham in lincolnshire weighing the same as a toddler. the lamb was born naturally and his mother is making a good recovery. his owners believe he may be the largest lamb ever born at 25lbs at the farm.
lorraine bracco, 60, was originally asked by show creator david chase to play the role of carmela soprano in the sopranos. she turned down the role because she had already played a mobster's wife in goodfellas nine years earlier. she wanted to play dr. jennifer melfi, tony's psychiatrist. chase cast edie falco instead.

detective patrick cherry of the nypd's joint terrorism task force has lost his badge and gun and will be placed on modified duty. cherry was caught on video screaming at an uber driver after he tried to park his unmarked car in new york. the officer was in plainclothes and trying to park when the driver honked his horn. cherry pulled over the cab and launched a tirade at the driver, calling him a 'd***'   cherry was returning from a visit with his colleague detective harry hill, who had recently had a heart attack.
kevin bollaert, 28, was sentenced to 18 years in state prison after he was convicted of 21 counts of identity theft and six counts of extortion for running a'revenge porn' website. he charged victims to remove nude images and their personal information from the website. more than 10,000 images of women were posted on the site. some of the victims have now spoken out and said that they no longer feel ashamed of having the images posted. bollaart, from san diego, california, was charged with running the website and charged victims $250 to $350 to remove the images.

labour shadow chancellor unveiled poster claiming voters had lost £1,100 each due to tax and benefit changes under the coalition. but prime minister hailed today as'money-back monday' with raft of tax changes. predicted a conservative government would hike vat and cut top rate of tax for earnings over £150,000. mr cameron claims labour are planning to increase taxes by £3,028 on 'every working family'   but tory treasury minister david gauke hit back with accusation labour has a secret plan to boost revenues.
john chapple has captured all types of landscapes, including grassy fields in england, major us cities, and sandy beaches in australia. chapple, originally from north devon, first worked as a news and showbusiness photographer before he got into landscape photography. he uses a film camera to capture the images.
sen. rand paul will announce his candidacy for president on april 7 in louisville, kentucky. paul's father, former texas rep. ron paul, is a self-described libertarian who has a reputation for being out of touch with the gop. the only other major republican candidate so far is tea party darling sen. ted cruz, an evangelical christian who is already in the race. he will launch his campaign with the populist slogan 'defeat the washington machine'   paul has been criticized for softening some of his stances on foreign policy, and for trying to position himself as an 'outsider' to win over centrist republic
rspca inspectors were called after complaints from neighbours in lawrence weston, bristol. one horse was found living in an alleyway so narrow it could not turn around. the other was chained to the ground in a muddy garden at the side of a house. both horses have now been moved after a warning from the rspca.
two-bedroom terraced property in snodland, kent, was first rented by len and beatrice barnes in november 1915. couple raised their son and three daughters in the house before it was passed to freda when they died. it was put on the market for £164,500 and is used by five generations of the same family. howard knott, son of hilda, is now selling the house after his mother died in december.
andreas lubitz researched suicide methods and cockpit door security on tablet computer found at his apartment. second black box from germanwings flight was found in 'usable' condition and 'in good condition'    it was reported lubtz told doctors he was on sick leave rather than flying. he was prescribed anti-anxiety drug so strong doctors have to warn of risk of suicide.

hernandez, 25, has pleaded not guilty to shooting  odin lloyd five times in the chest and back in june 2013. the former new england patriots tight end was dating his fiancee's sister. the prosecution has rested after two months and more than 100 witnesses. the defense team is expected to wrap up quickly before the jury delivers a verdict.
