aid agency has been negotiating for a week to deliver life-saving supplies and equipment to yemen. hopes of getting aid into the country by tomorrow are fading as they seek clearance from saudi-led military coalition. coalition has conducted 11 days of air strikes against iran-backed shi'ite houthis. it is thought more than 500 people have been killed in two weeks of fighting in yemen - but the red cross has not been able to gain entry. pakistan is currently in talks about whether to enter the conflict - but country's political leaders are urging diplomacy.
marina lyons, 80, took dog rosie for surgery to remove her spleen after scan detected a suspected tumour. when she returned home she discovered bruising on the dog's back. vet told her it was from the operation and said it was caused by a heat pad. after taking dog for a second opinion she discovered third degree burns on her back. dog had to have treatment to remove dead skin from the burn.
shinto kanamara matsuri started as a small tradition but has grown into a popular a tourist attraction in kawasaki, japan. participants pray to a god of fertility, child birth and protection from sexually transmitted infections. the festival started nearly 40 years ago at the phallus-shaped kanayama shrine. participants carry phalluses of all different sizes through the streets of the city.
since monday, over-55s have been able to withdraw all or part of their pension pots instead of being forced to buy an annuity. pension firms said britons remained baffled about how the radical changes worked. many unaware of age restrictions or tax implications of the pension reforms. treasury pulled the plug on television adverts promoting government's pensions helpline.
sudheer khamitkar, 42, shot his 38-year-old wife, smita haval kham itkar, and their two sons arnav, 10 and arush, 6, at their home in tulsa, oklahoma. the bodies were found on wednesday as officers conducted a welfare check after the mother failed to show up for work or call in sick. police are still searching for a motive for the murder-suicide.
pm david cameron visited a primary school near bolton to unveil new tory education policy. he wants to see children who get poor sats results forced to resit them in secondary school. the prime minister shared a joke with six-year-old lucy howarth during a reading lesson. labour's shadow education secretary tristram hunt dismissed the proposal as 'desperate'   100,000 pupils would take a new test in english and maths during first year after leaving primary school.
'remediation costs' wiped out 61 per cent of banks' profits between 2011 and 2014. banks set aside £4.7billion to compensate customers and £2.3billion to pay fines for rigging foreign exchange markets. bill has been driven by payment protection insurance scandal. but uk's strengthening economy has driven 72 per cent drop in losses from bad loans.
david cameron was filmed at home with his family for an itv profile due to be aired tonight. prime minister is teased for appearing to confuse disney film frozen for a book. his wife samantha cameron told the itv show that the family often teased the prime minister over breakfast.
image was created by superimposing a blurry picture of marilyn monroe over a picture of albert einstein. at normal viewing distance, healthy eyes should be able to pick up the fine lines on einstein's face. but as the distance increases, the brain processes the image differently. hybrid optical illusions can be created by moving closer or farther away from the screen.
researcher says a 'bone flute' found in slovenia is not an instrument - instead, he says it is simply a bone chewed by a hyena with teeth marks. the bone was believed to be the oldest musical instrument discovered in europe. the cave bear femur was found in 1995 at the divje babe archaeological park. but new analysis says that many bones found in caves can simply be attributed to animals around 30,000 years ago, not neanderthals.
police in the southern state of santa catarina busted the gang's lair. the dog laid down alongside its owner and rolled over on its back. picture of the dog and gang members has since gone viral in brazil. police recovered a substantial quantity of cocaine and marijuana at the scene.
pelvic organ prolapse, or pop, occurs when tissue supporting the pelvic organs becomes weak. up to half of women are thought to suffer from the condition. many women are offered hysterectomy as the solution to a prolapse. a sacrohysteropexy is a half-hour keyhole procedure that uses an implanted mesh'sling' to hold the womb back in place. just 1,072 admissions for the surgery in the past three years.
researchers from london and edinburgh have developed a computer that can collate meteorological information and then produce forecasts. it uses a process known as 'natural language generation' (nlg)   it has the potential to one day be used in humanoid robots on our tv screens. if the project is successful a prototype system will be tested by generating local weather reports on the mailonline's website.
jennifer drew, 31, has saved £17,000 over three years by spending an hour a day searching for deals and coupons. mother-of-one estimates she saves £70 on her weekly shop by using coupons and money-saving websites. she once managed to buy a week's worth of food for 29p - and even bags items she doesn't need and gives them to friends. she has so many products and groceries that they fill a room of her house and garage.
self-made multi-millionaire bought three-bedroom glasgow townhouse after splitting from husband michael in december 2011. she paid £780,700 for the duplex off-plan in city's upmarket park circus area and moved into it in 2013. ms mone will now move back into five-bedroom mansion in thorntonhall, lanarkshire, after agreeing a deal with her ex-husband. she split from michael after 19-year marriage and has a £2million flat in mayfair.
protesters mounted admiralty arch, which joins trafalgar square with the mall, and called for others to join them. banners bearing housing messages were seen hanging from the grade-i listed building. garbled message posted on facebook simply calls for 'christmas lights... any and all radical/revolutionary messages'   group said they got into the building overnight by climbing through an unlocked window.
audrey dimitrew, 16, of virginia accepted a spot on the under-16 chantilly juniors club but was benched first two tournaments of the season. she was told by coaches she did not have the skills to compete with her team. audrey was offered a transfer to another club, nv premier, but the league said she could not transfer. she and her family have filed a lawsuit against the league, chesapeake region volleyball association, seeking for audrey to transfer teams.
the self-proclaimed kidnapper behind the gone girl abduction of denise huskins says he will turn himself in . this is the vallejo police department and spokesman lt. kenny park. he says his co-conspirators should be given immunity from prosecution. this comes one day after the group demanded an apology from the police for calling the entire incident a hoax. the group claimed they monitored huskins' boyfriend aaron quinn after the kidnapping so he would not go to police. they claim they drilled a hole in the window of huskins and quinn's home and used squirt guns to take her.

samantha giufre, 19, spent months in hospital after being dragged behind a car and left for dead in a gutter on september 7, 2014. she suffered multiple fractures to her skull and face, along with bleeding on her brain. samantha was dragged along the street in casula, south-west of sydney, after being abandoned in a street. one man has been charged in relation to the incident, basher hawchar, 18, but police are searching for others. ms gifre said her life has been 'destroyed' by the attack and she is now blind in one eye and has limited vision in the other.
defence minister gen nakatani told mps there has been no violation of japanese airspace by extra-terrestrials. he told parliament no government studies into alien invasions were under way. japan's war planes can be scrambled when there is a report of an unidentified flying object.

one of the most widespread 'food rules' may actually be a myth. the five-second rule has been cited to justify picking up food off the floor. experts say there's no such thing as a 'five second rule' and it's a myth . more than 4.1 million cases of food poisoning are diagnosed in australia every year. the food safety information council says dry foods are less hazardous than wet foods.
james schoenfeld, 63, was granted parole by the state board of parole hearings on the 20th time it considered the possibility of releasing him. he was one of three men who kidnapped 26 children and their bus driver ed ray in chowchilla, california in 1976. the kidnappers were inspired by the 1971 clint eastwood film dirty harry in which the antagonist kidnaps a school bus for ransom. schoenfield and his brother, richard, and a friend, fred woods, kidnapped the children and kept them 'buried alive' in an underground trailer while they negotiated a $5million ransom. all three men were sentenced to life in prison.

geraldine alcorn, 29, of pittsburgh, waived a preliminary hearing on a felony charge that she interfered with the girl's legal custody. prosecutors allege alcorn encrypted her phone number on the 11-year-old's math homework, exchanged thousands of text messages with her and even spoke of adopting her. alcorn resigned from her job at a local elementary school last month.
dark.cyanide goes by the name of a teenager who climbs up some of the city's tallest buildings to capture the perfect photograph. the 18-year-old describes himself as an 'urban historian' and scales skyscrapers without ropes or harnesses. he says the tallest building he has ever scaled was 72 storeys above street level. many of the vertigo-inducing images show his feet dangling hundreds of feet above the streets of manhattan.
genes for good is a facebook app designed to survey the health of millions of social network users. it was set up by biostatisticians from the university of michigan and is available for free to people aged over 18 in the us. users can also submit spit samples to tie their survey results to their genes. sending a spit sample is voluntary, and users only become eligible once they have completed 15 health surveys. the app is only currently open to people with a valid mailing address in the uk.
summer michelle hansen, 32, was sentenced on friday to three years in state prison and must also register as a sex offender for life. hansen entered a guilty plea in february to 16 felony counts related to sex acts with five male students. she was a special education teacher at centennial high school in california. if she had been convicted at trial, hansen would have faced 13 years in prison. parents of the victims were disappointed that the judge approved hansen's plea agreement, as she could have faced up to 13 years. the crimes took place between 2012 and 2013.
sydneysiders missed out on the lunar eclipse on saturday night due to wet and cloudy weather. the event was predicted to be one of the shortest lunar eclipses of the century. weather warnings were issued for brisbane, darwin, canberra and hobart. melbourne and adelaide residents had a spectacular view of the 'blood moon' as it lit up the sky. the eclipse began at 10.58pm and finished at 11pm.
louis jordan, 37, was picked up by a german-flagged ship off the north carolina coast on thursday. he was found sitting on the capsized hull of his sailboat, angel, 200 miles east of cape hatteras. he took off from a marina in south carolina on january 23 to go fishing . he survived by drinking rain water and eating raw fish and flour fried in oil. jordan was airlifted to a hospital with a broken collarbone and dehydration and was released on friday.

kennel club says seemingly harmless foods such as hot cross buns and onions can be killers. around 56,000 dogs were treated for poisoning by vets between 2010 and 2014. painkillers were the most common cause of poisoning, followed by rat and mouse bait and chocolate.

eu has been investigating us search engine for five years following complaints that it abuses dominance in europe. eu's top antitrust authority asks companies who have filed complaints to publish them. google could be fined up to ten per cent of annual revenues if found to have been behaving unfairly. proceedings have stalled on three previous occasions .

internet companies will have to reveal names, ip addresses and residential addresses of 4,726 people who uploaded the film the dallas buyers club online illegally. the identity of over 4,700 individuals will be provided to the copyright holder of the film. the federal court of australia ordered internet companies to reveal the ip addresses of account holders. justice nye perram did not signify any limit to the amount of damages that the film's copyright holder could claim.
saturday’s total lunar eclipse will be visible in the skies of north america, asia and australia. it was predicted in the bible and could hint at a world-changing event, according to one us pastor. the eclipse is the third in a series of four blood moons and will turn the moon red. but nasa says the change in hue is harmless.
french health chiefs say uk is responsible for sharp rise in number of youngsters who binge-drink. almost half of french 18 to 25-year-olds have consumed alcohol solely to get drunk. officials claim binge drinking is an 'anglo-saxon phenomenon' and is being copied by youths.
only ultra low emission vehicles and electric cars would be allowed in the uk in 2040 under proposal. lib dem leader nick clegg wants to tackle 'dangerous levels of air pollution' which cut average life expectancy by eight months. party announced a £100million 'prize' for car companies who build the first low emission vehicle.
the signs are needed as rising numbers of staff are subjected to swearing and physical attacks from pupils and their families. research from nasuwt union shows majority of teachers are verbally abused by pupils. 82 per cent of 3,500 members polled were verbally abused in the last 12 months, up from 52 per cent.
14 of the uk's top cake artists created the eggs as part of a feature for cake masters magazine. each egg measures 30cm high and is made from edible cake and sugar work. they were inspired by faberge's famous jewelled eggs and feature in this month's edition of the magazine.

diwalinen vankar, 58, went to wash clothes in the vishwamitri river in west india with her 19-year-old daughter kanta. a crocodile grabbed her leg and dragged her into the murky river. she tried to pull her free but the crocodile was too strong and dragged her into the water. it took her 10 minutes to fight off the 13ft crocodile by hitting it with a wooden washing paddle. kanta suffered a leg injury and was taken to hospital but survived the attack.

the queen arrived at sheffield cathedral for the traditional royal maundy service in a turquoise coat by stewart parvin. she was joined by the duke of edinburgh and prince philip. the then princess elizabeth was pictured at the service eighty years ago at westminster abbey in 1935. monarchs have been presenting alms since 1210 and the queen was eight when she first attended the service.
blue tit collected moss, grass and straw to line a nest in a damaged street light near copenhagen, denmark. the bird usually takes between one to two weeks to build a nest. jeanette rosenquist, 47, was on her way to work when she spotted the bird flying out of the lamp post.
pilots of qatar airways flight landed at birmingham airport on monday night after severe winds foiled two landing attempts at manchester. police were first called to birmingham after passengers started 'kicking off'   officers returned two hours later after reports that angry passengers were trying to disembark. some passengers claimed they had been waiting in the airport for up to 24 hours.
haley mulholland became suspicious husband kevin was having an affair after reading his facebook page. she put him on a lifelong sex ban until he admitted the truth. kevin took a lie detector test on the jeremy kyle show and admitted to cheating. haley and kevin still share a house but he has to sleep on the sofa. the mother-of-eight monitors her husband's movements, checks his phone and even smells his perfume.
dr milton wainwright claims he has new evidence of 'extra-terrestrial organisms' floating 25 miles (40km) above earth's stratosphere. he says the organisms test positive for dna, and have masses'six times bigger than the size limit of a particle'   his research has been widely dismissed by the scientific community as being backed by poor and flimsy evidence.
a new study says students on computer science and dentistry courses at british universities are less likely to have had sex. 11 percent of computer scientists currently in higher education haven't had sex . nine per cent of physicists declared that they were still virgins. art and sociology pupils were most likely to say they had had sex, with just one per cent. 22% of students didn't lose their virginity until they were 18 years old.

tong shao, 20, was found dead in her toyota camry on september 26 in iowa city. her body was found stuffed in the trunk of her car and police believe she had been in the car for three weeks. she was a chemical engineering student at iowa state university. her boyfriend, xiangnan li, 23, was listed as a person of interest in the case. he is believed to have been the last person to see her alive before she went missing. police say an arrest warrant has reportedly been issued for li, the boyfriend of tong shao. li bought a one-way ticket to china in the days after she was last seen alive
#a**holeparent has almost 4000 posts from parents all over the world exposing the 'awful' things parents do to their children. most of the photos show children crying over the small details of life. the hashtag is a spoof of the instagram hashtag #parentingfails.
the gilmore gas station was a backdrop for the shenanigans of steve martin and eddie murphy. it was abandoned in the 1990s and left to vandals and graffiti artists. coffee giant starbucks bought the garage in los angeles last year and have now turned it into a drive through coffee shop. opened in 1935, the building was listed as a cultural monument in 1992, but was abandoned.

inscriptions were found in naours - a two-hour drive north of paris - and left for posterity by young men facing the horror of trench warfare a few dozen miles away at the somme. photographer jeff gusky has tallied 1,821 individual names: 731 australians, 339 british, 55 americans and 662 others.
a 26-year-old employee at ceva logistics in michigan secretly delivered a baby in a bathroom stall at work, stuffed the newborn inside her bag and resumed her duties. staff at the international company had no idea she was pregnant until tuesday morning. the newborn baby was later pronounced dead. the unnamed mother was a temp worker at the company.
the hospital of dolls, or ospedale delle bambole, was built by the squatriti family 60 years ago in rome, italy. it was set up by federico and his mother gelsomina to restore dolls in need of repair. every member of federico's family has worked in the small shop, which is known as the doll hospital. some of the toys have been left to rot in the studio, while others are painstakingly restored.
scar booth offers a gallery of 77 wounds - purportedly real ones - which can be superimposes onto selfies. makers say 'friends and family will be convinced you have suffered a painful beating'   anti-violence charities have accused the app of'making a mockery' of abuse and 'glorifying violence'
45-year-old man underwent 27-hour operation at vall d'hebron hospital in barcelona to reconstruct his lower face and neck. doctors say it was the world's most complex face transplant to date and took a team of 45 medical staff to complete. the man, who did not want to be identified, is now living a normal life. he had suffered a condition called arteriovenous malformation for 20 years.
little foot was found in the 1990s in south africa and is 3.7 million years old. lived at roughly the same time as australopithecus prometheus and lucy. had gorilla-like facial features but upright and strong with powerful hands for climbing. was a member of the same species as modern apes.
the cable company complained to the better business bureau's national advertising division that the ads featured a number of false claims. the watchdog ruled that several of the campaign's claims couldn't be substantiated. the series of ads, which launched last october, featured 80s heartthrob rob lowe.
anthropologists from cambridge university and oxford brookes university say modern humans may have carried infectious diseases to europe as they migrated out of africa. neanderthals may have succumbed to diseases such as tuberculosis, typhoid and the common cold. modern humans are thought to have wiped out our prehistoric cousins 30,000 years ago. but new research suggests they may have been infected by modern humans' diseases.
clare hines was diagnosed with a brain tumour after suffering epileptic seizures for 10 years. she was told to have surgery to remove the benign tumour. one week before brain surgery she found out she was pregnant. doctors warned her to keep the baby and give birth to her son noah. ms hines suffered three seizures during labour and doctors had to perform an emergency caesarean. seven weeks after her son was born she underwent surgery to have the tumour removed. she has since returned to the uk to live with her family and raise her son.
pete evans has been dropped as the celebrity ambassador for popular salad chain, sumo salad. the food chain maintains that the decision was not related to evans' recent paleo controversies. evans announced his baby cookbook 'bubba yum yum: the paleo way' will be self-published this month. this comes after his paleo cookbook for infants was delayed due to fatal health concerns.
researchers in the us and italy say dna-like fragments may have come with 'instructions' that guided their growth into complex life forms 4 billion years ago. they believe primitive dna could have self-organised to form chemical chains. this could have led to life evolving into complex organisms.
trading standards officials in buckinghamshire and surrey raised the alarm over the chinese made decorations. eggs bear a striking similarity to the sugar-coated chocolate treats. they were 'likely to contravene food imitation safety rules'   the eggs have now been withdrawn nationwide ahead of the easter break.
rebecca eldemire, 21, was shot repeatedly in the face with a.357 magnum by her boyfriend, 27-year-old larry tipton, at her off-campus apartment in oxford, ohio on sunday morning. the day before her murder, she called police to her apartment to protect her from her ex-boyfriend. police officers left after she told them she was okay to handle the situation on her own. the next morning, her roommates called police and found her body in her bed and a suicide note from her boyfriend. larry tipton shot her twice and then turned the gun on himself.
james ramirez, 37, said he has concerns over the care of his wife gillian nelson, 34, who died after complications arose with birth of son wesley. he was called to princess royal university hospital in bromley, kent, at 3.45am after she had gone in to labour. miss nelson was 'delirious and spaced out' following the birth, according to her husband. she had multiple cardiac arrests and was taken to theatre for a hysterectomy.
almost all the highly secretive officials overseeing the day-to-day running of isis are former members of saddam hussein's baathist army. almost all of the regional commanders appointed by isis' leader abu bakr al-baghdadi played prominent roles in the late iraqi dictator's military before the 2003 invasion of iraq. the ex-baathists' connections with oil smugglers are crucial to the group's £2 billion-a-year income.
the dome-like hue go can be controlled wirelessly from any ios or android device via the philips hue app. lamp uses a rechargeable battery and offers up to three hours of continuous light after a 90-minute charge. it can also be used as a sleep aid and an alarm clock. lamp will cost $100 when it goes on sale in the us from june.
scott suggs, 28, and brandy kangas, 36, were arrested after police received anonymous tip about welfare of 17-month-old son and two daughters, aged three and four. children were locked in room in fredericksburg, virginia, and fed through homemade 'gate' for 24 hours a day. room was stained with human urine and feces and had gate through which children were fed. couple pleaded guilty to three counts of felony child neglect, but have been spared jail. both handed six-year suspended sentences, 10 years of 'good behavior' and supervised probation.
chiroractor gertrude pitkanen would sell newborn babies to adoptive parents for as little as $100 in butte, montana. the illicit market started in the 1920s and grew until the 1950s. many of the children who were given up for adoption are still looking for answers. they have formed a group called gertie's babies who are using dna to trace their biological families.   they believe there are many more people who were sold to the black market for the same price in montana .
huw davies, 34, has been searching for permanent employment for almost 13 years. he has a geography degree and three a-levels, but has not even been called for an interview. the geography graduate has applied for more than 500 jobs but has been unable to secure a job. he graduated from the university of glamorgan in 2002 with a bsc (hons) degree. the 34-year-old has moved three times to work, but all the jobs have been on short, fixed-term contracts.

faith and hope howie were dubbed the miracle twins when they were born on may 8 last year with one body and two faces. the conjoined twin sisters died after just 19 days. they were buried at pinegrove memorial park in sydney's west. their family and friends had built a small shrine at their gravesite. when they arrived on thursday to leave mementos and flowers they found the baby section of the gravesite completely bare. faith and hope's parents, simon howie and renee young, confronted staff from the cemetery and were told they had been told it would be cleaned.
3,118 unidentified applicants were accepted as freshmen by the university of florida in gainesville for the fall. they had sent in applications for traditional first-year slots at the public college. but accepted on condition they agreed to take online classes for a year. classes are part of a new program - the pathway to campus enrollment - which aims to accommodate a higher number of students. the students who were accepted to the university had not applied to the program.

more than 100 firefighters have been called to fight a six-alarm blaze at general electric's appliance park in louisville, kentucky. there were no known injuries in the fire, which started around 7am friday morning. up to 50 employees were in a non-production building at the facility, but friday was a company holiday. the cause of the fire is not yet known. residents around the facility were told to stay in a room with the least windows and shut off ventilation. hydrochloric acid particles were found in the smoke near the building, but not in the downwind plume.

scientists at the university of california have discovered a new type of virus that infects bacteria living deep below the ocean floor. the virus causes one of its own genes to mutate - allowing it to adapt to the harsh environment. they found the virus while exploring methane vents 2,800 feet beneath the surface of the ocean. the discovery of archae bacteria living beneath the earth's surface has raised the prospect of finding life on other planets.

women of ancient history had some fascinating methods for beautifying themselves. cleopatra bathed in donkey-milk baths and made her own cosmetics. mary queen of scots washed herself in white wine, while empress elisabeth of austria created her own face creams. the geishas of japan used rice flour to whiten their faces and cleansed with nightingale poop.

the u.s. economy added just 126,000 jobs in march, the fewest since december 2013 and the worst month since then. the unemployment rate remained at 5.5 per cent. manufacturing, building and government sectors all shed workers, while the retail, health care and financial services sectors all added jobs. the government revised down its estimate of job gains in february and january by 69,000.

scientists at the university of connecticut say we know how far away the source of a sound is by listening to the echoes it produces. in a study they found that the reverberation of sound helps us locate the distance of, for example, a car passing round a bend or a person nearby. the research was conducted by scientists from the university of connecticut. echoes and fluctuations in volume are the cues we use to figure out the distance between us and the noise.

oscar hübinette shredded through the snow on the tolbachik volcano on the kamchatka peninsula in russia. adventure photographer fredrik schenholm looked on in amazement as oscar flew down the icy slopes. lava from the 12,000 foot tall volcano bubbled furiously behind him. after lying dormant since 1976 the volcano suddenly erupted in november 2012.

zulkifli bin hir was a malaysian member of the al qaeda-linked jemaah islamiah militant group. he was killed in a raid in the philippines in january. the fbi said on wednesday that he was one of its'most wanted terrorists'   the reward offered by the us state department for his arrest was $5million. investigators had a difficult time confirming his death because he was killed in a gruesome raid.
daxing internet addiction treatment centre claims to have 'cured' 75 per cent of its 6,000 patients. it is run by doctor and colonel in the people's liberation army, tao ran. he believes internet addiction leads to brain problems similar to those from taking heroin. china's government said internet addiction affects 24 million of 632 million of its internet users.

gertrude weaver, 116, of camden, arkansas, became the world's oldest person on wednesday following the death of 117-year-old misao okawa in japan. she attributes her longevity to treating others well and exercising three times a week in her wheelchair. weaver wants president barack obama to attend her 117th birthday party because she has voted for him twice.

the first generation ipad was revealed by steve jobs in early 2010 and launched on 3 april 2010. at the time it was met with ridicule as experts struggled to see how it would be popular. five years and 225 million units later, but sales of the ipad have dropped 18 per cent. industry experts have predicted that the tablet device's days are numbered. but it seems many critics have been proved wrong - for now.
richard hutchinson, 40, from thornaby-on-tees, north yorkshire, has been jailed for two years for the attack. he punched his former friend in the jaw and knocked him unconscious in a betting shop. the victim was left with a fractured skull and bleed to the brain and needed 16 days in intensive care. married father  said he lashed out because the pair had fallen out over a debt of £300 and he wanted to'sort it out'   the pair were involved in a 'long-running' feud after he borrowed the money but had not paid it back and was still owing the victim £60.
it was previously thought that the woolly mammoth died out from post-ice age climate change and being hunted to extinction by early man. experts spent a decade analysing more than 23,500 mammoth bones from western europe and russia. almost 100 per cent of the bones found to be riddled with osteoporosis and lacking in calcium. deficiency in calcium resulted in mammoths breaking their bones and breaking their limbs and spines, leaving them unable to walk.

church of england's ambitious plans involve harnessing the energy of bath’s 45°c spring water to power a modern heating system for the abbey. engineers plan to tap the power of warm waste water from the roman bathing complex to heat bath abbey's underfloor heating system. the idea has been in the pipeline for years, but now excavation work has begun to determine whether it's possible to connect a modern system with an ancient hot spring. each day 850,000 litres of spring water is pumped through the great roman drain to heat water from bath's baths.
the 'finest' steam yacht in australia was designed in 1900 and built the following year. originally named ena, the historic steam yacht was designed by walter reeks more than a century ago. it is on the market for more than $1.2 million after having served in world war i and being salvaged after it sunk in 1981. the edwardian style yacht is one of only three that remains in the world today.

desert fairy circles are considered one of nature's greatest mysteries because no one knows how they form. found in namibia, they are large barren patches of earth ringed by short grass. researchers compared the distribution pattern of fairy circles and human skin cells. the majority of skin cells and fairy circles both had six 'neighbours', and similar percentages of other neighbours. the researchers suspect the patterns might be similar because both patterns are fighting for space.

lusitanian toadfish make five types of calls and males can even sing in choruses to attract mates . the fish live in rocky crevices in the mediterranean sea and atlantic ocean and can whistle, croak and grunt. scientists at ispa university institute in portugal found males make boatwhistles to warn off love rivals.    the fish woo females with long, rhythmical noises that sound like boat whistles, which also act as a deterrent to rivals.

gibbons produce soft 'hoo' calls that are similar to whispers and are almost inaudible to the human ear. scientists at the university of durham found gibbons use whisper calls to communicate specific information to each other about predators and foraging. gibbons are known for their loud songs that can travel for miles in the forests of thailand.

jordan waddingham scoured through bushland at karoola, north east of launceston in tasmania to find the world's largest european wasp nest. the 12-year-old boy followed a trail of wasps when he stumbled across the 90-kilogram nest. it took two days to unearth the nest and four men to carry it out of the bush. the nest is currently on display at the queen victoria museum and art gallery.

the red lady's remains were found in the el mirón cave in cantabria, spain. radiocarbon dating suggests she was buried 18,700 years ago. her grave provides the first evidence of an ancient magdalenian burial in the region. her remains were stained with a sparking red material, later found to be red ochre from a haematite crystal. an engraved tombstone was found nearby suggesting she was a person of status or authority and was buried to oversee her subjects.

for years medical experts have warned about the dangers of too much salt. as the federal government prepares its dietary guidelines for 2015, some scientists are now saying that the average american salt consumption rate carries no risk. both federal government regulations and the american heart association have for decades warned that excess salt contributes to the deaths of tens of thousands of americans each year. the average american ingests about 3,500 milligrams of salt per day.

scient scientist fergus simpson from university of barcelona has calculated the minimum size needed for intelligent life to survive. he applied a mathematical formula to assume aliens obey the same laws of conservation of energy as animals on earth. if they exist, he believes intelligent aliens typically weigh more than 650lbs (300kg) - around the size of a polar bear. but the calculations don't take into account an alien planet’s surface gravity.
the replica cave has been built near vallon-pont-d'arc in southern france and contains 1,000 painstakingly-reproduced drawings of 425 animals as well as around 450 bones. it is the biggest replica cave in the world and is built a few miles from the original cave. the caverne du pont-d’arc is the oldest cave decorated by man and is not open to the public. experts scanned the original drawings using 3d modelling techniques to create the replica. it contains images of 14 different species of cave bears, woolly rhinos, mammoths and more.

researchers at columbia university in new york say fear of spiders is a survival trait written into our dna. could date back to early human evolution in africa, where spiders with strong venom existed millions of years ago. the instinct could be one of the most crippling of phobias and dates back thousands of years.

a europe-wide survey of 19,000 people revealed the more a country paid to the unemployed or sick the more likely its residents were to want a job. in norway, which pays the highest benefits in europe, almost 80% of people wanted a job . the study also found that governments that intervene to help the unemployed find work made people more likely to say they wanted work.

exposure to the mould can cause mood swings, irrational anger and cognitive impairment. 'ghosts' tend to be sighted in old buildings, which are often more likely to have damp and mould problems. clarkson university researchers claim that older buildings where hauntings are usually reported, often have poor air quality from toxic mould.

the illume arclighter creates a ‘super high-intensity’ electrical arc and contains a rechargeable lithium-ion battery. its inventors, based in edmonton, canada, claim it is the first flameless gadget of its kind. instead of using a spark and fuel mechanism like traditional lighters, the device creates an arc between two ceramic electrodes. it lights in any direction and can be used to ignite candles, incense and paper. the device costs cad$40 (£21) via kickstarter and is expected to ship in november.

the bus and train lie abandoned in the great smokey mountains in north carolina after being used to film a scene from 1993 film the fugitive. the scene was filmed using a real train hitting a real bus and cost $1.5million to shoot. harrison ford's character dr richard kimble escapes from a prison transport moments before he is hit by the train. director andrew davis used 13 cameras to film the scene and three were destroyed in the process. the vehicles have since become a popular tourist attraction 23 years after the action scene was shot.

programmer martin bellander used free images from bbc, google art project and other sites to create the graphs. software extracts the colour information from images and plots it in a nice way. all colours except orange change from orange to blue over time. the graph shows a trend toward more blue paintings toward the end of the 20th century.

it's long been known that earthquakes and seismic activity contribute to making the earth ring like a bell. as ocean waves collide near the surface they create weak microseismic waves. these combine with long waves on the ocean's floor to create a constant hum. the hum can be as low as an e flat, 20 octaves below middle c on the musical scale. a french team found ocean waves colliding generate seismic activity, but it takes 13 seconds to complete a single oscillation. the largest hum coincided with a johanna storm in march 2008, and was caused by ocean waves.
number of muslims will increase at more than double the rate of the world's population, according to pew research center. religion's share of world’s population will equal christian share - at 32 per cent each - in 2070. by 2100 around one per cent more of the population will be muslim than christians. the largest proportion of the religion's followers will be in india. number of atheists, agnostics and those who are religiously unaffiliated will also decline.

not all identical twins are truly identical, some are'mirror image' twins and some are more alike than others.   twins share the same blood group, the same hormones and the same serum proteins. it's likely that they will have grown more identical over time as their identical dna asserts itself. twins are an endless source of fascination and fascination for many.

science writer and biologist dr joe hanson has calculated what the human body is in terms of chemical elements. a 'human molecule' might contain 375 million atoms of hydrogen, 132 million of oxygen and 85 million of carbon. the average adult human body contains around 16kg (35lbs) of carbon and enough oxygen to fill 6 elephants. dr hanson says his formula only represents the chemical make up of a human body at birth.

the strange formation was photographed by amateur astronomer gordon ewen using a telescope at the bottom of his garden in letchworth, hertfordshire. it is a sun spot, a formation of magnetic fields on the surface of the sun. sun spots range in size from 10 miles (16km) to 100,000 miles (160,000km) wide. the photograph of the chick-like sun spot was taken on march 10 at midday.
ile louët is perched in morlaix bay in brittany, france and is the perfect retreat for up to 10 guests costing just £145 for two nights. the island is a 19th century lighthouse keeper's cottage that was used by the lighthouse keepers from 1857 to the 1960s. the lighthouse island can be hired for the small sum of €200 (£145) for a two-night stay.
faris al-khori, 62, was found with a hoard of chemicals and bomb-making instructions at his flats in edinburgh. he had dozens of chemicals, poisonous materials, bolts and notes on how to make a bomb. items were discovered by chance during a fire in a rubbish chute at a block of flats. police found a small amount of a highly volatile explosive lead picrate in one of the jars. he pleaded guilty to a breach of the 1883 explosive substances act and was jailed for three years.
former great british bake off contestant, iain watters, is back to revive easter classic, the simnel cake. the irishman created a modern twist on the classic with pistachios, figs and nutmeg.    the cake is decorated with orange zest and edible rose petals.
britain struck oil in the falklands this week in a remote field of the islands. discovery could be worth billions of pounds and increase fears of renewed conflict with argentina. officials claim companies active there are acting 'illegally' in argentine territory. it comes on the 33rd anniversary of argentinian invasion of islands in 1982. defence secretary michael fallon has warned of a'very live threat' from the country.
in order to ensure maximum exposure for their new design lab collection, the company partnered with 50 of the most influential fashion bloggers and got each to post a photo of them wearing the same dress. the $88 paisley asymmetrical dress sold out almost immediately and created an online buzz for the range. lord & taylor has admitted it paid the bloggers to wear the dress.
eight animals are dead, including at least one alligator that once belonged to michael jackson, after a fire at the garold wayne interactive zoological park in oklahoma. authorities suspect an arsonist is to blame for the march 26 fire that destroyed two reptile enclosures and a video production studio at the park. only one of jackson's alligators escaped the blaze. joe schreibvogel, the founder of the zoo, said the fire was arson and most likely an attempt to cover up a burglary or theft. no one has been charged in the case.
rutgers university has banned fraternity and sorority house parties at its main campus for the rest of the spring semester after several alcohol-related problems this school year. a 19-year-old student caitlyn kovacs died of alcohol poisoning after attending a fraternity party in september. under the ban, the university's 86 recognized fraternities and sororities will be allowed to hold spring formals and other events where third-party vendors serve alcohol.

sokaze-ki q uses fluid dynamics to take air in at the rear of the device, move it through specially designed channels and blast it from the front via a turbofan. it is on sale in japan for ¥39,350 (£220) and is available in crystal red, champagne gold and pearl white. the fan is powered by a dc motor and can blow out seven times more air than it sucks in.

james weld stumped up £15,000 to end a three-year stand-off with natural england over access to durdle door beach. the steps to access the popular tourist attraction were washed away in storms in 2012 . mr weld says the government body'shirked' its duty to reinstate the steps under the coastal access act. he says the steps are part of the coastal path down to the beach on the jurassic coast of dorset.    natural englands claimed the steps did not form part of a coastal path and said they were not responsible for them.
jasmine midgley was born with a birthmark and her parents were told it was nothing to worry about. at 10 weeks old, it had started growing into her throat, almost closing over her airways and choking her. doctors told her parents she had bronchiolitis - a common infection of the airways . she was rushed back to hospital and diagnosed with a rare condition called a subglottic hemangioma . jasmine was treated with medication which shrunk the blood vessels over two weeks and doctors were surprised she survived.

two adjoining 'his and hers' mansions have gone on the market on the world-renowned sandbanks peninsula for £13million. the beachfront homes are virtually identical in every way, boasting an indoor swimming pool, four storeys and sea views. they are the latest in the so-called millionaires' row in poole, dorset, to go on market. one of the homes has five en-suite bedrooms and the other has an extra bedroom. the homes are built on a 3,000sqm plot and can be bought as a pair or separately.

the total eclipse of the moon was visible from western u.s., canada, australia and new zealand. it lasted only five minutes, making it the shortest eclipse of a century. it is the third in a series of four blood moons, the final one will be visible from europe on september 28.

hiv specialists and network security experts at university college london created a model of how the virus spreads. it accurately predicted patients' progression from hiv to aids in a major clinical trial. they say early treatment is key to staving off aids. model was inspired by similarities between hiv and computer worms.

cal calcium formations on ‘altamura man’ - a skeleton found in a cave in 1993 - suggest he was 128,000 to 187,000 years old. now researchers plan to sequence his dna to see if they can reveal new details about the evolution of our ancient ancestors.

photographer victor albert prout travelled along the river thames in a makeshift boat where he developed negatives in a dark room. the collection is the oldest documented record of the houses of parliament and windsor castle, dating back more than 150 years. the images are to be sold as a collection at the oxford book fair and are estimated to sell for £30,000.

ephedra foeminea waits for the full moon to bloom and produces a sugary droplet to attract pollinating insects. it is the only known plant species to respond to the lunar cycle and produces the droplets at night. researchers from stockholm university studied the plant for four years and found it secretes the sugary fluid to attract insects.

physicists have argued for 40 years that black holes suck in information and then evaporate without leaving clues. dejan stojkovic at the university at buffalo says information isn't lost once it enters a black hole. he says interactions between particles emitted by black holes can reveal information about what is inside. the research could solve the 'information loss paradox'

lhc is the world's largest atom-smashing machine and was shut down for two years to be upgraded. scientists hope it will be able to detect and describe dark matter for the first time. the machine is most famous for proving the existence of the higgs boson.

tampons absorb chemicals commonly used on toilet paper, laundry detergents and shampoos, which glow under uv light. they could be used to detect pipes that shunt sewage into streams instead of treatment plants. around five per cent of homes in the uk have pipes that are misconnected. tampons can glow in ultra-violet (uv) light, because they absorb chemicals found in products containing ‘optical brighteners’ which are used to whiten colours. experts think tampons could be a cheap solution to detecting pollutants in rivers.

the city dates back around 5,000 years and lies beneath the nevşehir fortress in turkey's otherworldly region of cappadocia. it is thought to be the biggest underground city in the region, consisting of 3.5 miles (7km) of tunnels, secret churches, tombs and safe havens. the city was built from volcanic ash rock and dates back to the byzantine era. it was discovered when builders saw signs of a network of tunnels while moving earth.

scientists used a new technique to reconstrcut the patterns on 28 fossilised cone snail shells that are up to 6.6 million years old. the shells are covered in streaks of orange, purple, blue and even large pokadots. scientists believe the shells include 13 entirely new species of cone snails. they were found under ultraviolet light to reveal traces of pigment still in the shells.

frida kahlo wrote passionate love letters to catalan artist jose bartoli from 1946 and 1949 while she was married to muralist diego rivera. the letters are expected to fetch upwards of $120,000 dollars at auction. 25 of the letters will be auctioned off at doyle new york on april 15. frida and jose met when she was recovering from surgery in new yorks and had a secret three-year romance. the archive of more than 100 pages was written in spanish between august 1946 and november 1949.

luo kun kun was expelled from his village when villagers signed a petition to banish him. the eight-year-old was diagnosed with hiv when he was five years old. he was forced to play alone in his home village and was described as a 'ticking time bomb'    he was refused admission to local schools and locals would avoid contact with him, so he spent his days playing in the woods alone. after being banished from village, he has now been admitted to a specialist school in linfen, china. the school is the only school in china equipped to look after and educate hiv-positive children.

six infrared cameras mounted around the f-35 lightning ii jet allow pilots to 'look through' the air-frame. all of the information - airspeed, altitude and warnings systems - is projected straight onto the helmet's visor. each custom-made helmet costs $400,000 and is millions more than the original budget due to development problems. the jet is considered one of the most complex pieces of weaponry ever and is programmed with 8 million lines of software.

'marine photic zone euxinia' took place in one of the oceans 200 million years ago. this is when surface waters become devoid of oxygen and are poisoned by hydrogen sulphide. scientists at the university of southampton fear that the planet today could suffer similar consequences caused by the burning of fossil fuels.

researchers at joint base lewis-mcchord looked at military records of 3.9million personnel who served after 9/11. found no direct link between deployment to a war zone and elevated suicide rates. suicide rates were similar regardless of whether or not servicemen and women were deployed to iraq or afghanistan. leaving the military significantly increased suicide risk. service members with a dishonorable discharge were about twice as likely to commit suicide as those who had an honorable separation.

the native australian marsupial once occupied more than 70 per cent of the australian mainland. now it’s disappeared from around 80 per cent with only small populations remaining in queensland, the northern territory and western australia. foxes and feral cats are the biggest threat to the bilby populations. the bilbies are an important part of the australians easter tradition and are often used in dream time stories.

va ciach, from geelong in victoria, suffered from sagittal synostosis - meaning the two plates at the front of her skull had fused together prematurely restricting the growth of her brain. five-year-old ava had to have her skull removed, smashed into pieces and put back together like a jigsaw puzzle. she had to undergo complex surgery at the royal children's hospital in melbourne. seven months after her surgery ava, now six, is 'a completely different child'
archivists at confectionery giant nestle have assembled the compendium of photographs dating back as far as the 1970s. the collection shows the evolution of the easter egg over the past 40 years. the tradition of easter eggs can be traced back to the years following the first world war when they were a symbol of new life and hope.

the girl in the spider's web, published worldwide on august 27, will be the fourth installment in best-selling trilogy by author stieg larsson. book was completed in november by david lagercrantz based on plot outline left by author. publishers have gone to extreme lengths to keep the novel under wraps. it is being written on computers with no internet connection to avoid leaks.
the mineral veins were found at a site called 'garden city' on the slopes of mount sharp. scientists believe the bizarre network of ridges formed in mars' wet past billions of years ago above the now eroded bedrock. curiosity rover is now exploring different layers of the red planet's surface for more clues to mars' watery past.

fighters from 100 nations – more than half the countries in the world – have joined militant groups. number of foreign fighters worldwide soared by 71 per cent between the middle of 2014 and march 2015. syria and iraq were by far the biggest destinations, with over 20,000 foreign fighters. report by the united nations warned foreign fighters could be scattered across the world.

the research vessel flip has been used by the us office for naval research for more than 50 years. the vessel is more than 355 feet long and is used to measure underwater acoustics. it has to be towed to a location where it 'flips' by 90 degrees. the rv flip is used for oceanography, meteorology and marine mammal observation.

developers at open garden have built greenstone to help messages move around wireless mesh networks. the egg-shaped gadget acts like a beacon, or booster, to act as a beacon for messages. it takes advantage of a feature in apple’s ios 7 called multipeer connectivity framework. firechat app has been downloaded more than five million times and can be used to send messages. greenstone is currently in development and only works at a range of 20ft (61 metres)

developers in boston have worked with global emergency response teams to create its one-touch-911 app. users can call the police, fire service, report a car crash or seek medical help at the press of a button. each call is placed with the phone's gps location, user details and any medical information. the app can be used in 135 countries, and is compatible with any three-digit emergency number. rapidsos will begin testing the software in texas next month and has launched a campaign to launch the app globally.

the ring, located 12 billion light years away, is an illusion created by the chance alignment of two distant galaxies. it is a rare manifestation of gravitational lensing predicted by albert einstein in his theory of general relativity. the alma telescope in chile captured the effect in the highest resolution images ever taken by the observatory.

scientists believe the first complex conversation between humans took place around 50,000 to 100,000 years ago. much of it involved cavemen grunting, or hunter-gatherers mumbling and pointing. shigeru miyagawa at massachusetts institute of technology says human language developed rapidly with people quickly using complex sentences that sound like our own. most scholars believe that humans first started using a 'proto-language'    single words bear traces of syntax showing they must be descended from an older, syntax-laden system.

a university of nebraska researcher has revealed why stress is bad for you in a video. limited periods of stress are good, as they release the hormone cortisol. but too much will lower your immune system and make your bones fragile. the science of stress was explained by dr raychelle burks from the university ofnebraska-lincoln.
pet aquarium fish are being dumped in rivers in western australia. at least 13 species of fish have been introduced into the region's waterways. goldfish weigh up to 2kg and koi carp up to one metre in length. introduced species are also bringing exotic parasites and disease with them. pet owners are believed to be the biggest culprits behind the invasion.
animal liberation victoria activists broke into wagner's poultry farm in coldstream, victoria, in march. they found hens in 'deformed, sick and dying' conditions at the yarra valley farm. government health officials inspected the farm two weeks earlier and gave it the all clear. but the owner of the farm has denied claims the hens were not being cared for properly.

angela postle, from maroochydore in southeast queensland, stumbled upon the bizarre spectacle last month. oranges turned an inexplicable hue of purple in her house. the mother-of-five sent the fruit to queensland environmental health branch for testing. the first round of scientific tests have failed to explain the strange phenomenon. ms postle sent the oranges back to the supermarket and was offered a refund. she has sent a second round of tests to a laboratory for further analysis.

the latest huge land mass is 1.5 square miles (four square kilometres) in size and was created by dumping sand on live coral reefs. five islands have already been made, with two more in development. china has supposedly been carrying out the land reclamation in order to build airstrips and other structures in the south china sea. experts have told mailonline that the activities could be hugely damaging to local ecosystems.
erica ann ginneti, 35, a married mother of three from philadelphia, pennsylvania, has been sentenced to 30 days in jail, house arrest and probation for having sex with a 17-year-old student. she pleaded guilty in december to institutional sexual assault and disseminating sexually explicit materials to a minor. erica ginnetti, a math and calculus teacher at lower moreland township school district, had been facing seven to 14 years in prison. she will have to perform community service and register as a sex offender. the former teacher first met her victim at his prom in may 2013 and the two had sex in her car.
campaign chiefs attempted to rebuff a letter from 100 business leaders calling for a labour government. but one of the signatories was convicted of benefit fraud in 2012. she claimed £27,888 tax credits in two and a half years as a single person. labour removed her name after it was revealed she had been convicted of fraud. other signatories included a benefit fraudster, trade unionists and cigar-smoking children of millionaires.
mercury is set to rise steadily until friday, when southern parts of england are forecast to hit 21c (70f) or higher - the hottest day of the year so far. forecasters say a band of high pressure will keep conditions settled until late on friday - when april showers could return. temperatures hit 20.7c (69f) in aboyne, aberdeenshire, over the bank holiday weekend.
drek lowe, 38, and tina lowe,. 33, were struck and killed by an amtrak train shortly before 10am on sunday in durham, north carolina. train was headed from charlotte to new york city when accident occurred. none of the 166 passengers on the train were injured, although a man fell ill during the delay.
around 75 people were inside the korean union united methodist church in rahway when the ceiling collapsed. thirteen people had minor injuries and one woman suffered a serious head laceration. one woman was sent to the trauma center at university hospital with a serious but non-life threatening head injury.
cody neatis, eight, was admitted to royal preston hospital with a chest infection and has been in hospital for a week. he has down's syndrome, epilepsy, autism and is fed by a tube. but the hospital doesn't have a suitable bed for him to sleep in and he has to sleep on a mattress on the floor. cody's mother lynne, 48, has had to sleep with him on the mattress in case he hurts himself in the night. she says she has been battling the hospital for two years for a special bed for cody to stay in.

robert clark, 96, was a prisoner of war and survived the nazi 'death march'   brent council refused to increase funding for a live-in carer for war veteran. more than 127,000 people have signed a petition calling for him to stay in his home. but despite his war record, the council insists he cannot be treated as a special case.
martin vargic used satellite data to chart how the constellation stars have shifted and will change in the future. he estimated how the constellations will change from 50,000 bc to 100,000ce using data from the european space agency. many of the most distinctive stars will become almost unrecognisable in the next 98,000 years. some may need to be renamed entirely.
hernando rivera cervantes captured the images as the colima volcano in mexico erupted. he spent eight hours waiting to capture the images of the lightning bolts as it erupted. lightning strikes are thought to occur due to the build up of electric charge in the ash cloud. the volcano is one of the most active volcanoes in the country and is known for its explosive eruptions.
many oversubscribed schools reject non-churchgoing families even though they live nearby. many christian schools give priority to families who regularly attend services. but group of vicars say system is open to abuse and discriminates against the poor. clergymen say affluent parents are more likely to cheat the system by going to church to get children into a c of e school. alliance of left-leaning clergy and laypeople called for an end to religious selection in open letter. claimed the church was being ‘turned to the advantage of those who are already advantaged’   the comments sparked anger from the church of england, which labelled their arguments 'doctrinaire'
european space agency's asteroid impact mission will send a lander crashing into asteroid's moon at 14,000mph. experts hope the impact will be large enough to alter its orbit. it will be the first investigation of planetary defence techniques. mission will take place in two parts, and will be launched in 2020.

2,000-year practice of traditional chinese medicine is the main catalyst behind the world's third-largest illicit trade of exotic animal parts. illegal wildlife trade is the driving force behind the $20 billion (£13bn) illegal wildlife network. markets in guangzhou, south china, stock exotic and rare animals, many of which are endangered.
liquid is called shear-thickening fluid (stf), and instantly hardens upon impact at any temperature. provides protection from penetration by high-speed projectiles and dispersing energy over a larger area. researchers have already tested the material in existing body armour designs.
paul childs is running in the liverpool riverside seat and said he was diagnosed with the virus in 2011. air steward said he burst into tears when he was told he was hiv positive after a routine test. he revealed he was infuriated by nigel farage's'scaremongering' over foreigners with the condition. mr childs said he is the second liberal democrat parliamentary candidate to reveal he is hivpositive. adrian hyyrylainen-trett, who is running for the lib dems in vauxhall, is the first to go public.
hayley okines became well-known three years ago when she was part of a documentary about progeria. she suffered from the rare disease progeria which ages the body at eight times the normal rate. patients normally die from heart attacks or strokes at an average age of 13. but hayley defied the odds to live four more years and even published an autobiography about living with the disease. she died at home last night after being discharged from hospital with pneumonia.

dr lara briden is a naturopathic doctor with 20 years experience in women's health. she says that premenstrual symptoms such as irritability, cravings and fatigue are not normal. the doctor says that pms can be banished for good by adapting an anti-inflammatory diet. dr briden says pms is caused by chronic inflammation and is not a myth.
anthony clark reed was driving around detroit, michigan, on monday night when he was pulled over. 24-year-old nursing student was handcuffed despite complaining he had trouble breathing. he suffered a heart attack and was taken to hospital, where he died. his father, pastor kevin clark, claims detroit police were indirectly responsible for his death. he is planning to sue police for their role in his son's death.

temperatures reached 17.5°c on the northern tip of the antarctic peninsula last week. this is the highest temperature ever recorded on the coldest place on earth. the previous record was set in 1961 when the temperature reached 17.1°c. however, climate scientists are urging caution about the new record. the new temperature was measured by sensors at argentina's esperanza base.
brian gemmell said mi5 spy chiefs ordered him to ‘stop digging’ when he reported possible paedophile ring at northern ireland children’s’ home. former captain in the intelligence corps said he was one of three youngsters trafficked from the home. he claimed he was molested by ‘very powerful’ figures in a westminster paedophile gang. mi5 has faced allegations of covering up child abuse to gather intelligence on loyalist politicians.
julie merner, 39, has been admitted to hospital 13 times in the last six years. mother-of-three suffers severe liver cirrhosis and has been left with jaundiced skin. she vowed to quit her habit after her latest hospital stay in january. not a drop of alcohol has passed ms merner's lips since - her longest spell of abstinence. she began drinking heavily 10 years ago, drinking a bottle of vodka a day.

dylan miller, a senior studying english and philosophy at juniata college decided to live in a hut for a research project on simple living. he built the hut out of fallen trees, leaves, rope and a tarp since september. there is no plumbing or electricity in the structure, which is about a half-hour walk from campus in huntingdon, pennsylvania. miller has spent the last eight months studying by lantern and chasing away the occasional bear. he hopes living in the hut will teach him about living simply.
sydney’s dwelling values rose by 5.8 per cent in the last quarter bringing the average median house price to $690,000. it's the strongest increase since april in 2009 and a record for the harbour city. canberra surprisingly performed second best with a 4.1 per cent increase in dwelling values. the national dwelling value rose by 3 per cent, despite brisbane, adelaide and perth suffering declines. the median house prices across the combined capital cities is now $530,000, with sydney being the only city to surpass the figure.
two 17-year-old boys from dewsbury, west yorkshire, are believed to have fled to syria to join isis militants. one of the boys is believed to be a relative of hammaad munshi, britain's youngest convicted terrorist. he was found guilty of terror offences at the age of 18 in 2008 and jailed for two years. the pair have not been in contact with their families for several days and cannot be reached.
in britain more than 90 million easter eggs are consumed every year. femail picks the most unusual eggs to try this easter. the marmite easter egg is made with marmite and marmite cashew nuts. fortnum & mason's is the world's first gourmet chocolate scotch egg. godiva's alter eggo and hotel chocolat's chocolate egg sandwich are also on the list.
spanish expert, dr celia sanchez-ramos, has found led screens can harm the retina - the light-sensitive layer at the back of the eye. modern led screens emit up to five times as much blue light as older technology. it can permanently damage the retina and may even lead to partial blindness. in extreme cases, it may even cause macular degeneration - dark patches in the field of vision.
group of british companies found oil and gas in a remote field north of the islands after nine months of drilling. discovery could be worth billions of pounds and add to fears of renewed conflict over islands. argentina invaded the falklands in 1982 and still claims territorial rights to the islands.

dalny vostock was carrying 132 crew members when it sank in the sea of okhotsk at 4am on thursday. more than 1,300 fishermen and emergency staff are involved in the huge rescue operation. 63 people have been rescued, but at least 54 bodies have been recovered. 13 crew members are still missing after the trawler tipped over when a fishing net was pulled in. early reports say the ship sank in 15 minutes after its engine room was flooded.

brandon afoa, 33, of puyallup, washington, was operating a tug to push aircraft at seattle-tacoma international airport when the brakes and steering failed. he crashed into a luggage lift at 2am on december 26, 2007. the accident left him unable to use his legs or right arm. he sued port of seattle, which owns and operates the airport, claiming the company failed to maintain a safe workplace. the case was locked in the courts for years as the port claimed it wasn't liable. but a king county jury ruled in 2013 that the airport had a 'duty' to pay out.
baby malakai has been diagnosed with a rare medical condition known as pallister killian syndrome. his mother stacy maitai had to give up her job in perth in order to care for her son full-time. the newborn cannot see, cannot hear and struggles to breath. without an income, she has been forced to survive on welfare funding of $90 a week to support her baby and her seven-year-old daughter. she is not eligible for further financial assistance from centrelink as she's not an australian citizen. the baby has been alive for seven months and he's never left the hospital.

the money was collected from students at the university of surrey. thousands of bacteria colonies were discovered on banknotes and coins chosen at random from scientists’ pockets. currency was submerged in agar - a substance that allows bacteria to grow quickly. most of the bacteria found on the coins studied was harmless, but money has been known to carry dangerous diseases.

one crème egg will take 19 minutes of skipping to burn off, and contains almost seven teaspoons of sugar. many popular easter eggs contain more sugar than is recommended in a day by the world health organisation. a kit kat chunky easter egg contains 24 teaspoons, double the recommended daily amount. exercise coaches recommend how to offset the calories.
cryos international, an online sperm bank, is moving its offices from new york to a research park in florida. the company is relocating to tap into 'the abundant donor opportunities' at the university of central floria. cryos supplies sperm online to all 50 u.s. states and 80 countries worldwide. the university has an undergraduate intake of around 52,000 students per year, of which 23,000 are male.

nasa has selected a variety of companies to work on projects to create advanced space technologies. one of the projects is a faster method of propulsion known as vasimr. it could get humans to mars in just 39 days - and could be used on a mission to mars. the engine uses plasma as a propellant and is being developed by ad astra rocket company in texas. nasa is considering it for use on a future manned mission to the red planet.

misao okawa died of heart failure at her nursing home in osaka, japan, on april 1 aged 117. she was born on march 5, 1898 and lived through two world wars and the invention of the television. at her 117th birthday party last month she said her life seemed 'rather short' the great-grandmother was the oldest person in the world when she died. american gertrude weaver, aged 116, is now the world's oldest person.

zhou qunfei, 45, was born into extreme poverty in a village in rural china. her mother died when she was five and her father was nearly blinded in an accident. she worked in a factory making glass for watches and earned less than £100 a month. she quit after three months and was promoted to head up a new department. she set up her own company lens technology, which supplies window glass used in apple devices. she is now china's richest woman after her company went public, making her wealthier than richard branson.
figures show 205 seals were legally killed in scotland waters last year by farmers, fishermen and angling firms to protect fish stocks. some cubs are being left to fend for themselves after their mothers are killed. it is legal to kill seals without a licence in england but not in other parts of the uk. farmers say seals threaten farmed salmon and wild fish.

study of 1,500 teachers found 30 per cent have suffered online abuse by parents. bullying by parents is on the rise accounting for 40 per cent of all reported online insults this year. 15 per cent had threats made against them, compared to seven per cent last year. proportion of teachers suffering abuse from both parents and pupils has doubled in a year.
beatrice nokes, 21, faces claims she incited a ring of prostitutes operating out of properties in central london. she is accused of running the vice ring with detective constable daniel williams, 37. chemistry student is suspected of grooming three young women to sell their bodies for sex. nokes is the daughter of two respected solicitors and a scotland yard detective. he faces several further offences including voyeurism and hiding profits in socks.
in southern germany, hundreds of people braved the snow for a traditional easter monday procession on horseback. in slovakia women were doused with buckets of water as part of the weekend celebrations. in hungary, women present the men with coloured eggs in exchange for being sprinkled with water.
natalie fletcher's '100 bodies across america' project is a body-painter's dream project. she has been travelling around the united states painting different people in each town. she hopes to complete the entire series by september this year. each work takes between 45 minutes and three hours to complete. her subjects are painted wearing only underwear.

research has revealed frequency of britons having sex has been in decline since emergence of the internet. professor david spiegelhalter, a statistician at cambridge university, says people check their emails 'all the time'   a typical heterosexual couple is now having sex three times a month, compared to four times in 2000 and five times in 1990.

police arrested 12 protesters thursday when they tried to block trucks heading to the peak of mauna kea where one of the world's largest telescopes is being built. native hawaiian groups do not oppose the thirty meter telescope itself, they disagree with the location of the construction on the mountain. all of the highest points in the islands are considered the home of deities. some consider the $1.4 billion thirty meter telescopes project as desecrating the big island's mountain.

the rosetta spacecraft had dipped to within nine miles (14km) of the surface of comet 67p on saturday. but it lost sense of where it was due to the amount of dust and gas. the probe was placed into ‘safe mode’, causing it to momentarily lose contact with earth. the european space agency’s spacecraft uses two star trackers to work out where it is in space. and during the recent flyby, the spacecraft started to mistake comet debris for stars, losing sight of earth.

researchers based at different institutions in tokyo, noted that rats flatten their ears, narrow their eyes and puff up their cheeks when they are in pain. the study suggests that the pained faces of rats may have a ‘communicative function’. they may even use expressions to warn other rats of danger or ask for help.

the camel - the first intact camel skeleton found in central europe - may have been left in the town of tulln for trading after the siege of vienna in 1683. genetic analysis of the beast show it was a bactrian-dromedary hybrid - a breed popular in the ottoman army at the time. the camel was male, around seven years old and most likely castrated.

'big bopper' richardson died in a plane crash. the original manuscript also reveals a deleted verse, which was crossed out and never recorded.
researchers from texas a&m school of public health found that hospitalizations from car crashes dropped 7 percent between 2003 and 20010 in 45 states with texting bans. the study could not prove that a texting ban is the cause of the drop in car accidents. drivers between the ages of 25 and 40 are the most likely group to get in an accident related to texting and driving.

four-poster oak wood bed was left in the car park of former redland house hotel in chester and sold for £2,200 in 2010. builders who were renovating the property left it to be picked up by auctioneers. tv historian jonathan foyle has spent years trying to prove it was once belonging to king henry vii. dna testing on the bed's timber proved it once belonged to king and he traced it back to 1495. bed features an inscription from the matthew bible of 1537 and features biblical scenes of henry and wife elizabeth of york.

all elephants will be phased out of the ringling brothers barnum and bailey circus performance by 2018. once they retire from performing, they will be taken to the ringling brothers elephant conservation center in an undisclosed, 200-acre area of polk county in central florida. some of the asian elephants will live out the rest of their lives in the center, while others will be used for breeding. the center's goal is to conserve the asians, whose population has decreased from 100,000 to between 25,000 and 32,000.
