the cheyenne mountain complex in colorado was home to the north american aerospace command. it was built in the 1960s to protect the american response to a soviet nuclear attack. the military complex is home to more than 1,000 personnel and is protected by a 25-ton blast door. the base was closed down nearly ten years ago as the threat from russia subsided. but the pentagon announced this week that the base will again be home to military equipment.
there are only about 250 philippine crocodiles left in the wild, making them the most endangered crocodile species in the world. seven crocodiles flew from melbourne zoo to the philippines as part of a major conservation effort. the crocodiles travelled in custom designed boxes specially built by the zoo. the crocs will be released into the wild at the palawan wildlife rescue & conservation centre.
taken in tokyo, the images show clean-up crews entering rubbish-strewn buildings where lonely victims die alone and go unnoticed by their families for weeks or months. the images capture the work of japan's 'lonely death' squads, who specialise is clearing out the properties of elderly people who die alone. thankfully, police officers will have already removed the badly decomposed bodies before the cleaning teams arrive.
genetic analysis of ancient human remains shows europeans were dark skinned for far longer than previously thought. early humans migrated from africa 40,000 years ago but kept their dark skin colour. it was not until 7,800 years ago that two genes that make skin lighter appeared. the first farmers from the near east and turkey brought the genes to europe. the researchers found that hunter gatherers up to 8,500 years ago still had dark skin.

the national defense reserve fleet was set up in the wake of the second world war in 1945 to provide back-up in case of war or national emergencies. at its peak in 1950, the ndrf consisted of 2,277 ships, but only 122 remain. the fleet is so rarely used that many of the ships are falling apart and polluting bays. the worst affected is suisun bay, california, where less than 50 ships remain, polluting the environment.

autism assistance dogs are a little known but hugely beneficial form of 'animal therapy' for children with autism. they are used to keep a child with autism safe and help develop social skills. april 2 is autism awareness day and autism assistance dogs can change the lives of many children. the dog can provide companionship for the child, as well as social and emotional support for the parent.
'pessie' may have lived at the bottom of the freshwater lakes that would later become loch ness. the fossils were found in a 19th century collection at inverness museum and art gallery. they bear a'striking' similarity to depictions of the elusive creature. scientists discovered the fossils as part of research for the upcoming science festival. pterichthyoides milleri roamed earth's freshwater lakes between 542 and 251 million years ago.

research led by the university of montana has found that eating fast food after a workout may be just as beneficial as dietary supplements. performance remained the same after resting for several hours. levels of glycogen - used by muscles as ‘fuel’ - were slightly higher after fast food was eaten as a recovery food.

9 sections of the great wall of china have been found along the inner coast of the yellow river in gansu province and the ningxia region. the stretch is thought to date back more than 2,000 years. experts say the new 6.2 mile-stretch means the full range of the wall can be traced for the first time. china's first emperor ordered for the wall to be built along the river to stop invaders.

bae system's typhoon is powered by two eurojet ej200 engines and is 49ft (15 metres) long from tip to tip. it is built on 'floating' concrete rafts that move in sync with the moon's gravitational pull. two laser trackers and nine jacks are positioned on a single surface to control the jet's positioning and accuracy. typhoon can take off in less than 8 seconds, achieve supersonic speeds and reach speeds equivalent to 30 african elephants.
scientists at the university of illinois found that children who ate a diet higher in saturated fats and cholesterol had slower reaction times and a poorer working memory. children performed worse when they were given a task-switching game to complete. eating fatty food for five days can change the body's metaboilsm for the worse. this is because it disrupts the way muscles break down sugar in the blood.

research by doctors from oxford university found babies' brains are more sensitive to pain than adults' brains. it overturns the medical consensus that very young babies do not feel pain and do not need painkillers. it means newborns often go without painkillers, even during invasive procedures. until now doctors have assumed that babies’ brains are not developed enough to feel pain.

self-styled mirreyes (my kings) are the sons and daughters of members of mexican high society who post pictures of their wealth on social media. they are known to enjoy 'ostentatious spending, exhibitionism and narcissism' in a country where a majority of citizens live in poverty. they can be embarrassing but can also lead to political and legal advantages. the self-styles are often the sons of government officials and other members of high society.

the mystery of what appears to be a screw fixed inside a rock has perplexed scientists. russian researchers have dated the unusual'screw' to 300 million years old, leading some people to claim that it may be proof of a lost human civilisation or the work of aliens. but experts suggest that the ‘screw’ is in fact a fossilised sea creature called a crinoid. the screw-like shape may actually be the reversed-shape of the creature, which dissolved while the rock formed. the object measures an inch (2cm) long and was collected by a ufo and paranormal group.

three first-year students at rice university in houston created the single-use device to ease the pain of an injection. it numbs the skin prior to the jab by producing a rapid chemical reaction to cool the patient's skin. the device is 3d printed and costs around $2 (£1.34) to produce. it could also be used to ease pain of ear piercings and tattooing.

mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (mbct) teaches people to focus on the present moment. has similar recurrence rates as anti-depressants and could be offered as an alternative to drugs. relapse rates were 44 per cent in the mbct group compared to 47 per cent for medication.

al qaeda-linked networks have altered their tactics since the leaks by edward snowden. extremist websites have moved to protect their digital communications by releasing encryption programmes. think-tank henry jackson society says at least three terror groups have altered communications. other groups are using human couriers instead of email and mobile phones.    the report was compiled in the first comprehensive analysis of 1.7million classified documents.

hanan, 19, was snatched from her family and taken to a warehouse in mosul, iraq. she and other yazidi girls were dragged away by their hair and raped by isis militants. hanan was one of more than 200 women and children to be released by militants last week. she told how girls as young as ten were dragged from their families and raped.
researchers found spores of several mushroom species in the hardened plaque on the teeth of the red lady of el mirón. she was buried 18,700 years ago in an elaborate grave in a cave in cantabria, spain. her body was found covered in sparkling red paint and covered in a tombstone. her remains were uncovered in 2010 during excavations of the cave. researchers at the max planck institute found her teeth bore the remains of plant pollen, fungi and animals. they found microscopic evidence she ate sponge capped, bolete and gilled mushrooms. the study is the oldest evidence yet that mushrooms were eaten by early humans.
xiao zhengti, five, was born with a congenital liver disease meaning he needed a transplant at nine months old. mother donated part of her liver but his body rejected it and he spent four years in hospital. yesterday father xiao kunqing donated 40 per cent of his liver to save his son's life. the operation is believed to be the first in china where two parents donated the same organ to save a child.
there were 72 unprovoked shark attacks around the world last year. three people were killed in australia and south africa. only a minority of sharks are a danger to humans, according to the international shark attack file. there are a number of simple precautions that can be taken to avoid a shark attack. always swim in a group and stay alert to your surroundings. don't swim with shark food.
james ritchie was forced to resign from his role as women's officer at the tasmanian university union. public pressure and an online petition demanded he step down from the position. mr ritchie had been voted into the job with a clear majority over a female candidate. the university's student union has now introduced a requirement that candidates identify as female.
alfie underwent a general anaesthetic for an mri scan at the animal health trust clinic in newmarket, suffolk. 12-year-old king charles spaniel suffered three degree burns after vets warmed up a heat pad in a microwave. owner lynne edwards only realised something was wrong when he started to refuse food and found puss oozing from his back. alfie is now on medication while his wounds heal but could face surgery to remove some of the skin.
mike lane, 40, was beaten by balaclava-clad protesters armed with iron bars on ropes in everleigh, wiltshire. he is joint master of the tedworth hunt and was kicked in the head by saboteurs. police dropped an investigation into the attack just three months after it took place. video of the incident and dossier of evidence was given to police after the attack. mike lane condemned the decision as 'pathetic' and said police could have done more.
capybara joejoe who lives in las vegas with his owner cody kennedy, has almost 60,000 followers on instagram. the capybara has near 5,000 facebook likes and 1,000 twitter followers. the rodent has a twitter account and a facebook page.
the shire of montana guest house is inspired by jrr tolkien's fantasy books and is located in a remote valley in the north-west corner of the state. at 1,000 square feet, the underground home has a hobbit home, fairy doors and troll house. it costs $300 (£200) a night for two guests to stay at the home, which is underground and has no mobile phone service.
up to 2500 passengers on board the cruise ship carnival spirit are stranded outside sydney harbour due to the wild seas. the ship was due to dock at 7:15 this morning but was prevented from docking because of the heavy seas . the cruise liner has suffered damage and is currently stranded outside of sydneys harbour. the huge waves of up to nine metres have been battering the ship for the past 24 hours. the passengers are at the mercy of the wild weather conditions as storms batter the east coast.
the retired midnight oil lead singer, former politician and passionate environmental activist peter garrett is listing his three bedroom victorian terrace in randwick in sydney’s affluent eastern suburbs. the 62-year-old has lived at the home for almost five years with his wife dora and three daughters. the property was bought by garrett for $932,500 in 2010 while he was the minister for environment protection, heritage and the arts. he is hoping the property will be auctioned off for at least $1.05 million.
social services minister scott morrison is set to announce reforms to strip parents of welfare benefits if they don't vaccinate their children. the changes will scrap a provision that allows parents who don't claim benefits to claim childcare benefits. currently around 39,000 australian children under the age of seven are not vaccinated. the reforms come amid rising concerns about whooping cough outbreaks.

the crew of the admiral kuznetsov, russia's largest warship, have built a giant leaf-blower to clean the decks. sailors on board the aircraft carrier have attached an old jet engine to the front of a tractor. crew members use the machine to sweep the deck of the 14,700sqft deck, and blow debris overboard. debris on carrier decks can potentially get sucked into jet engines and damage planes.

pleasaunce cottage in dormans park near east grinstead is one of the first ever bungalows built in the country. built in 1880s by ra briggs, the property has been lovingly maintained to its original design. it is a three-storey indian-style bungalow built on the design of victorian houses in india. historians are eager to put the property forward for listing to further protect its heritage. the property is currently on the market for £985,000.

researchers studied 40 million posts by 1.7 millions users on news site cnn.com, breitbart.com and ign.com.   trolls are less likely to use positive words than other users, and they swear more in posts. they are also more likely to veer off-topic and have fewer similarities with other users. an algorithm can recognise a potential troll with an accuracy of 80 per cent by scanning comments.

geologist dr danny hilman believes that a site in west java is revered because it hides an ancient temple built between 9,000 and 20,000 years ago. the megalithic site of gunung padang was discovered in 1914 and is the largest site of its kind in indonesia. egypt’s oldest pyramid was built almost 5,000years ago but a similar structure could be four times older. if true, the claim could rewrite prehistory and shed light on a powerful and advanced ancient civilisation.

homeless period project hopes to shred the taboo around females living on the streets and their periods. encourages people to donate tampons and towels to their local homeless shelters. project was started by oliver frost, josie shedden and sara bakhaty.   26 per cent of people who access homelessness services are women. while homeless shelters receive funding for condoms, there is no government funding for sanitary products.
clark elmore was convicted of killing and raping his 14-year-old stepdaughter kristy ohnstad in washington in 1995. he confessed to killing her after she threatened to reveal he had molested her as a child. elmore claimed his constitutional rights were violated at trial and was sentenced to death. 9th us circuit court of appeals confirmed washington supreme court's decision was correct and upheld his conviction. he is the second-longest serving inmate on the state's death row after being sent there in 1996.

sleep cycle app tracks a user's sleep as they go through a cycle of sleep phases. using statistics from sleep cycle app users, researchers have discovered the earliest wake-up time worldwide is on a monday in south africa. on tuesdays, americans rise at 7am and are in the worst mood all week. the best sleep quality worldwide occurs on a wednesday night and people in finland sleep the most on a saturday. nearly 90% of countries surveyed sleep more and wake up later on saturday compared to any other day of the week.

chimps in kibale national park in uganda have learned to look for traffic before crossing busy roads. dominant males will wait to ensure younger chimps cross safely. it is the first time chimps have been seen to adapt to busy roads and look both ways. chimps will also often run across roads.

ten 1933 double eagle coins were found in a bank deposit box for joan langbord's father israel switt, a philadelphia jeweler. the government believed that switt stole the coins from the us mint in 1933. the coins were almost all destroyed when the us went off the gold standard. a jury sided with the government in 2012, but an appeals court overturned the decision and returned the coins to the family.

the disused rhondda tunnel, which runs 1,000 feet beneath the welsh hills, was closed as part of the beeching cutbacks. it was opened in 1890 in the coal boom and was closed in 1968. but engineers are due to visit the 3,148m tunnel next week to see whether it is safe to use as a cycle route. under the proposals, it would be one of the longest cycle tunnels in the world, second only to the 4,000m snoqualmie tunnel.

shoshana hebshi, of sylvania, ohio, was strip-searched at detroit metropolitan airport on the 10th anniversary of 9/11. she was ethnically profiled based on her dark complexion and was held for hours. frontier airlines, the transportation security administration and wayne county airport authority were named in the federal lawsuit. the federal government will give her $40,000 as compensation for being humiliated. she is a mother of twin boys and a freelance writer and yoga instructor.
peter reece, his fiancee, mother and six-month-old daughter were parked on an ocean shores, washington, beach on thursday when the tide came in and trapped the family. the car's tires got stuck in the wet sand and the family was unable to drive away. a police officer rescued the family, but his mother and baby were trapped inside the car. seconds after the officer saved the grandmother and baby, a wave hit the car, flipping it and pulling it out to sea. the family were able to get out of the car and walk up the beach.
oxford claimed their fourth win in five years in the 161st men's boat race. female crews representing oxford and cambridge universities rowed the same stretch of the river thames as the men for the first time in 87 years. oxford dominated cambridge in the men's race, claiming a third consecutive victory in a row. the women's team also made history by winning the race and competing on the same day as men.
tibor racsits, 42, had gone to pick up his daughter kiara from the movies at charlestown square in newcastle, north of sydney, on sunday night. two 15-year-old boys and a 14-year old boy have been charged with assault and affray. the father and his daughter were attacked outside a shopping centre. the youths were charged as normal, not under the controversial young offenders act.
stars like kate hudson, pharrell williams and gwen stefani show no signs of ageing in the last decade. femail rounds up the celebrities whose faces haven't changed for at least 10 years.    jared leto, angelina jolie, keira knightley and jennifer lopez are among the stars who have maintained their looks.
builders were called in to fix a leak in phillip and gaby beckle-raymond's home in north london. they left the family with no roof and just tarpaulin to protect the house from the elements. the family had to live in one room for six months as they couldn't afford the repairs. the builders ran off with £17,000 of their money.
martin burgess clock b is based on john harrison's 18th century clock, which he thought up to solve problem of determining longitude at sea. it has been part of a 100-day trial at the royal observatory, in greenwich, to see if it was accurate. clock has been certified by guinness world records and certified by national maritime museum.
tories launch new poster campaign showing ms sturgeon manipulating puppet labour leader. grant shapps says ed miliband would be a 'disaster' if carried by snp. snp leader claims her party’s manifesto will include pledges in policy areas which don’t affect scotland.
jack cordero, 14, vomited all over the floor of a powell's bookstore in portland, oregon, in march. manager was forced to clean up the 'gigantic' mess - but received apology letter and gift card. it was signed 'jack' and included a ben & jerry's ice cream card. manager said the apology letter'made her day' and thanked staff at the store.
around 16 million tourists visit florence every year. prince ottaviano de’medici di toscana is aiming to reclaim the city from mass tourism. the last ten years have seen a rise in the number of visitors to the city. vandals have destroyed historic monuments and binge-drinking tourists are sleeping rough. prince wants to attract visitors with its lesser known museums and smaller hotels.
new yorker amanda chatel explained in an essay that she is pushing for 'yes means yes' sex contracts to become mandatory on college campuses across the country. the law was first passed in california in 2014. amanda wrote that she was a victim of date rape and blamed herself for years after her assault because she never actually said 'no'    the writer said the law is just one step in combating society's prevalent rape culture and that we need to change the way people think of rape.
nyia parler, 41, was taken into custody by authorities in montgomery county, maryland overnight saturday. police say she went to visit her boyfriend after leaving her quadriplegic son, 21, in a wooded park with a blanket and a bible. the non-verbal man was found 10 feet from his wheelchair and the bible in a philadelphia park on friday night. parler was arrested on charges of aggravated assault, simple assault and neglect of a care-dependent person.
philip and victoria sherlock have been living out of their car for three months after a stomach operation. philip lost his job as a gardener and then the pair lost their benefits. they were forced to sell furniture and take out pay-day loans to live in their car. manchester business owner jasen jackiw heard about the story on a tv programme. he gave philip a job and the pair are now living in hotels when they can afford it.
aaron hernandez was a key player of the new england patriots offense and played in the super bowl in 2012. he was arrested for the murder of odin lloyd in june 2013. he has been accused of shooting a total of six men - killing three and wounding three others. he is currently serving a life sentence in prison for the crime. before his murder arrest, he was accused of being involved in a 'thug life' in his hometown of bristol, connecticut. his father died in 2006 and his mother was allegedly abused by her new husband after he moved in with her.
wendy wei mei wu has purchased slipper island, a 217 hectare new zealand island for aud $6.75 million. the buyer is yet to decide what she wants to do with the 2.7 km long, 1.8 km wide landmass. it was purchased by a former property developer. the island is located 4 km off the coast of the north island, and has six houses. the sale has divided the needham family who own the island, with some of them claiming it represents the loss of the family's legacy. ms wu made headlines in 2010 for making the biggest private home sale of the year.
stacey johnson, 22, was diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour in 2007 and has undergone gruelling chemotherapy. her sister dannii, 20, was her full time carer and helped her throughout her teenage years. in 2014, stacey was told her tumour had grown and she was told it was cancerous. doctors then discovered her younger sister had a growth in her brain. she was shocked to discover she too had a tumour, although hers is benign. the sisters, from much hadham, hertfordshire, were both born with benign brain tumours.
christine davidson was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer in 2001 and was told she only had up to three years to live. christine passed away at a nursing home on thursday at the age of 61. her diamond engagement ring was 'forcefully removed and stolen' from her finger just days before she died. the family has launched an online appeal to find the ring. christina and her husband ronny were happily married for 41 years before she passed away.
clarence david moore, 66, escaped from a north carolina prison as a 23-year-old inmate in june 1972. he was serving a sentence of more than 10 years for larceny when he escaped. moore has been on the run from the law for more than four decades. on monday he called the franklin county sheriff's office in kentucky and admitted to being a fugitive . he suffers from several medical conditions and cannot walk, but because he has no social security card of any form of id, he has been unable to receive medical treatment.

public land managers and councils in greater sydney are targeting feral rabbits with carrots laced with a deadly virus. over 30 government bodies scattered the carrots in public areas across 160 localities in march. it comes after a'significantly rampant population' of wild rabbits in nsw. about 70-100 per cent of rabbits die once infected with the calicivirus. the pest causes millions of dollars of major agricultural and environmental damage each year.

tony morris qc is mounting a landmark legal challenge against queensland's speed-camera laws. mr morris says he wasn't driving when his volvo was photographed doing 57km/h in a 50kph zone. he has invoked a spousal privilege case from 1817 to try to avoid a $146 speeding fine. he argues it's unconstitutional for a queensland court to fine him when there's evidence he was not the driver.

researchers predict abundance and distribution of popular fish could fall as north sea warms. north sea has warmed four times faster than the global average in the past 40 years. scientists combined long-term fisheries data and climate model projections to predict species. as the north sea warm, species won't be able to migrate north to avoid warming temperatures. uk fisheries will need to replace current species with those that prefer warmer water. this could increase the price of fish and chips.

oxford scientists say a mercury-like body struck the young earth 4.5 billion years ago. the object would have been the heat source for our planet's core. the same object could have been responsible for creating the moon. it also explains where some rare-earth elements came from .

bernard whalen's new book charts the rise of the new york police department from its beginnings in 1898. the department's first chief of police, william devery, was known as the king of kickbacks. richard entright failed to root out klansmen in his own police force. lewis valentine was a stalwart of the force for more than 30 years who had a reputation for brutality.

57 per cent of adults in the uk claim to use a discount store like poundland every week. almost half of all people who have visited variety discounters are middle class and among the country's highest earners. 53 per cent are in the top a/b social class and earn more than £35,000-a-year. the'stigma' of shopping in budget stores is disappearing, experts say.

90 per cent of women will experience period pain in their life time. most 'normal' pain can be treated with ibuprofen or over-the-counter medication. more severe symptoms can point to endometriosis. pain during or after sex, back and leg pain and bleeding between periods are all signs of the condition. it can take up to ten years to diagnose.

explosion on a pacific gas & electric co. pipe carrying natural gas happened while an equipment operator and a group of county jail inmates were expanding a road alongside highway 99 in central california. the explosion closed both directions of highway 99 and injured at least 15 people, four of them critically. the blast happened at the fresno county sheriff's gun range.   the flames shot well over 100 feet into the air, witnesses said.
terry mccarty was just six years old when he was engulfed with flames after his brothers filled a bowl with kerosene which was accidentally knocked on to him. endured 58 operations as well as cruel taunts from bullies who called him freddy krueger because of the scars on his face, body and arms. he has now overcome his injuries by becoming a firefighter after refusing to let 'fear take over his life'

prince george's birth in 2013 sparked a £247m sales bonanza for makers of royal memorabilia. but experts say the second royal baby will have a more modest increase of £60 to £70m. most of the money will be spent on champagne and cake. royal mint and royal collection trust are planning commemorative coins and mugs.
the unnamed man died from variant creutzfeldt-jakob disease in may 2014. he was a naturalized u.s. citizen originally from the middle east. the man likely contracted the disease over a decade before moving to the united states in the 1990s. he had been misdiagnosed with psychiatric symptoms before he was diagnosed with mad cow disease. he died from the human version of the disease.

neurio device claims to make ‘an ordinary home smart’ and recognises the electronic signature of different devices. it costs $250 (£168) and can be used to monitor energy consumption and control appliances remotely. the device monitors a home around the clock so it can tell users if they have left lights on. when used with another app, neurio can also turn appliances on and off remotely.

durham university scientists studied a 'clump' of dark matter that appears to be lagging behind its galaxy. dark matter is thought to account for 85 per cent of the matter in the universe. until now, it was thought dark matter did not interact with anything other than gravity. but researchers at the university found a clump offset from a galaxy by 5,000 light-years. this suggests dark matter interacts with itself through forces other thangravity. the discovery was made around one of the galaxies in the abell 3827 cluster, 1.3 billion light- years away.
columbia journalism school of journalism released 12,000-word review of the discredited story. sabrina rubin erdely is not expected to lose her job over her reporting of alleged rape at virginia frat house. she reported that a student named jackie claimed to have been gang raped by seven men. but the story was roundly discredited after it was published in november. experts at columbia said the story fell apart because of 'basic, routine' failures of journalism. but rolling stone publisher jann wenner said no-one will lose their jobs over the story.

in recent years, the chernobyl nuclear explosion site and nearby ghost town of pripyat, ukraine, have seen an increase in tourist interest. visits to the 50-kilometre exclusion zone are highly regulated, but day trips and even overnight stays are permitted.    the area is one of the world's most famous 'dark tourism' sites, and is popular with photographers.

the world's last northern white rhino, sudan, is under 24-hour armed guard at a reserve in kenya. rangers risk their lives to keep him safe from poachers lured by the rising price of ivory. they have even cut off his horn to deter poachers - but fear it won't be enough. he is one of only five northern white rhinos left in the world. attempts at breeding have been unsuccessful - and he is now getting old.

kenton lee, from nampa, idaho, came up with the idea while working in nairobi in kenya. the shoe that grows uses adjustable buckles and a strap on the toe to expand by five sizes. it has adjustable points at the front, sides and the back of the sandal to help it expand. a single pair costs $30 but buying 100 pairs reduces the cost to $12. mr lee is working with an organisation called because international to send the shoes to orphanages.

toyal lotus technology is inspired by the water-repellent nature of a lotus leaf and uses microscopic bumps to stop yoghurt from sticking to pots. german maker toyo aluminium's technology won silver place in the 2013 du pont awards for packaging innovation. the lid was inspired by lotus leaves that repel water to prevent being weighed down by rain. the toyal lotus lid's surface creates a contact angle of 170 degrees to stop liquids sticking to lids of pots.

giant concrete arrows were once markers for early airmail flights across the us. the arrows were placed at the base of beacons to help pilots find their way. the us postal service used surplus war planes to deliver mail after world war one. retired couple brian and charlotte smith have found 102 of the giant arrows across america. they have travelled across the country to photograph the monuments.
phillip buchanon was a first-round draft pick for the oakland raiders in 2002. his mother demanded he pay her one million dollars as the cost 'for raising him for the last 18 years' after he was drafted. he bought his mother a house instead, but she rented it to his aunt for seven years. he said his relatives also asked him for money, claiming they needed a check to pay for repairs and bills. he moved out of his mother's house at 17 because he no longer 'felt secure' in the home his mother was living in. he discussed the incident in his recently released book new money: stay rich.

the oldest active pilot is a 95-year-old man living in cameron park, california. guinness world records has confirmed peter weber jr.'s feat. weber was a flight cadet in 1943 and retired as a lieutenant colonel in 1970. he flew in both world war ii and the vietnam war and served as a korean war flight instructor. he has said he flies 'at least twice a month' and still has his driver's license.

deep brain stimulation is already used to treat parkinson's, but now researchers believe it could be used to improve brain function. technique can boost memory by causing new brain cells to be formed in the brain. experiments on rats found the therapy improved their powers of recall after 24 hours. it is used to enhance the growth of brain cells and ward off diseases like dementia.

national grid has revealed the uk's first new pylon for nearly 90 years called the t-pylon. it is a third shorter than the old lattice pylons. but it is able to carry just as much power - 400,000 volts - and will be used for clean energy purposes. national grid is building a training line of six of the new towers at their eakring training academy in nottinghamshire.

internet has countless local area networks that then connect with larger, regional networks. the brain operates in a similar way, the researchers found. first comprehensive picture of how neurons connect to one another. found local networks of neurons layered like the shells in a russian nesting doll. discovery is the result of 40 years' worth of research on rat brains.

town halls fail to recalibrate some of 100,000 parking ticket machines in the uk to accept new coins. 240 machines in manchester still do not accept new 5p and 10p coins brought in three years ago. drivers must use £1 and two 20p pieces for a typical £1.25 hour's parking. town hall bosses in the city are pocketing thousands of pounds extra from parking machines.

michigan micro mote is the smallest computer in the world, measuring less than 2mm across. contains solar cells that power the battery with ambient light. can act as a smart sensor, and give everyday objects computing capabilities. could be used for personal security and information.
wellington's inaugural cubadupa festival shut down streets and spanned several blocks at the weekend. the capital city put on a colourful party for more than 100 different performances. wellington's iconic cuba street was the centre point of all activity and drew in thousands of locals and tourists. the massive scale festival was the first of its kind in several years.
gerard t. 'the frenchman' ouimette was diagnosed with lung cancer and died in his sleep at a federal prison in north carolina after spending 46 years behind bars. he was convicted of extortion in 1996 and was the first criminal in new england sentenced to life in prison without parole. he had close ties to crime boss raymond l.s. patriarca and was suspected of having a role in up to eight murders. he 'ran' the federal prison and even had booze, drugs and lobster dinner smuggled in on a weekly basis.

'evil looking' man tried to rob them of the contents of their mobility scooter baskets. mrs mason shouted 'oh no, you don't' and ran over the would-be robber with her scooter. the man was knocked to the ground and the pair sped off on their motorbikes.
scientists at the niels bohr institute at the university of copenhagen found that large amounts of ice were at the martian poles and likely towards the equator. a thick layer of dust on mars covers the glaciers, so they appear as the surface of the planet. radar measurements show that there are glaciers composed of frozen water underneath the dust. there is more than 150 billion cubic metres of ice on mars, which could cover the entire surface of mars with 1.1 metres.
dusan bako, 18, flew into a rage after he tried to call the girl's phone only to discover it was switched off. he repeatedly punched her in the stomach causing her to lose their unborn baby. bako hit the girl 'like a boxer' before she was taken to hospital where she later miscarried the baby. he was jailed for four years and eight months at manchester crown court.
only 44 per cent of hillary clinton's 3.6 million twitter followers are real people who are active on the social media platform. at least 544,000 of the former secretary of state's followers are fake. clinton has more than 46,000 facebook 'likes' but more than half of them list 'baghdad, iraq' as their hometown. just 4% of president barack obama's twitter fans are fake, according to a popular online audit tool.

archaeologists have so far opened up seven of the tombs, recovering 171 broken mummies from the ancient ceremonial site known as tenahaha in peru's cotahuasi valley. each tomb was filled with bones of up to 60 mummies, with infants kept in small containers. over the years rats had eaten away at many of the remains, leaving only fragments. the mummies were buried with a variety of items, including teeth, hands and feet. the death rituals were believed to have been performed in a peaceful area of the andes.

tortoises can't swim, said florida wildlife officials this week after people tried to throw baby tortoises in the ocean because they were mistaken for sea turtles. all five species of sea turtle and the gopher turtle nest in the sand and are unable to swim like the sea turtle. there were at least three reports of people trying to release gopher tortoise hatchlings in the water.

the 41-year-old australian woman was getting ready for a new year's eve party when she started to wheeze. she reached into her bag for her inhaler, but it was uncapped. she thought it was due to a loose connection, but felt a scratch in her throat. she began coughing up blood, wheezing and short of breath and was rushed to hospital. doctors found the earring was lodged in her right bronchus - the airway leading to the lungs.
life spans of women aged 65, 75, 85 and 95 fell in 2012 for the first time since 1995. average 75-year-old woman could expect to live another 13 years and five weeks - five weeks less than in 2011. public health england said the fall was the first since 1995 for all four age groups. life expectancy for english women is among the worst in western europe.

researchers at stanford university studied 400 people with synaesthesia - a neurological condition that affects one in 10,000 people . they compared colour-letter matches to fridge magnets sold by fisher-price between 1971 and 1990. at least six per cent of synesthetes learnt many of the colours associated with letters from the toy. for people born between 1970 and 1985, the prevalence of synesthesia can exceed 15 per cent. but authors say the findings don't suggest toys cause associations of people with the condition .

the alarm clock, called wakē, rouses individuals from their slumber using a focused beam of light and sound. the wall-mounted device creates a ‘personal sunrise’ and emits focused ultrasonic waves to wake up each person individually. it uses a white led to slowly illuminate the area around a sleeper’s face to gently wake them up. it has an inbuilt sensor to detect sleepers’ body heat and sends a directed beam of sound to rouse an individual. the alarm costs $250 (£167) to pre-order on kickstarter and is due to ship in september.

the ufo map was created by writer levi pearson, who used a ufo sighting dataset from the national ufo reporting centre. it shows sightings of extra-terrestrials around the world in the last 76 years. many of the sightings can be put down to the development of drones and new aircraft technologies. but some enthusiasts believe there is a rise in alien activity. the map shows a dramatic rise in the number of sightings between the 1940s and the 1960s.

hyalinobatrachium dianae was found in the mountains of eastern costa rica and has a distinctive call. it was found with translucent skin on its underside, making its organs easily visible. the frog was named h. dianae and was found by brian kubicki who discovered it. the creature was found in the mountains and has been named a new species of glass frog. its heart, liver and gastrointestinal tract are easily visible and it has black and white eyes.

more than 700 asiatic black bears are being butchered on illegal bear bile farms in vietnam. up to four bears are killed in one day on some farms, according to sources.    owners are killing them to 'extract the last ounce of blood' and sell body parts to make chinese medicine. only 1,245 of the animals remain in captivity in bear farms compared to 4,000 in 2005.

visual health studios in colorado has developed a weight loss app called visualize you. it calculates what you would look like if you lost a specified amount of weight. the app processes an image of you to reveal what you'd look like after losing weight. users are shown an original and a slimmer version, with a slider. it costs £1.61 ($2.40) on android and $1.99 for the full version.

just over 60 per cent of americans believe global warming is taking place and nearly half blame humans for the change. but opinions on global warming vary wildly between states, local communities, and congressional districts. people in california are far more worried about the warming planet than those in central us. researchers at yale university created an interactive map to reveal public opinion in all 50 states, 435 congressional districts and more than 3,000 counties. concern about global warming ranges from a low of 38 per cent in pickett county to a high of 74 per cent.

nasa has released an infographic explaining which worlds in the solar system are thought to have oceans under their surface. nine other worlds are suspected to have subsurface oceans - and some may even contain life. the space agency claims we could find life on one of them in the next ten or 20 years.
more than 2,000 families have fled the iraqi city of ramadi. isis fighters have nearly surrounded the capital of western anbar province. ramadi was once the battlefield for us forces eight year battle against insurgents during the 2003 iraq war. us led coalition air strikes have targeted three villages recently taken by isis.
all flights were halted for about 20 minutes after potential drone sighting at 11:30am. some flights were delayed or diverted while a police helicopter scoured the area around manchester airport. some incoming flights were diverted to other airports and a second runway was opened to clear backlog. police search failed to turn up any evidence of a drone in air space.
letter was sent from white star lines bosses to christopher moody, brother of officer james moody who died on board the titanic. company bosses asked for £20 to return his body to england - almost £2,000 in today's money. mr moody was 24-year-old junior officer who died after titanic hit iceberg on maiden voyage. he was on watch when the ship hit an iceberg and later helped passengers into lifeboats. but his body had not been recovered by the time the letter was sent 103 years ago.
andras janos vass, 25, was found guilty of human trafficking and racketeering felonies. faces maximum sentence of 155 years in prison. at least two of his victims were lured to america via planet romeo gay dating website. he threatened their families and forced them to work 20 hours a day on sex work.
kendall schler crept onto the go! st. louis marathon course after the last checkpoint and was spotted at the starting point of the race just blocks from the finish line. she claimed to have removed both the magnetic strips from her bibs and didn't record any of her times electronically. her times that qualified her to run in the boston marathon have now been erased, and her spot in the event has been vacated. schler was unable to prove that she won this year's race. she finished third in the marathon last year and was the female winner of it but officials determined she didn't run the full course.

gases are potent greenhouse gases that have 2,500 times the impact on global warming compared to carbon dioxide. anaesthetic is used to send patients to sleep during surgery. scientists say they have detected gases as far a field as antarctica. concentrations have been rising globally in the past decade and are contributing to climate change.
by scanning the brains of people reading passages from the harry potter books, researchers discovered 'arousing words' affected parts of the brain concerned with emotion. study carried out by lancaster university used a magnetic resonance imaging scanner to map activity in the brains. it found the common use of words affected areas associated with emotion in the brain. the books have sold more than 450 million copies since the first was published in 1997.

state supplies more than three-quarters of the world's almond market and is in its fourth year of drought. residents attack bottled water industry and almond growers for 'depleting mountain streams and watersheds' despite the drought, almond growers are still planting trees. almonds are high in potassium, calcium, vitamin e and magnesium and have health benefits.

stocks of the influenza vaccine are arriving a month later than expected. scientists have included protection against two new strains of influenza. h3n2 and b/phuket caused a spike in deaths in europe and the us during the northern winter. high-risk groups will be able to access free flu shots from april 20. the vaccine was not a good match to fight against the new strains.

linda mclean was in her classroom at pine eagle charter school in halfway, oregon when a masked man in a hoodie burst in with a gun and pulled the trigger.    she believed for a several moments that she was going to die. doctors diagnosed mclean with post-traumatic stress disorder and urged her to return to the school. she is now suing the school board, the masked safety officer and school administrators for damages.
stephanie scott's father robert has opened up about the grief his family is feeling after her murder. stephanie's body was found in bushland the day before her wedding. the 26-year-old leeton school teacher went missing on easter sunday. she was due to marry her fiance aaron leeson-woolley on saturday april 11. her father says it is especially painful that she had so much to look forward to. he says he has contemplated the afterlife but is confident his daughter is in 'the best possible place'    ms scott was a bubbly and thoughtful personality who was full of love and happiness.
musk proposed that google buy tesla for $6 billion and promise an additional $5 billion in factory expansions. in march 2013, musk contacted google co-founder larry page. beset by technical problems on its flagship model s, the electric-car company in early 2013 was on the verge of bankruptcy. musk's proposal was rejected by page, who said a car company is 'pretty far from what google knows' but the company reported its first profit in may 2013.
researchers at george washington university claim civilisations were hit by a 'perfect storm' of disasters 3,200 years ago. professor eric cline claims a series of droughts, famines, climate change, earthquakes, invasions and rebellions led to the collapse of the great civilisations. egypt, babylonians, minoans and mycenians were unable to cope with the events. the sea peoples were previously blamed for the downfall of the civilisations, but professor cline says they may have been unfairly blamed.
brothers of men convicted of sex offences are five times more likely than average to commit similar crimes. biggest study of its kind suggests sex offending could run in the family along the male genetic line. sons of fathers with a criminal record for sex offending were four times more likely to be convicted. just 2.5% of brothers of sex offenders were convicted of similar crimes, compared with 0.5 per cent of the general population.
kate t. parker, from atlanta, georgia, was inspired to create her photo series strong is the new pretty while looking at photos of her daughters ella, nine, and alice, six. ms parker photographed her daughters and their friends playing sports and enjoying their childhoods. the series aims to empower the girls and honor their personal interests.
the philadelphia eagles officially signed 27-year-old quarterback tim tebow to a one-year deal on monday. tebow, 27, hasn't played a snap in the nfl since being cut by the new england patriots before the 2013 season. the team announced the contract monday but did not disclose the financial terms. heisman trophy winner tebow worked out with the eagles last month.

mick tabone, 74, owned and ran johnstone river crocodile farm and zoo in far-north queensland. he first came across a crocodile called 'gregory' in 1989. the 5.2 metre croc was captured after he was found stealing a farmer's cattle. the croc shared a special bond with mick and spent time with him every day. the farmer would sit on gregory's back and chatted to him for 20 years. mr tabone said he never felt in danger and was never frightened by the crocodile. he was captured by rangers after a warrant was issued to kill the creature.

kvin jonas rojano-nieto, 20, was found guilty of raping a three-year-old girl at his family home in june. superior court judge m. marc kelly said he 'did not intend to harm' the girl. the mandatory sentence for a child rapist is 25-years to life. prosecutor have said they will appeal the decision.
the original 1959 barbie doll goes back on sale this saturday in australia for the original 1959 price of $3.00. myer have teamed up with mattel to re-produce the dolls. the dolls are newly produced but modelled on the iconic doll. the first 100 customers at five of myer city stores will get the doll for the special heritage price.

margaret and gary mazan from bradford, west yorkshire, had 14 red setters seized by rspca inspectors. the animals were found in filthy cages in a garden shed with matted fur and dehydrated. couple were jailed for 26 weeks and given lifetime ban from owning or keeping pets. couple failed to seek veterinary care for their eyes and injuries to their tails.
brussels will say that google has used dominance to divert internet users from rivals to its own services. google currently boasts a 90 per cent share in europe's search engine market. margrethe vestager, the eu's competition commissioner, will today serve google with a formal charge sheet. the ruling is the result of a five-year investigation into the search giant.
senator bob corker, a republican from tennessee, has denied partisan politics in washington dc could derail america's landmark agreement to curb iran's nuclear capabilities. countering president barack obama's previous assertion, he said congressional oversight 'doesn't mean there won't be a deal' negotiators announced a framework deal on thursday. israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu has criticized the framework as deeply flawed and a threat to israel's very existence.
tracy cox says eye contact is the most effective way to signal sexual interest. she says it takes more than just simple eye contact to get someone's attention. tracey says there are five techniques that are scientifically proven to get you noticed. she explains how to use your peepers to get people to look at you.
new training will commence at los angeles international airport, one of the airports named in the complaint filed by the american civil liberties union. complaint was filed on behalf of malaika singleton, who said she was subjected to a hair pat-down with weeks of each other. the tsa said the re-training will stress 'race neutrality'   the administration will track of pat-downs complaints filed by african-american women throughout the country.
jordan sharifi, 17, was taken into custody on friday by police in mckinney, texas, after police say he confessed to giving a gun to friend raymond howell, jr. raymond's body was found in a ditch on thursday morning. police say sharifi led them to howell's body before confessing he stole a gun from a family he was staying with and gave it to his friend. he says he found the body of raymond, 14, in a rain culvert and found the gun beneath him. sharifi was charged with fabricating or tampering with evidence, theft of a firearm and making a firearm accessible to a child.
thieves targeted 13 shops in two-month crime spree in tipton, west midlands, stealing £2,000 worth of cigarettes and £30,000 in cars. they used pink umbrellas to hide their faces as they raided convenience stores and electrical shops. the gang also threatened shop workers with hammers, knives and screwdrivers. group have now been jailed for more than 27 years after pleading guilty to conspiracy to rob.
rebecca hannibal, 19, has pleaded guilty to supplying her best friend georgina bartter with 'purple speaker' ecstasy pills. ms bartter died after taking the pills at the harbourlife dance festival in november last year. she was 19 when she collapsed on the dance floor and died from multiple organ failure. police alleged she bought the pills from her friend matthew forti, 19. ms hannibal had pleaded not guilty to single supply charge at a previous hearing but changed her plea to guilty. she will appear in court on june 10 for sentencing.
natasha elderfield, 41, is accused of murdering boyfriend robert dobinson, 33, on the banks of the river thames in abingdon, oxfordshire. court heard she chased her partner off boat after he arrived home to find her having sex with her lover. she told police officers who arrested her 'it's so funny'    mr dobinsons' trousers were around his ankles and he was found with stab wounds after she chased him off the boat.

islam will be the fastest growing religion in the world over the next four decades but christians will remain the largest group in 2050. number of christians in the us will decline from three quarters of population in 2010 to two thirds by 2050. percentage of atheists across the globe is expected to fall while muslims will outnumber christians by 2070. global buddhist population will remain roughly the same but hindu and jewish populations will be larger.

the vaccine is made from pieces of a protein called tarp that's found in about 95 per cent of prostate cancers. it teaches the immune system to recognise compounds found in prostate cancer cells. it is being given to men who have already been treated for the cancer. u.s. national cancer institute is using the vaccine on 70 men. it could be used as a first line treatment for prostate and potentially other cancers.
awel manyang, five, believes her three siblings who died in a melbourne lake crash were eaten by crocodiles. her mother akon guode crashed her 4wd into a lake at wyndham vale in melbourne's outer west on wednesday.    she was released from police custody after homicide detectives questioned her over the crash. her daughter awel remains in a serious condition at the royal children's hospital but remembers the accident. she believes her younger sister and two brothers were killed by a crocodile because the children associate the reptiles with water.

marie hunt of spring green, wisconsin, was born in 1911. unable to get to her high school six miles away, she dropped out of school and helped to care for her eight younger siblings. her hospice nurse contacted the local high school after she regretted not graduating. ms. hunt was presented with an honorary diploma 87 years after she would have graduated.
matthew bird, from ashburton, new zealand, quit his job as an agricultural adviser to become a mechanic. he was happy to give up his $70,000 a year pay check to pay $554 a month in child support payments. inland revenue recently amended their child support formula which took effect on april 1. mr bird has three children and was expected to pay around $1,900 a month.
senior constable neale mcshane has spent ten years working in birdsville in far south-west queensland. he is set to retire later this year as one of the most remotely stationed police officers in australia. the 59-year-old has spent 40 years as an officer in three different states. temperatures in the region can reach over 50 degrees, with a population of only 100 people. he said the isolation of the job was a far cry from his previous police work.

deaths in britain, which have been falling for 40 years, will start to go up and increase by 20 per cent over the next two decades. report by think tank predicts numbers of deaths will rise by 20% over next 20 years. price of a funeral is rising fast thanks to higher costs for cremation and undertakers' bills. more than half of uk households have less than £3,000 in savings and will struggle to cover funeral costs.
teller lake in boulder, colorado, has been invaded by 3,000 to 4,000 gold fish. wildlife officials say it started as someone dumping 'four or five' of their pets in the lake two or three years ago. the fish are not a native species and are threatening to over-run the natural species in the water. officials are now considering two options - electroshocking the fish or draining the lake.
nicole mihai, 34, was told by new zealand immigration that she must return to romania. she separated from her partner after a two-year relationship. the immigration agency told her she must leave her son, chris, behind. a ruling from the family court said her son must remain within 50 kilometres of his father. she vows to fight this battle until the end and will not give up her life with her son.
new research has found certain items on sale at poundland are up to 50 per cent more expensive than those sold in supermarkets. budget retailer last week announced sales exceed £1billion for the first time last year. shoppers are being charged more per unit of certain products compared with bigger retailers.

two cups of coffee and hormone drug tamoxifen can slash the risk of cancer returning by 50 per cent. researchers at lund university, sweden, found caffeine causes breast cancer cells to divide less frequently and divide more often. women recovering from breast cancer can also take a cocktail of the drug and two coffees a day.

the solar probe plus will carry four experiments into the corona and study the solar wind and energetic particles as they blast off the surface of the star. during the closest passes around the sun, temperatures outside the spacecraft will reach nearly 2,500 degrees fahrenheit. the launch window opens for 20 days starting on july 31, 2018. over 24 orbits, the mission will use seven flybys of venus to reduce its distance from the sun.
kuku kube is available for free on facebook, android, ios and on desktop browsers. it is designed to put your colour vision and eyesight to the test by showing boards of coloured squares. on each board, one of the squares is a slightly different shade of the same colour. players get a point for every correct square identified and have 60 seconds to find the odd square. scores lower than 11 are poor, and scores higher than 31 are considered 'great'

a preservation group says old texas dance halls that for years served as important social centers in rural areas of the state are decaying and closing, with comparatively few still operating. about 400 such halls still stand, but only two traditional dance halls continue to operate. about 1,000 dance halls sprung up around texas in the 1800s, knitting together german and other immigrant communities.

colleen harris, 73, was found guilty of murdering robert edward 'bob' harris in california home in 2013. it took the el dorado superior court jury less than two hours to convict her of first-degree murder. in 1985, she shot dead her second husband and the father of her three children, james batten, after claiming he was abusive to her. she will be sentenced for the killing of her third husband on june 5 and stands to receive 50 years to life for murder with a firearm. she first testified that bob harris may have committed suicide but later said it was an accident.

acetaminophen is the main ingredient in the over-the-counter pain reliever tylenol and paracetamol. it has been in use for 70 years, but this is the first study to show it can dull feelings of happiness and sadness. people who took the drug didn't appear to know they were reacting differently.

researchers sequenced the microbiomes of yanomami people living in a remote amazon village in venezuela who had not had previous contact with non-yanomami. they found that the group had the highest diversity of bacteria and genetic functions ever reported in a human group. the bacteria could be potentially beneficial to modern society.

hawaii scientists say a supervoid may account for an anomaly in the cosmic microwave background radiation (cmb) of the universe. in 2004 astronomers first found the 'cold spot' - a region 20 per cent less dense than elsewhere. at 1.8 billion light-years across it would be the biggest object ever found. the supervoid is thought to be causing a 'less-dense' region of the world. but some 'exotic physics' is also needed to explain what's happening.

a washington, dc-based company called united space structures wants to create a new space station. their giant cylinder would rotate four times per minute to create artificial gravity. it would be 1,300ft (400 metres) long, cost £200 billion ($300 billion) and take 30 years to build. a rotating station would allow people to live as if they were walking in space. to build the station, something like spiderfab could be used, a proposed system of robo-spiders.

scientists in california have described how to create artificial auroras on earth. they said a particle accelerator could be sent 185 miles (300km) up into space. it would then fire high-energy beams back at earth's atmosphere. a beam fired from the machine could create auroras and even create lightning in the atmosphere. for now the idea is only a concept, and there are no plans to build it. they say a beam could be used to trigger different forms of lightning, including red sprites and blue jets.

study released on thursday by the centers for disease control and prevention found that about 30 percent of women who'd had a child became pregnant again within 18 months. experts say mothers should wait at least 18 months to give their body time to recover and increase the chances the next child is healthy. white women had the shortest spacing — about 2 years, 2 months on average.

a study found almost 30 million health records nationwide were involved in criminal theft, malicious hacking or other data breaches over four years. compromised information included patients' names, home addresses, ages, illnesses, test results or social security numbers. cyber-security experts say thieves may try to use patients' personal information to fraudulently obtain medical services.

nasa’s new horizons spacecraft has taken its first colour image of pluto and its largest moon charon. taken from a distance of 71 million miles (115 million km)    it will become the first spacecraft ever to visit pluto on 14 july this year - humanity's first ever visit to the dwarf planet. the spacecraft was launched on 19 january 2006 at a speed of 36,373 mph (58,536 km/h) and is now three months away from its arrival at pluto.
angela kelly, 67, spent many years wearing high heel shoes. she had almost no cartilage left in her knee and needed to have a titanium knee replacement. a new study suggests high heels can put dangerous pressure on knee joints. some women need invasive knee replacement surgery.
andrew sadek's body was found in a river with a bullet to the head nearly two months after going missing in may 2014. he had been working with a drug task force as a confidential informant after he was caught selling marijuana on campus. his mother, tammy believes that he signed his death warrant when he agreed to become a drug informant for police. an autopsy concluded that he died of the gunshot wound and that he had no drugs or alcohol in his system. a gun that fires the same caliber bullet is missing from his family farm.

researchers found traces of compounds in yarrow and camomile in the plaque of neanderthal teeth found in 50,000-year-old teeth. neanderthals may have used wild herbs to flavour the meat they ate to make it more palatable. there is already evidence that they cooked their food and may have cooked stews in the skins of animals. but new research suggests they may have also used herbs to improve the taste of their food.

larung gar buddhist academy is home to 40,000 monks and nuns, who study tibetan buddhism in the hills of larung gar valley in china. the settlement is the world's largest buddham settlement, home to more than 30,000 nuns and monks. the huts are made of red wooden huts, with no heating or toilets, and are segregated by age and sex.

13-page checklist from the gemini 4 mission in june 1965 is tipped to sell for a huge £80,000 ($120,000)   splatters of blood on the checklist were from an astronaut as he frantically battled to close the hatch door of the spacecraft. ed white was the first us astronaut to perform a spacewalk, but the hatch was difficult to open. it's thought one of them cut their hand or finger on the hatch locking mechanism and blood ended up on the document. but the mission ultimately proved successfully and paved the way to astronauts walking on the moon.

marks were found on the fossils of two adults and a child unearthed in the french region of poitou-charentes. similar marks have been seen at other neanderthal sites showing how our ancestors cut and fractured the bones of dead relatives. this is according to cuts seen on a number of fossils dating back 57,600 years. some neanderthals may have eaten deceased friends and family for food or in bizarre funeral rituals.

the photos were shot by linden gledhill from staffordshire, who combines his love of photography with a phd in biochemistry. the 51-year-old uses a modified microscope and a camera to capture the finer details of a butterfly's wing pattern. they show the layout of individual scales, which give the insect its iridescence. some of the scales look like exotic bird feathers, while others resemble autumnal leaves.

archaeologists discovered 20 stone flakes and anvils buried in sediment west of lake turkana in kenya. date of the stone tools is 700,000 years older than any other found previously. discovery could fundamentally change the current view of human evolution. stone tools were discovered by accident and are believed to be 3.3 million years old.

gaioz nigalidze, the current georgian champion, was expelled from the dubai open chess tournament. he was found using his smartphone in the middle of a match. his opponent lodged a complaint when he grew suspicious about his frequent trips to the toilet. tournament organisers found he had stored a mobile phone in a cubicle covered in toilet paper.
gordon jack, 47, was taken to hospital when emergency services were called to dunblane cathedral. father-of-three collapsed while covering the dress rehearsal of andy murray's wedding. murray was feet away from the photographer when he lost his balance and fell on a stone in the graveyard. he was placed in a medically induced coma and died this afternoon after complications following a heart attack.
kejonuma leisure land, in tohoku, japan, attracted 200,000 visitors per year in its heyday. the theme park closed its doors in 2000 due to a drop in visitors. urban explorer florian seidel, 38, visited the site in 2014 to document the park's ongoing dereliction. the park is reported to be jinxed by an ancient curse and is said to be one of the most underrated abandoned places in the country.
skopelos is known as the film location for mamma mia! and has a relaxed, offbeat vibe. the island is one of the most scenic in greece. it's a great place to rent a boat and explore the coastline by boat.
jim ratcliffe, founder of chemical company ineos, wants to build a 'carbon-zero' mansion overlooking the solent. the mansion has a jacking system which can lift the property up in the case of flooding. he wants to demolish the existing beach hut and replace it with the new mansion. the billionaire tycoon claims the mansion will be his only uk residence.
just four in 10 renters aged 20 to 45 are saving for a deposit to buy a home, according to research by halifax. three-quarters of uk renters also fear they will never be able to afford to buy their own home. the study found the three most common barriers to home ownership are high property prices and low incomes.

the '#kyliejennerchallenge' is sweeping social media, encouraging teens to blow their lips up using bottles or shot glasses. it is popular among teens desperate to emulate kylie jenner's bee-stung pout. participants place their mouth over the opening of a cup, jar or shot glass and suck in until the air vacuum causes their lips to swell up. many teens have been sharing the disturbing results of their experiments on twitter and instagram. the results are said to last for hours, even days, with people complaining of severe bruising.
patties foods says its testing has found no link between its nanna's brand frozen mixed berries and hepatitis a outbreak. 34 people in six states have contracted the hepatitis a virus. the health department continues to investigate how the outbreak occurred. four adults, three in victoria and one in nsw, have contracted hepatitis a. no hepatitis a or e.coli were detected in any sample of the recalled and non-recalled nanna’s frozen berries.

two-thirds of new uk fathers are now over 30. men are able to produce sperm throughout their lives but the quality declines. men aged over 35 have a 50 per cent lower chance of conceiving. advanced paternal age increases the risk of epilepsy, autism and breast cancer.
the government's drug regulator has approved a remedy containing a traditional chinese herb. phynova joint and muscle relief contains sigesbeckia, a herb traditionally used to treat arthritis. many orthodox doctors recommend herbal medicines for colds and depression. turmeric, st john's wort and hypnotherapy for bowel trouble are also popular.

researchers from the uk and portugal looked at 477 anatomical features across 81 individual dinosaurs. since 1903, experts have been arguing the creature was originally misnamed as 'apatosaurus'   but fossils that were originally labelled brontosaurus appeared different from two apatosaurus species. most of the differences were in tiny anatomical features, but one was a wider neck. the scientists claim that three known species of the giant dinosaur exist.

the caves are found near the mutnovsky volcano, 45 miles (72km) south of kamchatka, in the russian far east. the rainbow caves are given their various colours by light refracting through the ice. they are lit up by flares and fire-breathing to create a kaleidoscope of colours. the caves were captured by local guide and photographer denis budkov.
the archive of 52 celluloid negatives show captain scott's doomed expedition team heading off on the ill-fated terra nova expedition of 1912. some of the pictures show the herd of ponies the team used to haul the sledges on the 800 mile trek to the south pole. the negatives were sold at auction for £36,000 to an unnamed buyer. they were part of a huge 1,700 image archive gathered by official photographer herbert ponting.

colonel muammar gaddafi's bab al-aziziya palace in tripoli was a symbol of fear and terror to libyans. the compound was destroyed by nato in a 1986 air strike and later by rebels four years ago. the palace was once home to a zoo, indoor pool and a fairground - but is now a wasteland of rubble.
three studies have provided different theories for what happened after earth was struck by a mars-sized object called theia, 4.45 billion years ago. three studies provided conflicting theories on why the moon and earth are so similar in their composition. the university of maryland team examined the tungsten isotopic composition of two moon rocks. it claimed theia was similar to earth, and another that earth and the moon were showered by debris. what is agreed on, though, is that the impact of theia with earth happened and created the moon.
the chancellor appeared to leave the door open when asked if he would be 'depriving more families' of child benefit. more than a million households lost out when the coalition cut the payments. the conservatives say they would cut £30billion of spending if they win a second term.
lizzie cochran, a student at columbia university, has launched a kickstarter campaign to fund her upcoming fashion line epidemia designs. the clothing line will feature patterns from microscopic images of diseases and other biological structures. lizzie came up with the idea for the fashion line after studying biology under a microscope. the company has nearly reached its goal of $15,000. 15 per cent of the profits will go to funding projects aimed at reducing the impact of preventable diseases and expanding medical care access.

arthur and mo kreitenberg have created a robot, called the germfalcon, which uses ultra violet light to kill bacteria throughout the cabin. the device is the size of a drinks cart and uses motion sensors to navigate the aisles. germs can survive for up to a week on aeroplanes and are a breeding ground for e.coli and mrsa.

pilots and flight attendants eat the same meals that are provided to passengers. it's not as simple as turning a key or pushing a button to start a plane. pilots and cabin crew sleep and go to the loo in separate rooms on long-haul flights. the captain and co-pilot eat different meals to reduce the risk of food poisoning.
the molalla log cabin was constructed as early as 1795 - ten years before lewis and clark reached the pacific ocean. historic building repairer gregg olson and architectural historian pam hayden believe the cabin could have been built by a small settlement of russians as farmers to feed fur traders in alaska. the cabin's construction is unlike pioneer building methods, suggesting it was created by foreigners. the log cabin has been used as a home, animal shelter, machine shed and granary.

sour cherries contain high levels of antioxidants and can help a person sleep. avocados are a great source of healthy, mono-saturated fats and lower bad cholesterol. blueberries have been linked to a range of health benefits including improved heart health and cancer prevention. and pumpkin seeds are thought to help sleep, improve mood and boost eyesight.

jennifer pagonis was in fact born intersex, meaning she is genetically male and has the reproductive organs to match. the 29-year-old from chicago has androgen insensitivity syndrome, a very rare disorder affecting 1 in 20,000 which prevents a womb from growing and causes testes to grow in the abdomen. she was born with an enlarged clitoris, no uterus and a partial vagina. she now uses the first name 'pidgeon' and works as an artist and intersex activist against surgery.

eating peanut kernels without their skins can improve gut health and the ability to ward off bugs like e.coli. flour made from peanut kernel stimulates the growth of friendly bacteria, research by the university of maryland found. but peanut skin had the opposite effect and promoted growth of harmful bacteria.

music can bring out specific flavours - including sweet, salty and bitter - in a range of food and drink. listening to the right sort of music, including the beatles, can enhance flavours in certain foods. deep tones of luciano pavarotti's nessun dorma can enhance the bitterness in coffee and the intensity of a chocolate mousse. the right music can also enhance the taste of wine by up to 15 per cent, according to psychologists.

the ink illustration appears to show the jedi knight yoda in a medieval manuscript. it comes from a 14th-century manuscript known as the smithfield decretals. the drawing is part of a bizarre representation of the biblical story of samson. it shows a cloaked creature with long, spiky hands and protruding ears . it is not clear which character ‘yoda’ is meant to be in the tale and is simply a whimsical addition to the page.

researchers at jyväskylä university in finland say eye-spots on the wings of owl butterflies mimic the eyes of owls to scare off predators. scientists have long suspected the pattern was an example of mimicry but it has never been clearly tested. great tits were shown images of owl butterfly with and without eyes to see if they were scared by the patterns.

researchers isolated bacterial dna of several strains of tuberculosis from bodies of mummies found in the crypt of a church in vác, hungary. found 14 different strains of the disease and traced them back to a single source. mummies were discovered in the 18th century crypt of the dominican church in the city. all of the strains were found to have been infected with a single strain of tuberculosis.

the great dying, which struck the earth 252 million years ago, wiped out more than 96 per cent of the world's creatures. volcanic eruptions are commonly blamed for triggering the event. but research by the university of edinburgh found the majority of species were killed when the oceans became more acidic. they claim volcanic eruptions released huge amounts of carbon dioxide which was absorbed into the oceans and changed their chemistry. as carbon dioxide was released into the atmosphere, global temperatures soared and this caused oceans to get hotter. this caused a lack of oxygen in the oceans, killing off marine life and destroying food chains. the study is the first to show that highly acidic oceans were to blame for the

the average nfl player makes $3.2million over the course of a career. nearly 16percent of players are bankrupt within 12 years of retiring from the league. despite earning millions of dollars - sometimes tens of millions - former players go broke at the same rate as the rest of americans. the rate of bankruptcy remained the same no matter how long players were in the nfl.
conservative party supporters are most likely to opt for a window seat on the plane. scottish national party are the biggest sun lovers of all the political parties. green party supporters love a long-haul trip and labour are the most inclined to dance on holiday. ukip supporters are the least likely to book a romantic holiday with their partner.    liberal democrats prefer to eat airline food rather than bring their own meal.

adele sarno, 85, has been living in her two-bedroom apartment for more than 50 years in manhattan's little italy neighborhood. her landlord is the italian american museum which is dedicated to the legacy of italian-americans and is situated below her home. she received a letter seeking to increase rent to the market rate of $3,500 a month, far more than she can afford . the grandmother tried to go through the courts to see if the city's rent regulation laws could help, but it was determined that her apartment wasn't covered.
