scientist ryan consell studied the composition of modern steel and welding techniques to create a valyrian steel sword. according to the game of thrones books, it is a form of super strong and light metal forged using westerosi magic. the secret to forging it was said to have been lost with the doom of valyria. but consell found it could be possible to make a similar weapon using bona fide chemistry. he concluded that modern steel is a metal matrix composite, not a steel at all.

human bones found in gough's cave in somerset had the flesh cut from them before being chewed and crushed. tooth marks found on many of the bones suggest people indulged in ritual cannibalism. human skulls found in the cave had been carefully shaped into cups and bowls.
jean sharon abbott, 38, from plymouth, minnesota, was told she had spastic diplegia, a form of cerebral palsy, when she was just four-years-old. the mother-of-three was diagnosed with the rare muscle disorder at the age of 33. after three decades of suffering from muscle spasms, weakness and near immobility, she learned she was misdiagnosed. she was diagnosed as having dopa-responsive dystonia (drd), a rare, yet treatable, muscle disorder. jean insists she feels no resentment or anger about her doctor's life-changing error.

play double falsehood was said to be a forgery by theatre impresario lewis theobald in 1728. it was an adaptation of a shakespeare play and claimed to be written by the bard. but new study of the language of the play'strongly identifies' shakespeare as the true author. research by the university of texas analysed 33 plays to build up a psychological profile of the writer. found shakespeare was likely to be sociable and fairly well educated.

exposure to a wide range of bacteria is necessary to prime the immune system early in life. a lack of bacteria in the gut means we are less equipped to deal with germs. modern obsession with hygiene and cleanliness has driven a boom in allergies and health problems. people in the us had smaller collection of bacteria than people from papua new guinea.

a report suggests that carbon dioxide produced by burning fossil fuels could be captured and used to produce the fizz in cola. many nations are looking into carbon capture and storage technologies as a way to cut greenhouse house emissions. australian government report suggests the gas could be used to make fizzy drinks. it's estimated that 3,299 tonnes of carbon dioxide are released every day from people drinking cola . but there are concerns over storing huge amounts of carbon underground.

created by artist paul erard in the swiss city of la chaux-de-fonds, the petite pistol measures just two inches long but fires with one joule of power. the gun currently holds the guinness world record for the smallest working revolver. the 2.34 calibre bullets the gun fires were designed specifically for it by former watchmaker. weighing just 0.6 ounces, the mini-revolver can be made to order in solid gold and costs £300,000 to make.
scientists detected the complex organic molecules in a disk of gas and dust around a star 455 light years away. the discovery is a boost for finding alien organisms and suggests the conditions that spawned life on earth are not unique to our solar system. radio telescope observations showed the disk surrounding the million-year-old star mwc 480 to be 'brimming' with the building blocks of life.

dep deposit containing the bone was discovered during excavations ahead of a new pipeline in landford, essex. it is thought to date to 5,600 bc and could re-write the history of mesolithic, or middle stone age burial practices. the discovery of cremated bone was thought to be the earliest ever identified in britain . it was placed into a pit with a diameter of about three feet and was found by oxford archaeology. three radiocarbon dates have confirmed the remains are around 7,614 years old.
random darknet shopper was a computer program designed to buy and sell items on the deep web. it bought trainers, jeans, cigarettes, masterkeys and a dvd case containing 10 ecstasy tablets. the robot bought the drugs and put them on display in an exhibition in st gallen, switzerland. police raided the exhibition and seized the computer and the drugs. the drugs were found to contain 90mg of the class-a drug mdma and were destroyed.

the distinct tracks found at ileret in kenya are the oldest human footprints in the world. a total of 99 prints were found on the shoreline of a lake and belong to a group of hunting parties. the prints were made by a homo erectus and are believed to have been left by a hunting party 1.5 million years ago. it is the strongest evidence yet that the human ancestors were sophisticated hunters.
satellite images show a massive sandstorm sweeping across much of the arabian peninsula. it caused traffic accidents, the cancellation of hundreds of flights and flight cancellations. the sandstorm was almost as large as the united states and reached as far east as india and pakistan. it began on april 1 and caused chaos across saudi arabia, oman and the united arab emirates.
tens of thousands of aussies are using overseas accounts to access the us-restricted streaming service hbo now. hbo has warned users they will be cut off on april 21. users are using virtual private network technology to bluff their way around geographic restrictions. the network will deactivate accounts of users who are accessing foreign content. users have claimed they will go back to illegal downloading if cut off.
'rogue planets' could offer scientists a new avenue in their search for alien life. life can still form on rogue planets without a star to provide heat. this is according to sean raymond, an astrophysicist from bordeaux. rogue planets are of interest to astronomers because they could harbour extra-terrestrials.

underweight people are a third more likely to be diagnosed with diseases such as alzheimer's than those of a healthy weight. obese people appear to be protected against dementia, with a risk around 30 per cent lower. previous studies have suggested being fat with a high body mass index could raise risk.

the annual cost of gun violence in the u.s. is more than apple's annual revenue and the cost of the obesity epidemic combined. independent political magazine mother jones carried out a three-year investigation into the cost to taxpayers. although gun homicides are on the decline, 80,000 people were injured by guns in 2012. the yearly cost to send someone to prison for a gun-related homicide is $414,000.

the earth experienced its hottest month of march since record-keeping began in 1880. last month's average temperature of 56.4°f (13.6°c) was the hottest march on record. it was 1.5°f above the average for the 20th century. the first three months of 2015 have all set new high temperature marks for the world. noaa blames the heat on a combination of el niño and human-made climate change.

sonnenspeicher uses a lithium iron phosphate battery to store energy harnessed by solar panels. energy is used throughout the day, and any excess is stored for when the sun goes down. traditionally, energy gathered during the day is sent back to the grid to be used for power. german firm automatic storage device has created the sonnenspeicher to store this excess energy. it uses a smart battery that automatically controls the charging and discharging of energy. the system is independent of the national power grid and can be used to power a home until the sun rises again.

fast-casual chain chipotle says that it does not know when it will have enough pork to supply all of its stores with sustainably raised meat for its carnitas burritos. only five per cent of pigs in the us are raised in a way that meets chipotle's strict standards. chipotle removed carnitas pork from roughly a third of its locations in january. it only uses pigs that are raised outside or in living spaces with large supplies of straw. the chain says that constraints on receiving supplies that met its standards led to 6.3 per cent price increases last year.

overweight people are less likely to develop dementia. study's lead researcher said the results are a'surprise', but  it's no excuse to pile on the pounds. being overweight reduced the risk of premature death by six per cent. being underweight increased the dementia risk by 39 per cent .

norwich scientists have developed an adaptor for colour blindness. called eye2tv can be plugged into any hdmi port on a tv or a computer monitor. a remote control or app then adjusts the colour adjustment. it allows colour blind people to watch shows they otherwise couldn't. the team from the university of east anglia in norwich is seeking funding on kickstarter.

actor ryan reynolds was the victim of a hit-and-run in a hotel parking lot, according to his publicist and vancouver police. the incident took place on friday when the 38-year-old was struck by a car while walking in the residential parking garage of the shangri-la hotel. the vancouver-born actor was left uninjured following the incident. he has been in the city for weeks as he shoots scenes for his new film deadpool.
the car, which was carrying 12, crashed when a blown tire caused the 2006 ford expedition to overturn saturday in martin county, central florida. father, uriel miranda, 38, and his two-year-old daughter yaretsi miranda were not wearing seatbelts.    all 12 passengers were relatives from apopka and half of them weren't wearing seat belts. the driver and a 7-year old boy were treated at a hospital and released.
the uss independence is resting 800m underwater off california's farallon islands with its hull and deck very well preserved and clearly visible. experts found the giant u.s. ship standing upright and listing only slightly. there also appears to be a plane in the hangar bay of the vessel. the veteran ship even survived an atomic bomb test after being decommissioned in 1946.
tokyo's narita airport has installed running tracks in its new terminal 3 in honour of the 2020 olympics. to save money, the airport installed the cushioned tracks to celebrate the event. the newly-opened terminal 3 is primarily used for departures and arrivals of low-cost carriers.

sons and brothers of convicted sex offenders are four to five times more likely to be convicted of sex crimes. research analysed dna from 21,566 men convicted of sexual offences in sweden. only 2 per cent of cases could be explained by shared environmental factors. genetic traits are developed through interaction between genes and the environment. but this finding is unlikely to help prevent sex crimes or catch offenders.

palaeontologists led by scott persons believe they can tell males and females apart from certain tail bones. paleontologists at the university of alberta examined fossils of small feathered male dinosaurs. they say that the key differences between the sexes lie in bones near the base of the tail. the researchers suspect that male oviraptorosaurs shook their tail feathers in intricate displays to woo potential mates.

people with rapid eye movement sleep behaviour disorder (rbd) move around in their sleep and 'act out' their dreams. up to 90 per cent of people with the condition will develop a neurological condition, a study found. about half of those with rbd will develop parkinson's disease or another neurological disorder within a decade of being diagnosed. it could be an early warning sign of the disease.

around 1.3 billion chinese people marked the qingming festival, a three-day holiday in china, by travelling home to their ancestral villages to clean and tidy the graves of their ancestors. a record-breaking 36.5 million passenger trips were made over the public holiday - up 5.8 per cent on last year. as part of the annual 'tomb sweeping festival', chinese mark the start of spring with outdoor celebrations.

foreign-born blacks made up just 3.1 per cent of the black population in 1980, but made up 8.7 per cent in 2013. about 50% of black immigrant population hail from the caribbean and 36 per cent come from africa. immigrants from jamaica and haiti make up about a third of the foreign-born black population.

google wallet says it has changed its policy when storing users' funds. currently, funds are not protected by the federal deposit insurance corporation. as a non-banking institution, google wallet is not legally required to be federally insured. funds in wallet balance will now be stored in multiple federally-insured banking institutions. this is good news for users of the mobile transfer service.

lawrencium was first discovered in 1961 by the nuclear scientist ernest lawrence. it currently sits at the bottom of the periodic table at the end of a separate block from the main table. but researchers have measured the ionisation potential of the element for the first time. the element may have properties similar to sodium and potassium and should be placed in the main periodic table.

the map reveals average yearly counts of lightning flashes per square kilometer from 1995 to 2013. the democratic republic of congo was found to have the most over the period. the highest amounts of lightning occurs in the far eastern democratic republic and lake maracaibo in northwestern venezuela. according to the satellite observations, lightning occurs more often over land than it does over oceans.

kola fireball had a 'disturbingly similar' path to asteroid 2014 ur116, which is due to pass by the moon in 2017. it was spotted on april 19 last year near the russian-finnish border. researchers used camera footage to recreate its trajectory and create a computer model. it compared the orbit of annama meteorite with the evolution of a dozen orbits of near-earth asteroids.

nasa's messenger spacecraft is currently 18 miles above mercury's surface after using the last of its fuel to push it higher into orbit. it has spent four years orbiting the closest planet to our sun. messenger is expected to smash into the planet's surface on 30 april. but as it drops closer to the surface it is sending back some of the most detailed images ever taken of mercury. among the images are images of 2km high cliffs that formed as mercury has cooled and contracted.

government has invented 22 ways of criminalising the public every month. legislative splurge is equivalent to introducing a new law for every working day. it includes diving into the thames without authority and queue-jumping at tube station. between may 2010 and may 2014 ministers created 1,073 offences.
school leaders warn the 'bleak' situation is likely to worsen due to rise in pupil numbers and 'greater competition'   london schools are experiencing the most problems finding teachers in english, maths and science. some posts attract only one or two applicants, according to survey by association of school and college leaders.

china has suffered four massive sandstorms since the start of the year - the fourth this year alone. experts cannot pinpoint the reason behind the spate of massive dust storms but say it is variable. experts say climate change can make some areas more susceptible to the storms. this week incredible footage showed the moment a massive sandstorm blocked out the sun in belarus.
the h5n2 bird flu virus has been found at a farm in iowa that held nearly 10 percent of the state's egg-laying chickens. up to 5.3 million hens must be culled. seven other midwestern states have been hit by the virulent strain of bird flu. nearly 7.8 million turkeys and chickens have been killed since march. minnesota has had 28 turkey farms hit. the u.s. department of agriculture officials say the virus could be a problem for several years.

the new map allows astronomers to'stand' on planetary surfaces and could help explain how water and lava once flowed across mars. it is made up of individual 30 to 60 mile (50 to 100km) wide strips of imagery. scientists from the german aerospace center combined the images together to create a single complete 3d map of the red planet. the map allows scientists to create 3d models of the surface of mars and could be used to explain how the planet was formed.

a university of cologne scientist led research proposing a new theory. it suggests temperatures at earth's equator were -40°c (-40°f) 2.4 billion years ago. it says the entire earth was subjected to a ‘deep freeze’, with the oceans turning into ice. the reasons why the whole planet was frozen are not understood. but it could have implications for finding life on frozen moons like europa.

ministry of defence 1, also known as 'churchill's toyshop', was a weapons laboratory set up in 1939 by winston churchill. it was a top-secret british war lab set up by the prime minister of britain. many of the inventions were developed in the lab, but some played a vital role in ending world war two. the panjandrum was a giant wheel covered in rockets and the time pencil was a hidden detonator.

the trackyourdose app was developed by germany-based firm esooka and uses a mathematical model developed by scientists and meteorologists. the £1.49 ($1.99) ios app keeps a record of a user's personal radiation including exposure from changes in a person's location and flights. it was developed to track cosmic radiation from air travel and medical examinations.

the white house declined to give embattled drug enforcement administration chief michele leonhart a vote of confidence today as two news networks reported that she will soon resign. her anticipated departure stems from concerns that agents of the federal drug agency divulged secrets at sex parties with prostitutes that drug lords in colombia may have staged to elicit sensitive information. she said there was 'no evidence' that sensitive information had been leaked but it's 'absolutely' possible that information was compromised. a congressional committee will investigate the claims.
mohamed badie and 13 other defendants were found guilty of plotting unrest from cairo protest camp in july 2013. 37 people, including an american-egyptian citizen, were sentenced to life in prison. mohamed soltan has been on a hunger strike over his detention for more than 14 months.
glenna kohl of barnstable spent years in the sun as a cape cod lifeguard and countless hours laying in indoor tanning beds while at college. she was diagnosed with melanoma after she found a golf ball-sized lump in her groin just before graduating from college in 2005. at just 26 years old, glenna died from the disease. her parents are now campaigning for a change to laws governing sunbeds in massachusetts.
the body-building community is in shock after the premature death of 42-year-old phil primmer. the darwin man died after collapsing at his gym on thursday. he had reportedly been to see a doctor to seek treatment for neck pain when he died. he was given cpr but it was too late by the time emergency services arrived. phil won the 2012 and 2013 national amateur body building association’s southern hemisphere championships. he leaves behind his wife and two children.
breast cancer is the second most common cause of death from cancer among american women, claiming nearly 41,000 lives a year. u.s. spends $4billion a year on unnecessary medical costs for women aged 40 to 59. it is made up of $2.8bn from false-positive mammograms and $1.2bn from breast cancer overdiagnosis.
the prime minister said voters were not ‘fully sure’ about the tories at the last election but would back them this time. he said he only needed 23 seats to win a majority and admitted he would be seen as a failure if he failed to do so. mr cameron said nothing made him ‘more angry’ than being called the party of the rich.
soldiers were found buried in a farmer's field in comines-warneton, belgium, in 2008 and 2010. their identities are unknown, and no relatives have been found. four of the six soldiers were identified thanks to their uniforms. it is thought they were killed in the first months of world war one. the men were buried in prowse point military cemetery - known as 'known unto god'

some brands contain more than a day’s recommended intake of sugar in a single 300ml serving of soft drink. local government association found some cans contain twice the recommended daily limit for adults. ocean spray cranberry classic juice drink was found to have 11g of sugar per 100ml, which is more than the amount in a can of coca-cola.

nasa scientists in california have released new images of dwarf planet ceres. they were taken by the dawn spacecraft from a distance of 21,000 miles (33,000km)   the spacecraft is beginning to move closer and closer to ceres and it will soon study the whole planet. however, the images have not yet revealed what the mystery ‘bright spots’ on the surface of the world are.

scientists reviewed 20 different studies of penis size, including 15,521 measurements of penises from around the world. tracey investigate various sexual statistical claims and separates myth from reality. most men measure around 5.2 inches in length when erect with a 4.6 inch circumference. watching porn doesn't affect a man's ability to perform.

the question,'so when is cheryl’s birthday?' was one of 25 questions set in the singapore and asian schools math olympiad. it was set for 14-year-old students to work out. at first, it appears impossible to answer but the method used to work it out is known. the answer was july 16 and followed a series of logical steps to rule out other dates.
goldman sachs predicts population growth will slow to 1.25 per cent over the next three years due to low birth rates, high death rates and falling net migration. property prices are predicted to fall by up to 10 per cent in some states with economists tipping a housing surplus in 2017. sydney will be one of the only markets not to be hit by an oversupply of housing. the report predicts a 75,000 underlying surplus of established homes across australia by 2017.

latika bourke was adopted from india as an eight-month-old baby and grew up in regional australia. she was never interested in looking into her origins until she watched the movie slumdog millionaire. latika has visited india every year since 2012 and has become her second home. she visited the orphanage where she was born and was shown the only record of her time in the slums of india. the film was life-changing for latika and led her to a spiritual journey back to her home.
the east coast low weather system is causing strong winds and storm force winds to batter the nsw coast. an estimated 100,000 homes are without power across sydney, the central coast and hunter region. the stormy weather system hasn't hit nsw this strong since 2007 and is expected to be one of the longest lasting east coast lows ever. on monday 24 suburbs incurred 100mm of rainfall, with blacktown hit hardest. state emergency services have received 2400 call-outs and are preparing for more.

flow vr provides passengers with a virtual image of the horizon that mimics the movements of the aircraft. device uses accelerometers to detect the movement of the plane and displays it on the screen. flow ife's device could help to combat the conflict between eyes and inner ear that can lead to travel sickness. the device was designed by british engineers to combat air sickness.

psychologists from goldsmiths university of london, and ohio state university in the us studied more than 13,000 twins aged nine to 16 took part in the research. 40 to 50 per cent of the differences in children’s motivation to learn could be explained by genetic inheritance from their parents. genetics and non-shared-environment factors were found to have the largest effect on the children's motivation.

researchers at university of sheffield analysed people with a body mass index of 30 or more. found obese people fall into one of six categories: 'heavy drinking males', 'unhappy and anxious middle-aged', 'physically sick but happy elderly' and 'poorest'   findings suggest clinicians and policy makers should not target obese people as a whole, rather treat them according to the 'type' of obese person they are.

zapping the brain with a mild electric current can boost creativity by nearly eight per cent. scientists at the university of north carolina tested their theory using a 10-hertz current on the brain's of 20 volunteers. it was used to stimulate brain's natural alpha wave oscillations. as well as creativity, these oscillations are linked with depression.

swiss researchers measured the temperature of 'hot jupiter' hd 189733b.    researchers from the universities of geneva and bern in switzerland measured the atmosphere of the planet. they found the temperature reaches up to 3,000°c in the atmosphere and wind speeds are in excess of 620 miles per hour. the findings were made using a novel technique relying on sodium signals . the planet is 63 light-years away and is a gas-giant slightly larger than jupiter located 370 trillion miles from earth.
nasa scientists in california have revealed new images of the dwarf planet ceres. they reveal new views of the two brightest spots in a crater, however, scientists are still not able to explain what they are. nasa's dawn spacecraft has captured the images from the dawn spacecraft. dawn will begin its first science orbit around ceres on 23 april. several theories currently exist for what they might be, with the favoured being salt flats or ice - both reflecting sunlight .
company began as a single shop in burton-on-trent 25 years ago and has become europe's largest single-price discount retailer. total revenue over the 12-month period grew 11.8 per cent to £1.1billion. profits are expected to be £44million, with 60 net new stores opening in uk and ireland. founded by steve smith in 1990 then sold it for £50 million a decade later.

researchers at virginia polytechnic institute and state university have found a way to convert 100 per cent of the sugar in corn husks and stalks to make cheap hydrogen fuel. the breakthrough could one day see the fuel being produced locally. it could accelerate the take up of biogas for eco-friendly hydrogen cars, which emit only water. but the gas is expensive and is not easy to store. coconut kernels could be used to store hydrogen in gas form using carbon from the kernels.

jerusalem syndrome affects people visiting the holy city. first identified in 2000, it is characterised by anxiety, agitation and nervousness. people with the condition believe they are biblical characters. experts say condition is likely part of a broader psychosis, not unique to jerusalem. the need to be clean and perform sermons are two of seven stages of the syndrome.

flashgap is free for ios and android devices and is inspired by the end credits of 2009 film the hangover. photos and videos taken on the app disappear into a hidden album after three seconds. only people who attended the event can see the album, and users can only delete photos they took themselves.
the two chimps are the first animals in history to be granted the same rights as human prisoners. hercules and leo are currently living in a lab at stony brook university, long island. a representative of the university have been ordered to appear in court to respond to a petition by the nonhuman rights project. the chimps have been granted a writ of habeas corpus to challenge their detention.

st george's county asylum opened in 1818, the asylum once housed nearly 1,000 patients and expands over 350 metres in length in stafford in the west midlands. it closed in 1995 but is now set to be transformed into 102 apartments. patients were restrained by means of 'the leather muff,' 'iron handcuffs' and'restraint chair' and dysentery and syphilis were said to be commonplace.

the images were captured between 1850 and 1855 by photographer hugh owen and could fetch up to £30,000 at auction. the albumen prints were made in the 1870s from the original paper negatives of the early 1850s. they are believed to be some of the first ever taken of the city of bristol and were taken at the dawn of photography. many of the buildings pictured have changed dramatically between the 19th century and today.

the 'goblins' are created by gradual erosion of entrada sandstone over millions of years in utah's san rafael desert. once known as the mushroom valley, the area was first discovered by cowboys searching for cattle. goblin valley state park is a popular attraction for tourists visiting western america.

finley lamb suffers from rare brain abnormality periventricular nodular heterotopia. he was born with parts of his brain in the wrong place and has a 90 per cent chance of developing epilepsy. finley was unable to walk and talk and was told he would never walk or talk. but he defied the odds to take his first steps last year and now walks two miles to school.

garnet was established in the 1860s by miners looking for gold and silver, but was abandoned after a fire in 1912. the montana mining town was devastated by fire and deserted. the u.s. bureau of land management is offering free food, housing and a job to people willing to live in garnet and work as a tour operator. local folklore says the area is haunted by former residents, with visitors saying they hear music and laughter and the sound of doors slamming. garnet is set to become a new tourist stop as the government prepares the village to be a tourist stop.

researchers plan to drill 5,000 feet (1,500 meters) below the surface of the chicxulub crater in mexico. uk researchers studied the asteroid impact 66 million years ago. they found the heat near the impact site in mexico was not intense enough to ignite plant material. a heat pulse lasted less than a minute, too short to set plants alight. previous researcher has questioned the theory that a global firestorm accompanied the asteroid that killed off the dinosaurs.

natasha hope-simpson became disabled after her leg was crushed in a tragic hit-and-run accident in 2013 and she lost a part of her left leg below the knee. she received weekly angry notes on her windshield scolding her for parking in a handicap space. because her prosthetic leg was covered, someone thought she was lying about being handicapped. despite receiving the angry notes, natasha felt flattered that someone mistook her for someone who could walk normally. she is an artist and uses her disability to create wearable art.

researchers found a bronze and leather buckle and a bronze whistle at the 'rising whale' site in cape espenberg, alaska. trade was taking place between east asia and the new world hundreds of years before christopher columbus arrived in 1492. bronze-working had not been developed at this time in alaska, and researchers believe the artefacts were created in china, korea or yakutia.

psychologists at new york university have been trying to understand how the brain stores memories for 'emotionally neutral events' that gain significance. emotion increases our ability to remember by affecting activity in brain regions involved in emotional processing. strong emotion can strengthen memory for positive events, and for negative events. emotion also increases the strength of our memory over time - a process called consolidation. researchers said we remember highly emotional events better than neutral events.

yaphank, long island, was once home to a pro-nazi camp for nazis. the german american bund was a group of americans who supported the cause of the third reich. the town's streets were once named adolf hitler, goebbels and goering. the nazi camp was founded by friends of new germany and was one of several scattered across the u.s.   the bund organized military demonstrations where they waved both the american and nazi flags.

population was deemed healthy in hundreds of northern european fisheries analysed. cod stocks plummeted in the 1980s and 1990s after being heavily overfished. but industry has steadily recovered since regulations were put in place in 2006. one in nine fisheries operate sustainably, but 400 have serious failings in data management.

genetic analysis of bones of ‘altamura man’ has revealed they belong to a neanderthal who fell into cave 128,000 to 187,000 years ago. skeleton was found fused to the walls of a cave in altamura, italy, in southern italy. it was discovered in 1993 after an adult male fell down a sinkhole and starved to death. researchers analysed dna extracted from the bones and found he was a man who fell down the cave. the dna is the oldest to ever be extracted from a human skeleton.
the remains of friedrich  branft, 22, make the first complete skeleton to be recovered from the battle of waterloo. he was found under a car park at the waterloo battlefield and identified by historians. the soldier was identified as friedrich brandt, 23, a hanoverian hunchback who was killed by a musket ball lodged between his ribs. it took three years of research to identify the soldier.
researchers have found that bird species are continuing to drop in fukushima. scientists analysed 57 species in the region and found that the majority of populations had diminished as a result of the nuclear disaster in 2011. researchers at the university of south carolina. researchers have discovered that bird numbers have dramatically declined in the area. the barn swallow, for example, dropped from hundreds to dozens. this is despite radiation levels in the. region starting to fall. and comparing it to chernobyl could reveal what the future holds.
bar jellyfish have been spotted in water off the coast of devon and cornwall. experts believe they have been attracted by warmer waters and a lack of predators. the barrel jellyfish can grow up to six feet and weigh 55lb. fishermen have hauled in hundreds of the jellyfish each the size of a dustbin lid.
xylella fastidiosa bacteria has ravaged olive trees in the puglia region of italy. contributed to a 35 percent drop in the region's olive oil production last year. farmers have opposed the government's destruction plan, saying it won't stop the spread of the disease. first seven trees have been cut down and are to be burned today.

the chair has been on display at the henry ford museum in dearborn, michigan, for 85 years. on april 15, it will be removed from its enclosure to be displayed for the 150th anniversary of the assassination. abraham lincoln was shot in washington d.c.'s ford's theatre in 1865 by pro-confederacy actor, john wilkes booth. the chair has a dark stain on the back, which many visitors believe to be blood from the shooting. but historians at the museum say that the stain is oil from other people's heads.

susan farmer, 37, from eddy, texas, weighs 43st (605lbs) and was told by doctors to lose half her body weight or face death. she was told she would die unless she dropped more than half her weight. at her heaviest, she was unable to walk for more than 30 seconds at a time. her mother continued to buy her fatty foods and she lives with her mother nita.
yougov poll of more than 2,000 britons revealed we consume an average of 17 cups of tea each week. almost a third of women turn to a cuppa to make them feel better when they are unwell. research showed tea-drinking habits increase as we get older, with 55 and over drinking 21 cups a week.
the mysterious ‘antarctic bw29 signal was recorded near the orkney islands, south shetland islands and antarctic peninsula. experts are sure the noise isn’t made by arnoux's beaked whales or cuvier’s beaked whale, because the signal doesn't match their songs. but the song could belong to a strap-toothed whale, a southern bottlenosed whale or a gray’’, according to the study.
marilyn zuniga allowed her students to write to convicted police killer mumia abu-jamal after he became ill in prison. third grade class wrote 'get well soon' letters to him after he was hospitalized. she was suspended from her job as a teacher for allowing the letters. but she apologised and said the children wanted to send notes to him. abu jamal is serving a life sentence in prison after he shot philadelphia police officer daniel faulkner in 1981.
great grandfather bill dudley has worked at mcdonald's in mold, flintshire, north wales, for nine years. he works two days a week and says his job 'helps me stay young and i just keep going'   he joined the team nine years ago after growing 'bored' pottering around the house. he served in the royal navy during the second world war.
carlos manuel perez jr, 28, was killed inside high desert state prison in indian springs, nevada. he was fighting andrew jay arevalo, 24, inside maximum-security prison. a trainee corrections officer allegedly opened fire four times in a row trying to break up the fight. the blasts killed perez and left arevala with wounds to his face.
stéphane charbonnier, known as charb, finished his book two days before being murdered by jihadist gunmen. he argued that left-leaning intellectuals who denounced the cartoons were ‘ridiculous demagogues’ for doing so. he argues that some intellectuals who condemned the drawings were merely attention-seekers. he also defends charlie hebdo's controversial depictions of the prophet.
temperatures are due to rise throughout today and are set to peak at 22c (72f) tomorrow in the south east of britain. it will be the warmest temperature recorded this year and surpass the average daytime temperature for august. the department for environment, food & rural affairs has issued a warning to asthma sufferers of'very high' air pollution tomorrow.
governor mary fallin signed bill allowing state to use nitrogen gas as alternative method of death. nitrogen gas has never been used to execute humans before. executions in the state are currently on hold while supreme court rules on new lethal injection mix. it comes after a botched execution last year in which inmate writhed on gurney for 43 minutes.
more than 4,000 people, including hundreds of school children, lined the streets of dereham to wave farewell to the light dragoons. the reconnaissance unit is moving from robertson barracks in swanton morley to catterick, north yorkshire, after 15 years in the county. more than 250 men and women from the regiment marched through the town for the final time. they will hand over barracks to another unit in the summer and move 200 miles to their new home. the regiment has most recently served in iraq and afghanistan and has a 300 year history.
around 20 million people in the uk are expected to suffer hayfever symptoms this summer, up a third from last year. five million people are predicted to fall victim to the symptoms for the first time. by 2030, experts predict there will be 31.8 million sufferers of the allergy. warm weather and air pollution are contributing to the rise in the number of sufferers.
aracely meza, pastor's wife of a texas church, has been arrested in attempt to resurrect a two-year-old boy. boy identified by a witness as benjamin, is being held in the arms of aracely and pastor pastor daniel meza. she was arrested on monday and has been charged with injury to a child by omission. police went to a home on march 26 in balch springs to do a welfare check and were told a child had died. a witness said the boy was possessed by demons and went 25 days without food before he died. meza is reportedly not the child's mother and was arrested.
police say an inebriated sergio barrientos-hinojosa had his 13-year-old son take him to buy beer at the gas station in albuquerque, new mexico. police say he got into an argument with a customer and started shooting at the man. the father ordered his son to drive away while he fired his gun in the air. police were holding a dui checkpoint at the time of the incident. barriento was arrested late saturday. no one was injured.
hamilton college in clinton, new york, was placed on lockdown this morning in response to a bomb threat and threat of a shooting at kirner-johnson building. campus officials said someone called in the threat at 9.45am. police evacuated mcewen, milbank, babbitt, cafe opus and schambach buildings. a suspicious package was found in the building and police found it to be harmless. all classes at the private liberal arts college were cancelled for the day.
munira khalif, stefan stoykov, victor agbafe and harold ekeh have each been accepted to all eight ivy league schools. all four are the offspring of immigrant parents who moved to the u.s. from somalia, bulgaria, somalia or nigeria.    they hope to use the opportunities to improve education across the world or become a neurosurgeon.
sculptor of the i love lucy statue in celoron, new york, has pledged to make a new one for free six years after it sparked a hate campaign. even the famous madame tussaud's gets it wrong with some of the world's most offensive waxworks.
hilary border, 54, had power of attorney over her 83-year-old mother dorothy's affairs when her health deteriorated. mother-of-three was required to pay £300-a-week for the care home fees of her mother. border, from newark, nottinghamshire, stole the money and spent it on herself. border was sentenced to 16 months in prison, suspended for two years, at nottingham crown court.
primatologists at iowa state university recorded 300 hunts by chimps in fongoli, sénégal. they found female chimps are more likely to use the tools to help them hunt for food. males tend to prefer capturing prey with their hands. the chimps at fongolic are the only animals to regularly hunt for prey with tools.
michael brelo, 31, charged with two counts of voluntary manslaughter for the deaths of timothy russell, 43, and malissa williams, 30, in november 2012. he is the only officer charged because he jumped on the hood of a police car and fired 15 shots at the suspects. brelo's attorney said the officer had reason to believe he was being shot at when he opened fire on the car. the officers were chasing the suspects after a high-speed chase in cleveland, ohio, in which 137 rounds were fired at the car .

kfc opened up their kitchens to skeptics and fans alike on saturday. the fast food giant allowed hundreds of people to tour the back of 219 stores across australia and roam from freezer to fryer. kfc hoped to dispel myths around the quality and freshness of their ingredients and prove their chicken was fresh and cooked in the kitchen of each store. however health experts warned consumers not to equate kfc's attempts to be hygienic with healthiness.
woman in her 30s was kicked out of melbourne's greatest ever easter egg hunt after she told a 13-year-old volunteer to 'f*** off'   she was told by a volunteer she was taking too many eggs and told the volunteer to stop. the egg hunt was run by zaidee's rainbow foundation to raise awareness of organ and tissue donation. more than 2,500 chocolate lovers paid $5 to fill up their buckets at the event.
the 19th century castle toward, near dunoon, was used to ready soldiers for landing at a beach. it was commandeered by winston churchill to help prepare troops for the d-day landings. the castle was commissioned as hms brontosaurus in 1942 and is now on sale for £1.75m. overlooking the clyde estuary, castle toward was used as a training base for troops. many servicemen were killed in accidents during training at the castle, which was very realistic and demanding.
baby boy's body was found wrapped in a blanket in a sainsbury's bag floating on a pond in norfolk in 1988. police exhumed the body last year as part of a case review and a dna sample led to his mother. she was arrested on suspicion of infanticide but the charge was dropped. the woman told officers she had concealed the pregnancy from her family and friends. the baby was stillborn and was found by a group of teenagers in the pond. the boy was reburied at a church in the village of weasenham st peter last year.

real estate heir robert durst was arrested in new orleans in mid-march for the murder of his friend and writer susan berman in 2000. authorities found $44,000, marijuana and a revolver at his hotel room. his lawyers have asked for the return of $161,000 taken during his arrest. they say he got the money legally and it is not needed for evidence or subject to forfeiture.
molly schuyler won the 72-ounce steak dinner challenge at the big texan steak ranch restaurant in amarillo, texas on sunday. the 120-pound mother-of-four ate three steaks, three shrimp cocktails, three baked potatoes, three salads and three rolls in just 20 minutes. she beat the previous record for quickest steak dinner eaten by a competitive eater, set last year at the same restaurant. she earned $6,000 in prize money for the competition.
nigeria's new president muhammadu buhari said his government will do 'everything in their power' to find missing schoolgirls. more than 200 girls were abducted by boko haram militants from a nigerian school in chibok last year. buhari says he does not know if they will ever be found. march was held through abuja to mark the first anniversary of the kidnapping.
crowd source collection holds around 150 photographs taken by arthur syer, a 27-year-old man living in sydney. the detective camera was the first'secret' handheld camera. it was produced between 1883 and 1887. the photographs will go on display at the state library on saturday. they were taken with the very first hand held camera. the photos capture the true essence of life on the streets of sydneysiders in the 1800's.

holmesburg prison's 101-year history was filled with violent riots, bloody beatings and the cruel chemical experimentation on its inmates. since its construction in 1895, the philadelphia, pennsylvania prison housed some of the country's most dangerous criminals. nearly two decades after its closure in 1995, the prison's halls have fallen eerily silent. inmates were used as human guinea pigs to test chemical substances on inmates and disabled american citizens for money to buy cigarettes.

the 29-year-old american tourist drove into oncoming traffic in thailand and crashed into 13 vehicles. she was chased by police through the pattaya region for 30 minutes before they shot out three wheels of her car. officers broke the front passenger window of the vehicle to arrest her when she refused to open the door. the woman was bundled into a police car to protect her from an angry mob. she drove the wrong way down a busy road and injured two people.
jade wimsey went from a size 12 to 20 in four years as she guzzled up to seven cans of energy drinks a day. the 24-year-old from yorkshire weighed 17st 6lb and was the victim of cruel jibes at work. she is now a slim size 12 after losing six stone in 18 months by cutting out the fizzy drink.
u.s consumer advisory group says shrinking space on planes is putting our health and safety in danger. tests conducted by faa use planes with a 31 inch pitch, a standard which on some airlines has decreased. many economy seats on united airlines have 30 inches of room, while some airlines offer as little as 28 inches.

known as 'ogle-2014-blg-0124lb,' the gas giant was detected by the spitzer space telescope and the ogle warsaw telescope in chile. it is half as massive as jupiter and could help astronomers gain a better understanding of the distribution of planets in the milky way. most of the planets we know about are 10-100 times closer.

in 84 days from november 2013 to january 2014, the area around azle, texas, shook with 27 magnitude two or greater earthquakes. scientists believe these earthquakes were the result of high-pressure injection of drilling wastewater into the ground. this adds to other studies linked to earthquakes in oklahoma and southern kansas.

the tiny copper coin, which is smaller than a penny, dates from the iron age almost 2,300 years ago and suggests links between the south west of england and the mediterranean. it was found in silt after the river avon burst its banks between bristol and bath. experts have dated the coin to between 300 bc and 264 bc and say it came from the western mediterranean . the find suggests that the village of saltford was on a major trade route long before roman times. on one side of the coin shows an image of the goddess tanit, the chief deity of carthage, while on the reverse is a horse’s head.

australian mp andrew robb revealed one of the unusual methods he used to stave off depression. the minister for investment and trade battled depression for 43 years. he drove to work with a pen in his mouth to trick himself into thinking he was happy. mr robb also said he would force himself to sneeze by looking at the sun. he stood down from parliament in 2009 due to his battle with depression.
rebecca calder, 24, who was jailed for a year today, went out drinking on the same night she used her victims' bank card to withdraw cash. at her peak she was draining up to £300 a day from disabled couple's accounts. the family of the victims, a couple in their 80s, installed a spy camera and filmed her taking money. calder posted regular partying pictures of facebook not knowing the family. she was caught red-handed and jailed for 12 months after admitting nine counts of theft.
the pentagon announced tuesday plans to exhume and try to identify the remains of 429 sailors and marines killed on board the uss oklahoma during the december 7, 1941 surprise attack on pearl harbor. the ship capsized after being hit by nine torpedoes during the japanese assault. only 35 of the 429 men were identified and are currently buried as unknowns in honolulu's national memorial cemetery of the pacific. officials aim to identify up to 388 servicemen within five years.
tavon watson, 24, was driving a $220,000 lamborghini at the exotic driving experience at walt disney world in florida on sunday. his passenger, gary terry, 36, was pronounced dead at the scene. terry was the operations manager at the richard petty driving experience. watson was taking racing advice from terry when he lost control of the italian supercar and crashed into a guardrail at the speedway. he was taken to celebration hospital where he was hospitalized.
ronnie lungu was singled out as 'a marked man' by wiltshire police solely due to his race. his internal assessments were secretly downgraded to make him appear unworthy of promotion. the 40-year-old was passed over for promotion in favour of white colleagues. mr lungu said he was left 'upset' and 'angry' after being penalised because he was black. the employment tribunal ruled that he was unlawfully discriminated against on grounds of race. despite his treatment, he is still serving as a pc with the force.

max muggeridge, 19, from the gold coast caught a four metre tiger shark at the weekend. he reeled in the monster after a three hour battle with the four metre beast. he was camping on the tweed coast just across the nsw border with his girlfriend. the teenager spent three hours battling the beast to reel it in. he said it was one of the largest tiger sharks ever caught off a beach. the teen believes it could have been close to the world record size but he wasn't able to measure it.

more than 140 children have been removed from their classes at schools in washington because they did not have the required vaccination forms. health officials have warned a growing number of people are not getting vaccinated against measles. 143 pupils were removed from classes in spokane this week because they could not prove they had the required vaccinations. health experts have warned the country is in danger of being gripped by a measles pandemic. in february around 100 people were diagnosed with the virus across 15 states in america.

rhino horn trade is the third-largest illegal trade in the world, after arms and drugs. last year 1,215 rhinos were poached and killed in south africa - one every eight hours. poachers sell rhino horn which can make up to £47,000 a kilo. the last surviving male of the white rhino, sudan, lives under 24-hour guard.

as orthodox easter sunday was held, thousands of homemade rockets were aimed at church towers in the aegean island of chios by rival parishioners in a traditional'mock war'   the custom dates back to the 19th century, when the island was under turkish occupation. the annual 'battle' is held at the church towers of aghios markos and panagia erithiani.

park crescent west, next to regents park in london, was designed by buckingham palace architect john nash in the early 19th century. property developer pcw property holdings has submitted plans to demolish the grade i listed crescent and rebuild it as luxury flats. new development will be made up of 73 homes, ranging from studios to five-bed flats worth £15million. but nearby residents are furious at the plans, claiming years of noise and disruption will ruin their lives. crescent was originally designed by nash and replaced with offices and residential accommodation in 1960.

the boeing 757 was struck by lightning shortly after takeoff on a flight from reykjavik, iceland, to denver, colorado on tuesday. the plane continued its 3,700-mile journey and landed safely and no one was injured. it wasn't until after landing that passengers and crew discovered a gaping hole in the nose of the plane. pilots reported the lightning but continued on with the eight-hour flight. the lightning struck at a point in the plane where weather radars are housed.

native reds have been almost wiped out in the country, except for a few pockets in the north of england, the isle of wight and scotland. since 1952, 95% of red squirrels has been wiped out. but experts say there have been a number of sightings in windermere, in the lake district. experts say a lack of habitats caused them to disappear from the area.

the head of the drug enforcement administration, michele leonhart, is expected to resign soon, an obama administration official said tuesday. she has faced mounting pressure from congress, where some questioned her competence in the wake of a government watchdog report detailing allegations that agents attended sex parties with prostitutes. she was widely criticized for her response to the report and a group of lawmakers said she was 'woefully unable to change' the agency's culture. leonart has led the dea since 2007 and is the second woman to hold the job.

eddie raymond tipton, 51, of norwalk, iowa was originally charged with two felony counts of fraud for illegally playing the lottery. now prosecutors believe he used an intricate hack to ensure he won the $14.3million jackpot.   he was arrested in january and charged with having a friend collect his prize. he was accused of installing a self-destructing hack program to make sure his numbers were drawn.
experts from centre for international research in the humanities and social sciences in new york city studied neolithic ornaments to understand how farming spread. northern europeans in the neolithic period initially rejected the practice of farming. their findings show a bump in the road in the adoption of farming, which enabled groups of people to move away from foraging and hunting.
abc2's new show, tattoo tales, follows the customers of bondi ink, a tattoo parlour in sydney. jan bearman, 83, has a tattoo in memory of her daughter shell, who died in 2011. jan's daughter shelley died of complications from diabetes at the age of 56. jan has had a new tattoo inked on her shoulder every birthday for the past three years. jan said that her tattoos are a memorial and a way for her to carry her daughter with her.
french photographer and illustrator, thomas lamadieu, takes snaps of the sky in courtyards and built-up areas to create'sky art'    he travels the world to photograph the space between buildings in various cities to create the images. lamadua's aim is to'show a different perception of urban architecture and the everyday environment'
humane society international has captured images of baby seals being clubbed to death on canada's ice floes. this year's commercial hunt off the coast of newfoundland is the world's largest annual marine mammal slaughter. images show seals being shot and wounded before they are dragged onto a vessel and killed for their fur. government has authorised the killing of up to 468,000 baby seals in the commercial hunt. animal rights charity says the baby seals are 'dying a violent death for fur products nobody wants'   hsi says if the killing happened in view of the public 'it would have been shut down decades ago'

the aluminium battery was created at stanford university, california. it is said to be the first high-performance aluminium battery that is 'fast-charging, long-lasting and inexpensive'    the battery can also withstand more than 7,500 cycles without any loss of capacity. but the researchers said the battery has only half the voltage of lithium-ion technology.

a mansion that resembles an alien spaceship in the rain forest of far north queensland is on the market for $15 million. the home was designed by architect charles wright and won the australian institute of architects house of the year for queensland in 2014. it features six bedrooms, six bathrooms, five balconies, a helipad and a man-made lake. the property is located within 73 acres of daintree rainforest and fringes over 600 metres of queensland beachfront. it was inspired by stamps and was five years in the making.
56-page notebook is believed to be the only extensive turing manuscript in existence. was written in 1942 at bletchley park code-breaking headquarters in buckinghamshire. details his work on the foundations of mathematical notation and computer science. sold at auction for $1,025,000 (£698,000) at bonhams in new york on monday. part of the proceeds will be donated to charity. turing is best known for his contribution to cracking the code used by the germans in enigma.

rappers quavious marshall, 24, kirschnick ball, 20, and kiari cephus, 23, were escorted off the georgia southern university campus mid-performance on saturday night and taken into custody. all of the band members have been denied bond - meaning they might not fulfill their upcoming tour dates. multiple guns, marijuana and another undisclosed drug were found in their van.

25-ft long chunk of a fiberglass boat was found floating off the coast of oregon. live yellowtail jack fish, native to japan, were found inside the debris and are being housed in the oregon coast aquarium. an estimated 5 million tons of debris washed into the ocean after the 2011 japanese tsunami.
spending in restaurants has increased by 17 per cent in the last 12 months, study shows. spending on women's clothes grew by 6 per cent over the last year, and 4 per cent for men. a fifth of people are delaying a major purchase until after the general election. low grocery and household bills has encouraged people to spend more.

the tennessee supreme court postponed execution dates for leroy hall jr, 48, donald wayne strouth, 56, nicholas todd sutton, 53, and abu-ali abdur'rahman, 64. the last four men are on the state's death row. new lethal injection methods are being challenged and problems obtaining lethal injection drugs have stalled new executions. electrocution has been designated as a backup method. the court is waiting for verdicts about the constitutionality of the lethal injection drug pentobarbital .

jessica silva reveals on 60 minutes why she had to kill her abusive partner james polkinghorne. she was convicted of manslaughter for stabbing him to death in mother's day 2012. she visited the home of his father to explain to him why she killed his son. michael usher, the journalist who conducted the interview, said silva walked away from the interview 'totally drained'   jessica says she hopes his family can one day forgive her for what she did.   she was living in fear and violence and she told no one about the abuse.
study looked at the voting habits of 2,355 twins born in the uk. aim was to explore how much nature and nurture influence our party political allegiances. identical twins were more likely to vote the same way than non-identical twins. voting conservative was strongly influenced by genetics, with 57 per cent of the variability due to genetics.
skeletons were found on top of one another in a tomb dating to between the 5th and 6th century in korea. it's thought that the tomb was intended for a noblewoman and her lover. the man is believed to have been a human sacrifice and his bones were found in the tomb. some experts say the set-up could even have been designed to show two people having sex. both the woman and the man are thought to have died between the ages of 20 and 30. archaeologists believe that the man may have been killed so he could be buried with her.

a poll of 2,000 britons found 68 per cent had hurt themselves doing odd jobs or decorating. two in five had injured their back, one in five cut themselves and one in ten had suffered side effects from chemical fumes. men are more likely than women to try to cut corners when doing a job.

spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration. until 1.4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast spain. but then the climate warmed to 13°c (55°f) and became more humid. this enabled hominins - our distant ancestors - to move to new regions .
london-based designer claims to have made the world's safest bike. called the babel bike it has a host of features including a roll cage. crispin sinclair is seeking £50,000 of funding on site indiegogo. the bike also has foot protectors and an electric motor. it was designed by london- based crispin sinclair - son of the famous british inventor sir clive sinclair.

holly barber, 25, woke up feeling unwell and with chest and neck pains but thought it was just a bad hangover. she started coughing up blood and was having difficulty breathing so rushed to hospital. doctors found she had 13 pulmonary embolisms - blood clots blocking the arteries in her lungs. she was told she was days from death and was diagnosed with another blockage a year later. ms barber believed she was being paranoid and thought she was just having a hangover . she has since given up drinking and taken up exercise to lead the healthiest life possible.

hayley grimes, 42, found baby peter's body in a pond in norfolk in 1988 and was accused of being his mother. she was a teenager when she found the baby's body wrapped in a blanket and a bag. the boy's mother was arrested after police used dna profiling to trace back to his family. she told officers she had put the body in the lake after a stillbirth. but ms grimes said she was scarred after being accused of dumping the baby and was 'blamed' by locals. the mother was later arrested on suspicion of infanticide but the charge was dropped.
doctors at imperial college london took a new look at caesar's symptoms described in greek and roman documents. caesar collapsed at the battle of thapsus in 46bc and historians have long believed it was result of an epileptic attack. mini-strokes can explain a number of symptoms better than epilepsy. for instance, caesar was known to suffer from depression towards the end of his life.
baroness hale of richmond wants to see the bitterness taken out of most matrimonial disputes. wants couples to be made to sort out arrangements for children and money before divorce. around 120,000 couples divorce in england and wales each year. lady hale was behind the move for 'no fault' divorce 20 years ago.

the tunnels were dug into sandstone cliffs along the river mersey in stockport, greater manchester, in the 1930s. they were originally intended to be turned into a car park, but were turned into an air raid shelter. the shelter was so popular that officials had to issue season tickets to limit the number of people who could hide there. the tunnels could hold 6,500 people, and was converted into a museum.

the optimal case was designed by israel-based amited. it was designed to warn you when your phone is getting too hot and cool it down. optimal is fitted with temperature sensors, resistance coils and two built-in micro-fans. sensors monitor the phone's temperature and if it gets too hot, optimal will cool the device using fans. the case can also be used to heat a phone using resistance coils if it is too cold. optimal will be available for pre-order for apple, nexus and nexus nexus phones.

gold and silver bullion was loaded onto the hms ulster queen in 1942 and was being transferred to the u.s. as payment for weapons. but the case of precious metals was lost overboard in the river clyde. it was to pay the americans for arms shipped to russia during the war. a secret diary kept by one of the engineers on the ferry was the only evidence of the blunder.

dr teresa belton believes there are simple things we can do to increase happiness. author of happier people healthier planet, dr belton, says they are all free. simple acts such as straightening posture and joining a community choir can increase wellbeing. she says people living modestly tend to find more satisfaction in their lives.

new tool downloads a search history of every google search you ever made while logged into a google account. users can download entire search archive, or delete part, or all, of the record. exports searches to google drive in a zip archive, with files divided by year and quarter.

the men fish without the aid of a rod with this unusual method, which was first practiced in 960 ad. each morning, fishermen in guilin, china, release a cormorant bird, which then dives into the water and retrieves a carp. the stunning images were captured by a russian photographer called viktoriia rogotneva. the men fish on the river li in guiliin each morning with just a bird, a gas lamp and a net.

sue sharp, 57, bought leg of lamb from asda in midlothian, scotland, to support fellow farmers. but she was shocked to find a stamp on the meat saying it was from new zealand. asda said it was a one-off and that the lamb was born, reared and slaughtered in the uk.
steven and sarah nick built up the huge arsenal, including a 50-caliber machine gun and a sniper rifle. many of the 30 weapons were legally owned, but couple are accused of stealing more than $50,000. police raided the home of steven nick, 33, and his wife sarah, 32, in michigan. the couple are facing a combined total of 15 felony charges. it is alleged they stole mrs nick's 67-year-old mother's savings to fund the haul.
four out of ten people say prince charles should give up his right to be king so crown passes straight to william. only 43 per cent believe he should ascend to the throne, according to daily mail poll. 55 per cent are against the duchess of cornwall becoming queen if prince of wales succeeds to throne. andrew languishes at the bottom of the popularity table, with only andrew is more disliked than liked.
ashleigh sokie was asked to wash one direction's niall horan's clothes after washing machine broke in georgia. she posted a picture of herself wearing the singer's polo shirt and underwear on twitter. the 20-year-old claimed to have taken his underwear as a trophy. horan has been in augusta for the us masters, acting as a caddy for rory mcilroy.
up to 21 million acres of jungle will be torn down to make way for rubber plantations in the next decade alone. demand is putting endangered gibbons, leopards and elephants in south east asia at risk. the tyre industry consumes 70 per cent of all natural rubber grown.
nicola sturgeon refused to rule out holding a second independence vote in the next few years. snp leader said she would not call for another plebiscite in snp manifesto for 2016 scottish election. she had earlier said 2014's referendum was a 'once in a generation' event.   she said she wanted scots to vote snp because 'we can make sure labour keeps its promises'   labour leader in scotland, jim murphy, said she was 'offering to make ed miliband prime minister' of a labour government.
william kerr, 53, was released on licence in january after spending 17 years in jail for the murder of maureen comfort. he is believed to have travelled to london after disappearing from approved premises in hull. police say he is'very dangerous' and must return to prison 'as a matter of urgency'
a third of australian women are not finding time for their hobbies and passions. a recent study of more than 1,000 australian parents found more women are choosing work and'more important things' over their passions. clinical psychologist and happiness institute wellness expert dr paula watkins says its important to create space for the things we love. she says changing work spaces and technology contribute to stress and brain overload.
kevin russ hopped trains, dumpster dived for leftovers and slept in ditches as he photographed the lifestyle of a nomad down south with just his phone and a sleeping bag. russ traveled from california to colorado, making his way through arizona, texas and new mexico. the traveling photographer has clocked tens of thousands of miles in the last couple of years as he's journeyed across the country to take photographs. he began using the iphone when prints from his digital camera kept getting rejected.
britain last year produced more than 1.5 million cars - the most since 2007. boris johnson says ed miliband wants to take the country back to the 1970s. miliband is turning the labour party sharply back to left, he says. they want to recreate the stifling environment of management and unions. johnson: one of the key authors of labour party manifesto is his former adversary ken livingstone.
joe anderson, 56, the mayor of liverpool, claimed £4,500 per year from chesterfield high school, merseyside. tried to justify payments by saying he provided the school with 'kudos' for being linked to him. he tried to sue the school for discrimination after it stopped the payments in 2011. said he was being punished for his 'philosophical belief' in public service. mr anderson is paid an £80,000 salary and has campaigned against austerity.
andreas lubitz, who purposefully crashed germanwings flight 9525, had been treated for psychiatric illness. debate has ensued over whether privacy laws should be less strict for professions with special responsibilities. it has been argued that germany's privacy laws were to blame for the tragedy.
ronnie carroll died just days after successfully getting on the general election ballot paper for hampstead and kilburn. mr carroll was due to stand as an independent but died after battle with cancer. he came fourth in the 1962 and 1963 eurovision song contest. electoral commission said he could still potentially win but vote would be declared void and a new candidate sought.
some hospital trusts are charging up to a'shameful' £2,700 for one eye - treble what it costs the health service. 41 hospital trusts in england offered patients the opportunity to pay for cataract surgery. operation usually costs nhs between £800 and £900 per eye, but some trusts charge up to £3,000. more than half of over-65s suffer from cataracts.
the study was conducted by scientists at purdue university in indiana. they were investigating how to reduce bird to aircraft collisions by keeping birds away from planes. research showed that birds responded most to blue lights on planes. the authors suggest that runways could be synced with aircraft to alert birds to incoming planes and avoid collisions .
university student waheed ahmed, 21, from rochdale, greater manchester, was held at birmingham airport this morning. he was deported by turkish authorities and flown back to the uk on monarch-operated flight. ahmed and eight of his relatives were stopped on the turkish border with syria on april 1. the 21-year-old is the son of labour councillor shakil ahmed who is a member of the council. he and eight family members - including four children - were arrested by police on the border with turkey.

lee allan bonneau, 6, died from blunt force trauma to the head in august 2013 after being attacked by a 10-year-old boy on a reservation in saskatchewan, canada. the boy, identified as l.t., went to his friends claiming he had witnessed a 'big guy' strike lee with a rock and a stick. lee was found dead from severe head injuries four hours after he went missing while in the care of his foster mother. the child had been beaten to death on the evening of august 21, 2013 on a remote reservation. l. t. later admitted to killing lee bonneau and blamed a stranger for the slaying
nbc news chief foreign correspondent richard engel was kidnapped in syria in 2012 and held captive for five days. he was convinced by his captors he was taken by forces related to president bashar-al assad. broadcaster had previously said he was most likely taken by government militants. but analysis of his kidnapping shows they may have been a group of sunni rebels instead. they tried to convince his crew they were shi-ite rebels affiliated to the government. mr engel and his crew were held captive and expecting to be killed for propaganda purposes. nbc said it is now clear they were most likely kidnapped by a criminal gang and released for money.
kai windsor, now 10, from cheltenham, started life as a girl but knew from the age of three he was a boy. he always preferred football to dolls and refused to wear dresses. at nine, he told his mother rachel, 37, he was'really a boy' and is now set to have hormone treatment to curb puberty.
dietrich evans, 22, arrested on suspicion of shooting kay hafford, 28, in the back of the head in road rage attack. she was driving on the freeway in houston, texas, when she honked at another driver. man pulled up next to her and shot her in the head but she was able to pull over and call for help. evans has been charged with aggravated assault after being arrested by police. the church singer has agreed to face her alleged shooter in a police line-up.
irobot has filed a request with the u.s. federal communications commission to use airwaves for its lawnmower. national radio astronomy observatory claims irobot's machines will interfere with its sensitive radio telescopes. frequency band proposed for the lawnbot is 6240-6740 mhz - the same one used by several large telescopes. but the company claims the frequencies iro bot wants to use are the same as those used to detect methanol.
johanna johnson's hollywood-inspired collection, sirens' call, closed fashion week australia 2015 in sydney on thursday night. the collection was inspired by the great gatsby. johnson said she wanted to 'bring a little bit of hollywood' to the city. the designer is set to open a new flagship store in the city next month.
hayley sandiford's seven-stone american bulldog winston has attacked several postmen in blackburn, lancashire. she has been told to get rid of the pet by the end of april or she will lose her home. housing association has ordered her to find a new home for the dog or lose her house. postman terroriser winston must leave her home after 14 month ban on postal deliveries to 60 homes in the area.
lisa skinner, 52, shot the male home invader, thought to be her estranged husband bradley skinner,. 59, after he broke into the house in south huntsville, alabama, armed with a pistol and a large knife. police said mrs skinner armed herself with a shotgun and opened fire at her husband. he was shot in the chest and is believed to have life-threatening injuries. her mother ran to a neighbor's house to call police but when officers arrived on the scene, she was shot by one of the officers. mr skinner had a history of violent outbursts against her husband and had filed for multiple orders of protection against him.

new zealander tim weston was on holiday in puerto vallarta with his wife when he saw the crocodile with a dead pet dog in its jaws. a video of the croc swimming through a public marina with the dog has been viewed more than half a million times online. the dog belonged to the bike shop owner's dog and was kept in its mouth for hours. the clip shows a large croc calmly moving through the marina in the tourist hotspot.
directorate of religious affairs for turkey stated that the use of the material for hygiene is acceptable but water was preferable. islamic teachings traditionally state followers should use water to clean themselves after going to the toilet. code also states that followers should not speak or read while on the toilet .
some astrophysicists have suggested that magnetism might have been responsible for aligning and then binding together rocks into larger boulders during the early stages of planet formation. but new measurements show comet 67p's core isn't magnetised. scientists say other forces were responsible for the formation of planets.

the us justice department said prison officials must treat an inmate’s gender identity condition just as they would treat any other medical or mental health condition. justice department ruled in the case of transgender inmate ashley diamond. diamond was denied hormone treatment for three years after a lawsuit was filed against georgia department of corrections officials. diamond claims she was sexually assaulted and ridiculed in prison.
dr. nikita levy was fired from john hopkins health system in february 2013 after it was discovered he had secretly filmed and photographed thousands of women during gynecological exams. he committed suicide ten days later. attorneys representing more than 8,000 women will receive $32 million in legal fees from a $190million settlement. the money will be divided among patients of dr. levy.

people walking along somerton beach, southwest of adelaide, found a deceased fully-clothed man aged about 45 lying on the shore on december 1, 1948. a post-mortem determined that the man had died of poisoning but police and coronial investigations were unable to identify the body. the mystery of the man's body washed up on a beach 67 years ago may be solved thanks to the advances in dna testing.
new york's 630ft ferris wheel will be able to carry as many as 1,400 passengers at a time. it will offer stunning views of the manhattan skyline and other new york boroughs. $500million observation wheel will cost an estimated $25 to $30 for a 38-minute ride.
scientists at harvard medical school and massachusetts general hospital have developed a device that clips onto a smartphone. it uses powerful cameras to analyse samples of cancerous cells in combination with tiny beads that bind to them. researchers claim it can asses 100,000 cells from a single image in 45 minutes. they have already tested the device to detect cervical cancer in tissue samples from smear tests. the device could be used to detect other types of cancer and could even be used at home.
former royal navy rescue pilot jerry grayson, 59, was involved in rescuing sailors during the fastnet yacht rescue in 1979. he was the youngest pilot to join the navy and was responsible for saving 15 yachtsmen. mr grayson travelled 23,000 miles to find every helicopter he flew in during the 1970s. he found that one of the choppers had been turned into a glamping unit - a posh camping facility.
