internet companies will have to reveal names, ip addresses and residential addresses of 4,726 people who illegally shared the film dallas buyers club. a federal court ruled on tuesday that internet companies should hand over the names and addresses of those people. internet law experts say it is very difficult to prove who is legally responsible for the downloading. the company behind the letters will have a hard time following through on the threats. iinet has warned customers to expect letters threatening legal action if they illegally downloaded the film.
dr zoe waller, 31, teaches pharmacy at the university of east anglia and suffers from the skin condition dermatographia. she draws on her own skin to teach her students about new drugs and molecules. dr waller suffers from a type of urticaria - a raised, itchy rash on the skin. she uploads her designs to social media and they are making waves across the university. she was diagnosed with the condition two years ago and uses it as a teaching aid.

nasa will launch the orion spacecraft using the space launch system in 2018 using the largest, most powerful rocket booster ever built. 11 small satellites will be used as secondary payloads to the first test flight of the rocket booster. three missions will help develop technologies for astronauts travelling to deep space. near-earth asteroid scout, lunar flashlight and biosentinel will be launched during the test flight.

uk came 11th in table of countries with the highest standards of prosperity, health and tolerance. obesity levels were the main factor pushing the uk down the health rankings. almost one in four of the population is obese and britain was 111th out of 133 countries. living standards are driven down by poor health and fitness, particularly obesity and crime.
more than 200 members of check it, the only documented gang of gay and transgender youths in america, are the subjects of a new independent film. many of the youths have been stabbed and shot at, while others have served time in juvenile prisons. but now, the gang members, aged 14 to 22, are fighting to break the cycle of poverty and violence in washington dc. they have launched their own clothing label, putting on fashion shows and working as models. formed in 2005 by a group of 'bullied 9th graders', check it now has more than200 members, who live a 'brutal' life.

president barack obama has held the fewest number of state dinners since harry s. truman, who left office 62 years ago. in his first six years, obama held just seven state dinners and plans at least two more this year. the white house state dinner is the highest diplomatic honour the u.s. reserves for allies and other countries.

study uncovered a link between belief in god and other societal characteristics, such as a strong social hierarchy. society with less access to food and water are more likely to believe in all-powerful deities. the uk is one of the least religious places in the world. scientists suggest that religious beliefs help people cope in inhospitable habitats.

debenhams and mothercare have called a halt to long-running promotions that fail to excite shoppers. experts claim prolonged sales can devalue products and encourage shoppers to delay buying. a third of all fashion purchases are now made in a sale or promotion, figures show.

train heading from queens into manhattan was stalled underneath the east river around 8.30am monday morning. more than 500 passengers were taken to manhattan after spending an hour and a half trapped. service on the 7 train was suspended for almost two hours. no injuries were reported after passengers were evacuated from cars in underwater tunnel.
espresso machine is intended for international space station astronaut samantha cristoforetti of italy. spacex is scheduled to launch its unmanned rocket with the machine and 4,000 pounds of food, science research and other equipment on monday afternoon. machine was originally intended for astronaut   to get a break from the station's instant coffee. it is the first coffee machine able to work in micro gravity and can also be used to rehydrate food.

few weight loss plans have solid evidence to back up their claims. weight watchers, the atkins diet, jenny craig and nutrisystem are backed by long-term studies. only a few programmes have shown users lose more weight than those not using them. others produce no better results than people dieting on their own. johns hopkins university researchers reviewed 4,200 studies for evidence of effectiveness.

the maglev train completed a test run on a track in yamanashi. it beat the previous record of 361mph (580km/h) set in 2003. maglev trains use magnets to lift the carriages above the track. the technology promises to be smoother, quieter and twice as fast as high-speed rail.

jared mccarroll, head chef at m restaurant and grill, says speak to your butcher when you're shopping for a perfect steak. allow your meat to come to room temperature before you start cooking and pay a little extra for the best meat. the best steak should have a fine texture, be well marbled and firm to the touch. cooking times for the perfect steak are based on the thickness and cut of meat.

tokyo researchers have proposed a laser system to attach to the international space station. it would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in earth orbit. the system would have a range of 62 miles (100km) and could target things less than 0.4 inches (1cm) in size. tokyoresearchers have proposed a system to shoot down space junk using a laser. powerful pulses from the laser would push space junk into earth’s atmosphere, where it would burn up.

alex bellini will live atop an iceberg in greenland starting next year. he will live inside a contained ball, with no means to escape for 12 months. italian alex bellini, 36, is currently seeking funding for his project, called adrift, which he hopes to begin in november 2016. the aim is to highlight how global warming will melt icebergs around the world and cause sea levels to rise. mr bellini is to be subjected to the full force of the iceberg as it melts, cracks and flips. the capsule will be 10ft (three metres) wide and could fit 10 people - but he will remove all the seats apart from one.

rhodri giggs, 37, was found guilty of driving a mercedes c200 without insurance. he was banned from driving for six months and fined £110 at manchester magistrates court. the former player-manager of salford city revealed he is now unemployed as a hgv driver. giggs said he has not worked since december and has no income or benefits. he had already accrued six points from two previous speeding offences.
ufo researcher scott waring says he has spotted an extra-terrestrial spacecraft in a 55-year-old photo from nasa's mercury project. the image was taken as part of project mercury, which was the us' first mission to put men in space. scientists say claims such as this are a simple case of pareidolia, which is the psychological response to seeing objects in random places.
adidas ultra boost trainers have gone on sale for £130. supermarket chain aldi have a running flash sale of £19.99 running trainers. femail writer and marathon runner lucy waterlow tested out two pairs of running shoes. she tested out adidas' ultra boost shoes against a aldi's budget version. both are available in stores from tomorrow while stocks last.
couple, in their 30s, were convicted of noise pollution and harassment for 'deafening' screams during sex sessions. neighbours in san martino, italy, moved out after complaining to police in 2009. man was sentenced to four months in prison and his fiancée given a noise abatement order. but the couple have been ordered to pay £9,000 after being convicted of harassment and harassment.
hackers reportedly accessed president obama's non-public schedule, which is considered highly sensitive information. according to federal officials, the white house acknowledged suspicious activity on its unclassified computer network in october 2014. a six-month investigation by the fbi and secret service found evidence pointing to russia as the source of the cyber-attack. the hackers accessed white house system by breaching first the state department's network.
director gareth edwards took to the stage at the star wars celebration convention in anaheim, california, on sunday. he revealed a preview of the first star wars spin-off rogue one. the film is described as an anthology movie and will be released in december 2016. felicity jones will star as a rebel fighter in the film.
no man's land fort, a victorian sea fort in the middle of the solent, is set to open as a luxury hotel this month. the hotel boasts 23 luxury suites and can sleep 44 guests, with prices starting from £450 per night. the fort was built between 1867 and 1880 and is located 2km off the coast of the isle of wight. it has a rooftop hot tub, shops, restaurants, bars, a spa and a nightclub.
california appeals court ruled yoga classes taught at capri school district do not violate students' right to religious freedom. family claimed the school district's yoga classes promoted hinduism and inhibited christianity. the district said the practice is taught in a secular way to promote strength, flexibility and balance.
36-year-old man arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to murder abdul hadi arwani. father of six was found dead in his car on a london street two weeks ago. jamaican businessman leslie cooper has already appeared in court charged with murder. burnell mitchell, brother of boney m's lead singer, has been arrested on suspect of terror offences.
sisters sophie morgan, 21, and sheree, 25, allowed their bank accounts to be used to accept stolen money. elderly couple were conned out of £36,000 over the telephone by a fraudster posing as a policeman. man, 86, and his 84-year-old wife from cardiff, south wales, were told to transfer money. sheree morgan and her sister sophie agreed to let their accounts be used in 'vile' plot to steal money. both sisters and her mother and two accomplices admitted money laundering but avoided jail at burnley crown court.
violet pietrok, who lives in portland, oregon, was born with frontonasal dysplasia, a congenital malformation that widened her nose and the space between her eyes. plastic surgeon dr. john meara of boston children's hospital spent months preparing for violet's surgery with molds of her skull that were made using a 3d printer. violet is now smiling, laughing and dancing again six months after the operation.
melanie serita buck, 33, accused of killing michael buckley, 60, at marks & spencer in bromley, south-east london. court heard she became frustrated because the store was 'gridlocked' with christmas shoppers. she 'deliberately rammed' frail widower  with her trolley and broke his thighbone and wrist. buck, from forest hill, charged with manslaughter and alternative charge of inflicting gbh. she denies the charges at croydon crown court and has pleaded not guilty to manslaughter.
jemma peacock, 31, suffers from a rare form of stomach cancer and is currently taking three drugs to prolong her life. mother-of-two has been refused life-saving drug regorafenib which costs £1,000 a week to provide. she says the nhs is denying her two daughters their mother by refusing to fund the drug. mrs peacock has not told her daughters kacie, six, and willow, four, that she has cancer. she has set up a 100,000-strong petition for the drug to be funded but is yet to tell them.
restaurants serving cat meat are springing up across northern vietnam despite laws against eating the animal. cat meat is sold as a delicacy known as 'baby tiger' and is smuggled across the border from china and laos. police officers and lawyers are among the biggest customers of the meat, which is illegal to eat. one restaurant owner slaughtered 31 cats in one day to keep up with demand.
jeremy trentelman, 36, of ogden, utah, built a giant box fort for his son max, 3, and daughter story, 2, in his front yard last week. he received a letter from city code enforcement officials telling him to take down the castle. the father says he will leave it up for 14 days, the maximum allowed before receiving a $125 fine.
so-called 'boomerang generation' are living at home even in their twenties and thirties. only 42 per cent of parents charge their adult children rent. 80 per cent still buy their children's groceries and 60 per cent cook dinner for them. debt organisations warn parents should not be afraid to ask children for rent and money.
when tracking began in 2008 roughly 14per cent of citizens were uninsured. the uninsured rate lowest since gallup and healthways began tracking in 2008. an estimated 14.75 million adults have gained coverage since the fall of 2013. hispanics saw the biggest coverage gains of any ethnic or racial group.
britney e. montenegro, 20, was charged with disorderly conduct in orlando, florida, early saturday after getting involved in a fight. she was arrested covered in blood, but police say it was not her own. the fight broke out about 2.40am saturday at a bar in downtown orlando. she is from queens, new york, and studies at valencia community college.
abiotic methane is 20 times more effective in trapping heat than carbon dioxide. scientists found vast deep water gas hydrates in the arctic that are reservoirs for the gas. it is created by chemical reactions in the crust beneath the seafloor. the reservoirs are secure, and scientists don't believe they will impact climate change. similar formations could someday be used to store methane, that can be used as fuel.
ed miliband will warn supporters that labour faces coming to power in a ‘time of scarcity’ launching party’s manifesto in manchester. he will insist a labour government would ‘cut the deficit every year’ and have national debt falling ‘as soon as possible’   labour leader will claim ‘not one policy’ in it would be funded through additional government borrowing.
more than 160 melon-headed whales washed up on two beaches at hokota city, north-east of tokyo. officials are investigating the cause of the mass stranding. it triggered rumours on social media of an impending earthquake and tsunami. but experts have dismissed the claims as 'unscientific'
average australian sheds the equivalent of a 50 gram packet of chips every week in dry skin. dust mites are the number one cause of allergies in australia. an average bed can have approximately 10,000 dust mite living in it at one time. more than 1,000 mites live in just one metre of carpet and produce 2000 droppings in their lifetime. just 44 per cent of women wash their sheets on a weekly basis.
martina levato and her german boyfriend alexander boettcher, 30, wanted to 'purge' her previous relationships, court heard. they planned to throw 'corrosive liquid' at men she had previously been linked to, it was claimed. the 23-year-old also tried to castrate a man's genitals in a car, it is claimed. couple was detained on suspicion of throwing acid on ex-boyfriend pietro barbini's face and body.
tony degrafreed, of indianapolis, indiana, has been charged with murder for allegedly beating to death wife rebecca degrafrees, 47, at their home on july 20, 2014. in january 1994, he was arrested and charged with the murder of his estranged wife along with two counts of attempted murder and illegal possession of a handgun . he was convicted of murder in 1995 and sentenced to 30 years in prison, but served less than half of that sentence.
the queen will visit runnymede in surrey to celebrate the magna carta's 800th anniversary in june. but dozens of anarchists have set up a camp just yards from the historic site. the squatters claim to live off the land and are linked to the occupy london movement. they have been granted a stay of execution by a county court judge.
the suzy lamplugh trust, a london-based charity which aims to'make society a safer place', has slammed the t-shirts. the shirts are sold in us and uk stores including zazzle and look human. feature phrases such as 'i heart my stalker' and'some people call it stalking'   according to the slt, the shirts mock a serious issue which affects one in six women, and play into people's fear of being laughed at.
gianni van, 45, is accused of the 1995 murder of gonzalo ramirez, 24, whose blindfolded, bloodied body was found on the side of a california road having suffered 30 blows with a meat cleaver. prosecutors say van killed ramirez as revenge for raping his on-and-off girlfriend norma esparza. van was arrested in 1996 and charged with the murder, but released because esparzas could not be forced to testify against him. van later divorced her and she went on to become a psychology professor in france.
a 56-year-old man was taken to hospital with head injuries and a broken arm after the six-storey building collapsed in holborn, central london. staff at royal courts of justice and london school of economics were evacuated after the incident. it is just yards from where underground cable fire ripped through holborn on april 1. the building collapsed 'like a pancake' sending a cloud of dust into the air.
gavin munro grows young trees into plastic moulds, pruning and guiding the branches into shape. he hopes to harvest a crop of 400 tables, chairs and lampshades from a field in derbyshire next year. mr munro hopes to have the furniture on sale by 2017 priced between £1,000 and £2,000.
stars including nancy dell'olio, josie gibson, jamelia and susanna reid share first selfie in aid of #selfieesteem. good morning britain's initiative celebrates women as they are. according to survey, women take an average of six selfies before posting one online and men take four.
volvo teamed up with a swedish start-up to make a light reflective spray for cyclists, called life paint. life paint is a reflective safety spray that’s invisible by daylight but reflects light in the dark. it contains powder-fine reflective particles designed to react to a car's headlights. volvo launched the paint to increase the visibility of cyclists on the road. a trial began in london bike shops on 2 april and 2,000 cans were given away free. the paint has proved so popular that the trial cans are now on sale on ebay for £45 ($66) at the time of writing.
national driving survey analysed the travel habits of 3700 australian families. one in five nsw families have admitted to sedating their children before a long road trip. four in five families use technology to deal with bored children. 20 per cent of parents admit to using sedatives like phenergan to knock their children out. the medication can cause breathing problems in young children. the medical community claim the sedative should not be used on children younger than two.
lisa webb, 34, was nervous about sending her vegetable-phobic three-year-old to school in france. she feared her daughter would starve during the day. she spent a week in the canteen of her daughter's school for a week. the canadian expat was shocked to see tots eating everything put in front of them.
rochelle coulson suffers from sleep apnoea - a condition often linked to obesity - and has not worked for five years. the 21-year-old put on 13 stone in four years by eating through 'boredom'   she says she would be a 'danger' in the workplace because she is so tired she falls asleep unexpectedly. doctors have warned her she needs to lose weight to cure her condition - but she claims she needs a state-funded support worker to write meal plans.
unnamed man was gored between the legs during a bullrunning event in teulada, a small coastal town on spain's costa blanca. he was running away from the angry animal when he was knocked to the ground. the bull caught him with one of its horns and sent him sprawling to the floor. the man was trying to scramble to safety behind a set of iron bull bars .

university of manchester researchers have revealed an hd dark matter map of the cosmos. it shows clumps of mystery particles across 0.4 per cent of the sky . the goal is to eventually map 12.5 per cent over five years. a team from the manchester team has spent two years measuring the shapes of galaxies to create the map. it is the first in a series of maps of dark matter that will allow astronomers to study how galaxies formed in the universe.
mike fregoe and his family on new york's long island tried to keep a 9-foot-tall snowman alive for as long as possible. the family built the snowman in january, but the frosty melted this weekend when 70-degree temperatures hit the area. frosty became an internet celebrity, with more than 3,000 people liking a facebook page dedicated to him. the fregoes decided to start a new snowman for next winter.

mangu ram was 14 when he fled to kashmir as a refugee after the partition of india. for the past 70 years he has been denied citizenship rights to own property or vote in state elections. around 100,000 people are classified as refugees in india's only muslim-majority state. the west pakistan refugees (wprs) have been refused the right to vote or own property.
biologists at the hebrew university of jerusalem in israel studied the movement of octopuses. they found that the movement is controlled independently in the brain and can move in any direction. the findings could help scientists develop new ways for soft robots to move around. the octopus was found to move by pushing with its legs rather than pulling.

paula mckay's daughter natasha, 24, and son patrick, 22, were both left severely disabled after birth at same hospital. staff at sharoe green hospital in preston failed to monitor natasha and failed to ventilate her properly, causing brain damage. when she became pregnant with her second child the same mistakes were repeated by staff. natasha was left brain damaged and with cerebral palsy and needs 24-hour care for life. ms mcksay has won a 20-year legal battle to secure £13 million compensation for her two children.

in the third part of our major good health series on dementia, we look at ways to help those with dementia. older people find it harder to reach a deeper sleep - but they still need just as much. avoiding catnapping during the day is one of the most important measures to help with memory.

horses, ponies and donkeys are being abandoned in record numbers across the country. many owners find they can no longer afford to keep and look after them. animal welfare charities are full to capacity and are struggling to care for neglected or abandoned horses. rspca alone took in 1,500 horses last year, many of them former family pets.

hedione is derived from the greek word 'hedone', for fun, pleasure, lust. christian dior fragrance, eau savage, was the first to use it in 1966. it activates the pheromone receptor vn1r in humans. this activates part of the brain responsible for triggering the release of sex hormones in women.

naomi jacobs was 32 when she woke up one morning having lost her memory of the past 17 years of her life. she had transient global amnesia, a form of memory loss brought on by stress. she thought she was a 15-year-old and her son was a stranger. after eight weeks her memory began to return to normal.

photos taken between 1900 and 1911 during the qing dynasty show beijing's famous landmarks with barely any visitors. they are some of the earliest holiday snaps of the chinese capital and were taken during the imperial era. the photos show tourists posing at the temple of heaven and standing next to giant statues at the western qing tombs. the quiet scenes are a far cry from modern-day beijing, which is visited by millions of tourists.
canadian duo mitchell moffit and greg brown present online science show asapscience. they discuss how being the first, middle, youngest, or only child affects personality traits. personality traits are also affected by whether parents have high expectations and how strict they were. first-borns are expected to be academic achievers and more ambitious. middle-born children tend to be co-operative and sociable, and are more likely to be social butterflies. youngest children are likeable and charming, and only children are creative and responsible.
more than 37 tons of silver fish have died in rodrigo de freitas lake in rio de janeiro, brazil. the lake is where olympic rowing and canoeing events will be held during next year's games. authorities and biologists have argued about the cause of the deaths. rio's waste management company said it has cleared more than 37 tonnes of fish, but there is still an overwhelming stench. the dead fish are being scooped out of the water and taken to the city's main dump.
pregnant women with extreme morning sickness more likely to have children with language and speech delays, and attention disorders. study shows condition suffered by duchess of cambridge triples risk of developmental problems. about 10,000 women a year in the uk are affected by hyperemesis gravidarum - severe morning sickness.
veronica ‘roni’ gonzalez and her fiance ely alba were returning from engagement party when they stopped on interstate 30 to help a group in trouble. four were killed instantly in the collision. of the 13 people injured, one later died in hospital from their wounds. veronica lost a leg and remains in critical condition.
lion - known as p-22 - was found by workers in the crawl space under a house in los feliz hills on monday. animal rescue workers have tried to get the cougar to move out - but to no avail. he is best-known for being pictured in front of the hollywood sign in 2013.
flakka resembles a mix of crack cocaine and meth and it has a noticeably foul smell. users have nicknamed the drug '$5 insanity' because hits often cost less than $10. flakka can be injected, snorted, smoked, swallowed or taken with other drugs. it can be even stronger than crystal meth or bath salts and is spreading across florida.
photographs show teenagers and people in their early 20s kissing in public, drinking alcohol and living openly gay lifestyles. some of those pictured are even seen wearing clothing adorned with the stars and stripes. taken in the capital tehran, the photographs show young people in iran are defying the country's hardline islamic image to create a more westernised society. young people represent the largest societal bloc in iranian, with over 63 per cent of iran's population of 73 million people aged under 30.
andrés iniesta's vineyard in castilla-la mancha can be rented out for €125 (£90) a night. the world class midfielder took to twitter to announce the news. the property comes with a guided tour of the vineyard and a wine-making tour.
shiba the dog uses his nose and paw to open a sliding glass window at shimada cigarette shop in west tokyo. visitors have travelled from afar to give the dog a snack, pat him on the head or pose for a selfie. one of the videos showing his customer service skills has more than two million views on youtube.

'our planet' will focus on the earth's last wilderness areas and the animals living there. it is being produced by u.k.-based silverback films in collaboration with world wildlife fund.

men in u.s. special operations forces do not believe women can meet the physical and mental demands of their commando jobs. they fear the pentagon will lower standards to integrate women into their elite units. the military lifted the ban on women in combat jobs in 2012, opening up 230,000 positions to women.
the jet is unusual because it is erupting from the dark underside of the comet, whereas such activity had only been seen on the day side so far. the jet may have been caused by a wave of heat reaching ice trapped under the surface. but it is unusual, because so far such activity has only been spotted on the comet's day side. the images were taken by the rosetta spacecraft from a distance of 47 miles (75km) from comet 67p.

more than 730,285 reddit users have pressed the button since reddit launched its r/thebutton thread on april fool's day. it is not yet known what happens when the timer reaches zero and users can only click the button once. only people who registered on the site before 1 april are eligible to press the button. when the button is clicked, the timer resets and users are awarded a 'flair' with a colour.

on average, pets watch 21 hours of tv a week. owner of a micro pig lets their pet watch 28 hours of shows a week - equivalent to 42 episodes of eastenders. paul o'grady's show 'for the love of dogs' is pets' favourite show. almost two thirds of goldfish owners admit to putting the tank in sight of the tv.
the 13th century castle in the dordogne, france is on the market for £703,400. the 14-bedroom property was refurbished in the 19th century and again in 2002. the castle is only 15 minutes from an airport which has regular flights to london. the hill-top castle features its own swimming pool and its own suit of armour and shield. the property also features 14 bathrooms and 46 hectares of land.
david potchen, 53, robbed a bank in merrillville, indiana, and waited for police to arrive so he could go back to prison. the ex-con spent 12 and a half years in prison for a 2000 bank robbery. he had lost his job, lost his place to stay and spent a night in the woods. he is now employed and living with the support of his relatives and is staying out of trouble.
finnish researchers say widely-prescribed drugs could be contributing to obesity epidemic. by two years-old, one in five boys and one in ten girls was overweight or obese. a third of 10-11 year olds and a fifth of 4-5 year olds in england are overweight.
50 obese pupils at jianxin primary school, in eastern china, are being sent to special classes to help them lose weight. a survey revealed 5 per cent of the school's 800 pupils were obese, including one 11-year-old who weighs 180lbs. instructors say the classes are aimed at making fitness fun, and are named after a dreamworks film. teachers have been told to monitor each child's weight and work with parents to help control the weight.

moder of the reddit thread, find boston bombers, chris ryves, has told of his regrets about the thread in new documentary. he set up thread after boston marathon bombings in 2013 to help identify suspect or suspects. but three million users took to thread, which became 'its own beast' in the days after attack. users hurled false accusations at spectators who had been wearing backpacks at the event. claims even led to 22-year-old sunil tripathi, a brown university student, being wrongly identified as the bomber. now, he has spoken of regrets about thread in a new documentary, which will be released on monday.

the world's joint third-largest cruise ship, the anthem of the seas, has arrived in southampton, uk, for its naming ceremony. the ship has a capacity for almost 5,000 passengers and is expected to welcome 80,000 this summer. the vessel is owned by royal caribbean and will be named after the queen. the naming ceremony will take place on april 20 at the 101 at southampton docks, which is the home port for the summer season. guests will experience robotic bartenders, a virtual skydiving machine and even go on a sky dive.

almost half of those with severe allergies live in daily fear of suffering a potentially fatal reaction. many britons are unaware of the seriousness of the condition, says charity allergy uk. two thirds of adults would not know how to help if they saw someone suffering allergic reaction. hospital admissions for allergies increased by 8 per cent between 2013 and 2014.

mitzi neyens, 77, was the last link in a chain of 34 kidney transplants. she received a kidney march 26 after her husband bill gave his kidney to a patient in need. eight surgeons in four states linked five hospitals through transplants on the day of her transplant. the world's longest kidney donation chain began with a minneapolis attorney who donated a kidney without having a loved one in need of a transplant.
a 'blob' of warm water 2,000 miles across is sitting in the pacific ocean of the us. since last june it has extended from alaska to mexico. a university of washington study says it could be responsible for droughts . california's drought is one of the worst on record, while the east coast of the. us has seen unusually cold temperatures . it is also having an effect on marine life, and fish have been spotted in unusual places.

there is an insufficient supply of whooping cough vaccine in australia, according to queensland health. the adult vaccine will not be available until july. it comes less than a month after the death of 32-day-old riley hughes who died after contracting the disease. medical professionals insist the resource shortage will not affect the immunisation programs for babies, children and pregnant women. riley died at just 32 days old after contracting whooping coughing.

lallawavis scagliai was found in a cliff on a beach south of mar del plata city in argentina. scientists used 3d scanning of the skeleton to examine its hearing ability. the bird is one of the most complete skeletons of a 'terror bird' discovered 3.5 million years ago. it would have had powerful jaws but limited hearing .
heart patients who expressed gratitude for the positive things in their life had better mental and physical health. patients who were more grateful had lower markers of inflammation, which can worsen heart failure. the university of california study involved men and women who had been diagnosed with stage b heart failure .
the i'm up alarm can be set to go off the night before and will only turn off by scanning a bar code. the alarm is linked to a qr code that can be printed on a mug or magnet and can be kept in another room of the house. the app will have a snooze function but only for a set number of times.

there are now 1.02million men in the uk who have opted to work reduced hours compared to 4.58million women. 14 per cent rise in the number of men opting to work part-time in the last two years. men make up one in 10 parents who care for children or family full-time. one million men have chosen to work as they become more involved in childcare or are retiring gradually.
john potter, from savannah, has admitted forging the picture with his brother in the 1980s and placing it in a frame which now holds a picture of his dead dog. he passed on the image on to the georgia historical society and the photo became unofficial part of the ship's history. in 1986 he fibbed that he was at a yard sale when he found the picture in an antique frame.

new study highlights the areas in washington, oregon and california that would require more time to successfully evacuate for higher ground. 94,872 residents and 42,424 employees live within the tsunami hazard zones of the three states. 70 per cent of the communities are equipped to evacuate in 15 to 25 minutes. some communities can increase their chance of survival by walking faster.
qantas could be fined £20,000 for every time they arrive late at heathrow airport. the airline could loose eight of their eight landing strips at the busy airport. qantas have slipped to a ranking of 75 out of 80 airlines that use the airport. air congestion at dubai and air traffic delays are to blame.

bryan morseman, 29, from bath, new york, ran three marathons in eight days to raise money for his son leeim, who has spina bifida, a developmental congenital disorder. he earned $5,750 in winnings from the races, all of which will go toward medical treatment for his nine-month-old son. since 2008, bryan has won 23 of the 42 26.2-mile races he has participated in.

cairns father was charged with administering a dangerous drug to a minor for treating his two-year-old daughter with medical cannabis oil. the little girl was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer called neuroblastoma. the father was refused access to his daughter and has been unable to see her since january. he has pleaded for the government to legalise the drug and drop the charges against him. the toddler's mother, who is estranged from the father, does not agree with his actions. the dad has now been allowed to see his daughter in hospital but she is in a critical condition.
president barack obama and his wife, michelle, paid more than $93,000 in federal taxes last year on an adjusted gross income of $477,000. their effective tax rate was 19.6 percent. the obamas donated $70,712 in charitable donations to 33 different charities. the white house released the couple's tax returns ahead of the filing deadline.

neuroscientists at john hopkins medical school in baltimore have identified the area of the brain that is the key to picking up on sarcasm. stroke patients with damage to the right sagittal stratum in the brain are unable to detect sarcasm . stroke survivors often suffer damage to this area of their brain and struggle to recognise sarcasm when listening to sentences.
melissa borg has been missing from her baulkham hills home since last thursday. the 13-year-old left home at 7:30am and made her way to the hills sports high school in seven hills in sydney. she never made it to class and her father reported her missing to police. police have questioned her school friends about her mysterious disappearance.

the sinkhole appeared on a hillside in north-western china after locals noticed the ground was getting warmer. experts think a coal seam may have spontaneously combusted below ground. the temperature has been measured at 792c from two metres away. geologists can't get close enough to determine how deep the hole is.

black book of carmarthen is the earliest surviving medieval manuscript written solely in welsh. dating from 1250, it contains some of the earliest references to arthur and merlin. researchers recovered images using combination of ultraviolet light and photo editing software. the faces are only visible under uv light and are invisible to the naked eye.

christine carriage, 67, was handed a six-month suspended sentence at norwich crown court. police found 1,337 items of clothing, shoes and handbags at her home in bowthorpe, norwich. 340 of the items still had price tags on and police found an eight foot clothes rail bending under the weight. she was found with son shane carriage, 45, and grandson luke hall in november 2013.
image was captured over jaibru in australia by an off-duty emergency services officer who dubbed the phenomenon 'looping lightning'    upwards lightning is very rare - estimates suggest less than one per cent of lightning travels in an ‘upwards’ direction. storm chaser dan robinson believes 'looped lightning' is simply a trick of perspective, based on where a viewer is stood. the bolt appears to rise and loop up from the cloud before striking the ground.
carlos toro, 66, worked as a mid-level member of the medellin cartel in the 1980s. he fled from colombia fearing for his life after a confrontation with his boss. toro worked as an informant for the dea and helped carry out undercover stings around the world. he was told he would be rewarded with us citizenship but retired and is now technically living in the us illegally. he is facing deportation from the united states after working for dea as an undercover operative for 27 years.

caitlin kellie-jones suffered from hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy, a type of brain damage. caitlin was placed in a special cooling wrap to keep her body temperature at 33.5 degrees. she was diagnosed with the condition minutes after she was born. medics gave her hypothermia in a bid to prevent any brain damage and keep her alive. she is now 10 months old and has recovered from the illness. her parents nicola and paul are raising money to help other babies in need of cooling machines.

extraordinary aerial photographs taken above whitefish bay on eastern lake superior, ontario, show some of the freighters lined up across frozen expanse. they are carrying goods from canadian grain to us iron and steel but are being hampered by slabs of ice as big as pick-up trucks. the biggest ice cover on north america’s great lakes in decades is backing up shipping deliveries.

the dea program was created for the drug enforcement agency in 1992. it monitored every telephone call made from the united states to up to 116 countries on a watch list for drug trafficking. the program was used to infiltrate drug trafficking rings. it was the oldest known example of the american government tracking phone calls. the dea was a model for the national security agency.

the 18-carat gold irish freedom box was a gift to lord uxbridge for his heroics at the battle of waterloo. he is said to have stoically remarked 'by god, sir, i've lost my leg' after losing his leg to a cannonball. his leg was buried near the battlefield but later dug up and used as a tourist attraction. the gold trinket box was sold by bonhams to a private collector for £100,900.

monitoring by hebridean whale and dolphin trust teams has seen the number of encounters with common dolphins off the west of scotland increase by 68 per cent over the past 12 years. common dolphins were once a rare sight in the hebrides, preferring warmer waters further south. experts believe global warming has led to pods moving north. the shift north could be creating new opportunities for the dolphins to find food in new areas.

researchers at the technical university of braunschweig, germany, showed that passive smoking affects plants too. they found peppermint plants can take up high concentrations of nicotine from contaminated soil and plumes of smoke. finding may explain why some spices, herbal teas and medicinal plants have high levels of nicotine in them. nicotine was frequently used as an insecticide until it was banned by the european union in 2009.

little zane gbangbola died at home – in the middle of the night – after being poisoned by gas. for months after his death, police and other official agencies ruled out fears that the deadly fumes had come from a landfill site. they insisted carbon monoxide from a faulty pump hired by his family had caused his death. but new evidence proves authorities knew for 14 months that hydrogen cyanide gas capable of killing zane had leaked into the family's home as it was engulfed by floodwater.
swedish scientists analysed more than 10,000 families with children aged two to 14 who did not have type 1 diabetes. 58 children were diagnosed with the condition after being affected by stressful events. study suggested damaging events in childhood could affect beta cells and raise insulin demands to cope with stress.
image shows 'ribbons' of sand and patterned stripes known as linear dunes in an area known as the erg chech, a desolate sand sea in southwestern algeria. it was captured by nasa's landsat 7 satellite using rays of sunlight reflected off the sand. linear dune are straight ridges of sand that have been known to measure as long as 99 miles (160km) but the exact cause of these longitudinal structures is not known. one theory is that the dunes are created by helical roll vortices, but this is disputed.
mexican soldiers uncovered a trapdoor leading to a suspected drugs tunnel hidden inside a wooden wardrobe in the border town of tijuana. the trapdoor leads to a secret underground passageway stretching 500 feet towards the u.s. border. the tunnel was wired with lights, ventilation and a cart system. nine people were arrested after soldiers uncovered the tunnel and found 44 pounds of marijuana.

kenneth morgan stancil iii, 20, was arrested sleeping on a florida beach early on tuesday morning. he allegedly walked into wayne community college in goldsboro, north carolina, and shot dead his former work-study supervisor ron lane. lane, who was gay, had worked at the college for 18 years and was found dead on monday. his mother said lane had fired him with no notice and that lane had made 'inappropriate sexual advances' towards her son. police are investigating lane's death as a possible hate crime.
sarah brady was the wife of former white house press secretary jim brady, who was shot in 1981 in an assassination attempt on former us president ronald reagan. mrs brady and her husband crusaded against gun violence and helped pass the brady handgun violence prevention act in 1993. she died from pneumonia at the age of 73 on friday. her husband died in august 2014 from injuries sustained in the 1981 shooting. she first got involved in gun control advocacy after seeing her six-year-old son playing with a loaded gun that was left in a car.

the four sisters at the centre of australia's largest abduction case are happy and well-adjusted children. the four vinceni girls were taken back to live with their father in italy in dramatic circumstances in 2012. the girls are now aged 16 and 17 and are living in florence with father tomaso vincenti. the two eldest girls, emily and claire, have expressed their regret for the way they handled the dramatic exit. they speak to their mother every night and speak with their dad every night. the sisters are living healthy and happy lives and speak to each other regularly.

researchers at boston university and the university of bath believe neanderthals were not very adept at controlling fire. they believe they died out as they were unable to get as much energy from their food as modern humans who used fire. without fire, a neanderthal group would have had the equivalent of 12 reindeer a year. they disappeared around 40,000 years ago after surviving through the last ice age.

giant internal organ weighed a colossal 6lbs (2.7kg) - and was 20 times the normal size of a healthy kidney. it was extracted from a 45-year-old man with a genetic disease called autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease. condition causes fluid-filled cysts to grow in the kidneys, causing them to expand. a second kidney weighing 5.5lbs was removed a week after the first, beating previous record of 4.7lbs. patient was diagnosed with the potentially lethal condition last year.

noaa fisheries in maryland says the humpback whale is no longer endangered. they want to break up global population into 14 sub-populations. ten of these will be 'not at risk', two 'threatened' and two still 'endangered' it follows a conservation'success story' that raised numbers to 90,000. at one stage the worldwide population dropped to just a few thousand due to over-fishing and hunting. however, some experts have warned it is too soon to declare the project a success story.
scient in belgium say all sweet potatoes contain 'foreign dna'. agrobacterium bacteria in the crop exchanges genes between species. this makes sweet potatoes a 'natural genetically modified organism' and humans have been eating it for thousands of years. scientists in belgian say allsweet potatoes contain a type of natural genetically modified organisms .

university of illinois scientists have created the first 3d simulation of merging black holes in a disk. it shows what happens when two supermassive black holes collide  and was created by scientists at the university of illinois. it comes after two black holes were found to be seven years from merging. gravitational waves - ripples in space-time - are also predicted to be created by the merger.

the uco stormproof matches are made using an incredibly tough coating that smoulders no matter what. they are made by uco which has been making outdoor accessories for 44 years. the matches can burn again once exposed to oxygen and even when buried in dirt. the match sticks are dipped in water and buried in sand and then covered in mud.
former secretary of state hillary rodham clinton flew first class from boston to washington, d.c. on tuesday night. she refused to acknowledge her first campaign-trail question about the deadly benghazi terror attacks in 2012. four americans were killed in the september 11, 2012 attacks, including the us ambassador to libya. clinton and president barack obama incorrectly blamed the attacks on protests against a youtube video.
yom hazikaron - or memorial day - is held the day before israel's independence day. it is held to remember the 23,320 people who died 'fighting for the national cause' since 1860. all cinemas, theatres and nightclubs are closed by law on the day. 116 security force personnel have been killed in the line of duty in the past year.
noise-induced hearing loss is one of the most common work-related illnesses. scientists at the university of southern california have identified a gene, named nox3, found in the inner ear. it is crucial in determining how vulnerable a person is to developing hearing loss.
palaeontologists at the university of bristol found that male and female stegosaurus had different shaped plates running along their backs. male dinosaurs could have used them to show off their prowess in the same way as peacocks. some scientists had been baffled by differences in the shape of the plates on some fossils . the discovery could help scientists determine the sex of some of the dinosaur species.
ukip leader said'millions' of refugees could arrive on boats in europe over the next few years unless intercepted and turned back now. urged prime minister david cameron to resist pressure for britain to take in refugees. experts warn up to 30,000 migrants, including 2,500 children, could be killed this year unless crisis is tackled.
bbc2 boss kim shillinglaw said clarkson 'will be back' on the bbc but not on top gear. insisted there was 'no ban on jeremy being on the corporation' and he has 'had time'   final scenes filmed before top gear presenter's sacking will be aired this summer, says head of bbc2. but she refused to say who would be replacing clarkon and said female candidates are being considered. clarksonson was suspended by bbc last month after he attacked top gear producer mr tymon.
laura smith, 35, has been charged with dui, child endangerment and public intoxication. police say she was drunk driving and allowed a 10-year-old girl to drive her car. smith was in the passenger seat and the girl was in her lap. a witness tried to contain smith until police arrived, and she pepper sprayed him.
in all 1,177 barrio 18 members were transferred. from izalco jail to san francisco gotera in an effort to curb gang violence. members will mix with rivals from the hyper-violent mara salvatrucha gang, or ms-13. so far this year, gang members have been blamed for killing 20 police officers, two soldiers, six prison guards and a prosecutor.
raquel d'apice, a comedian and mother-of-one from new jersey, created yelp reviews of newborns, an entertaining collection of spoof critiques that highlight the real struggles plaguing new parents today. raquel posts the reviews on her humorous parenting blog the ugly volvo.
whole pantry founder belle gibson has admitted she never had cancer. in an interview with the australian women's weekly, she said: 'none of it was true'    she said she was not seeking forgiveness and that she feared for her family's safety. her business empire is in tatters and her relationship with her fans is broken. she is thought to be struggling financially and facing an investigation.
papyrus was found in oxyrhynchus, egypt, and contains a medical'recipe' for treating a hangover. text recommends stringing leaves of alexandrian chamaedaphne together and wearing them around the neck. but it is not known if the treatment had any effect. it was found as part of an effort to translate 500,000 documents found in ancient rubbish tip.
graeme finlay, 53, insisted he acted in self-defence after being attacked by ron phillips, 70, with his crutch. he is accused of attacking husband and wife ronald and june phillip on a luxury cruise ship. finlay denies charges of unlawful wounding and assault causing grievous bodily harm.
cetaphil gentle cleanser is responsible for the glowing skin of stars including britain’s got talent judge amanda holden and actresses charlize theron and olivia wilde. is fragrance and soap free and contains just eight ingredients. currently costs £6.74 at boots and is stocked in pharmacies and online.
monica mcdermott, 41, could not walk straight when police stopped her black lexus in macclesfield, cheshire. mother-of-one refused to give a breath sample and had to be restrained by police. when officers breathalyzed her she was three times over the limit. she pleaded guilty to drink driving and was banned from driving for four years. she avoided prison in 2012 when she crashed her car while four times the legal limit.
rspca officers discovered five illegal pit bull terrier-type dogs at a make-shift farm in lancashire. animals were held in electrical shock collars, covered with scars and kept in urine-soaked cages without water. three men involved in illegal dog fights have been fined a total of £40,000 for animal cruelty offences.
5,080 flight cancellations and delays in first quarter of 2015 compared to same period last year. low-cost carrier monarch has seen a 30% increase in delays, easyjet a 19% increase. but thomas cook has reduced delays by 37% and british airways by 11%.
erik de vries, 24, and josephine egberts, 22, were separated back in 1999 after their parents' messy break-up. erik moved back to netherlands, joined tinder and swiped 'right' on her profile photo. they were reunited after 16 years.

greg hardy was convicted by a judge last july of beating, strangling and threatening to kill his ex-girlfriend nicki holder. the nfl announced today that hardy will be suspended without pay for 10 games at the start of the 2015 season. hardy, 25, was dropped by his previous team, the carolina panthers, after the charges were dropped. he will be forced to sit out the first 10 games of the season and will not receive his salary.
chairchair-bound christopher starrs, 50, admitted defrauding bt openreach of £28,000 over two years. he was sentenced to 16 months in jail suspended for two years in january this year. but recorder stuart trimmer qc said sentence was 'unlawful' and ordered him to pay a fine. judge nicholas cooke qc blasted junior colleague recorder for 'taking his eye off the ball'    he said judge should have been sent to prison for his crimes - but he was spared jail as an 'act of mercy'

the apple watch version one has been labelled 'a waste of money' by some tech experts. the release date for the apple watch 1 is april 24. price comparison website finder.com.au says consumers might be better off waiting for the second generation apple watch. the first version of the watch is expected to retail from $499 right up to $24,000. a panel of five australian tech experts say version two will be a vast improvement.

the james webb space telescope will be 100 times more potent than hubble, and will be able to see back to 200 million years after the big bang. nasa hopes to launch the telescope in october 2018. the telescope will weigh 6.4 tons, and is expected to be 70 times as powerful as hubble. it will be used to look at the first galaxies of the universe.

car is a 1962 aston martin db4 series iii and will be worth three times its £220,000 price if fully restored. restoration project will cost up to £350,000 - meaning whoever buys it will have to pay £570,000 to return it to its former glory. car was off the road in storage when it was bought by the current owner in 1982 for restoration.
david norris, 51, repeatedly stabbed his wife dionne in the graveyard of a church in southfleet, kent. his wife begged him to think of their children as he pounced on her. he only stopped stabbing her when she 'played dead' and a member of the public intervened. norris was found guilty of attempted murder and jailed for 20 years at maidstone crown court.
actor peter ustinov bought the aston martin db4 cabriolet in 1962 after winning a best supporting actor oscar for his role in spartacus. the car cost £4,000 in 1962 when the average house price in britain was just £2,500. it was one of the most luxurious cars of its day and went 0-60mph in nine seconds and had a top speed of 140mph. it is expected to fetch more than double the £431,200 it sold for four years ago at auction at bonhams.

british workers spend an average of £1,840 a year on a daily lunchtime takeaway. 60 per cent of britons buy their lunches out and spend £552 on the high street. food website food52's 'not sad desk lunch' series shows you how to make your own lunch at home. a fifth of workers choose to purchase their work-time lunches instead of making them. workers could save up to £1,300 a year if they made their own lunch.

the 'naatsit' is on display at the national museum of denmark in copenhagen as part of its animal-skin clothing collection. traditionally known as a 'naatit', the underwear is adorned with beads and would have been sewn together by a woman using strips of seal fur. it was obtained during an expedition to the ammassalik settlement in greenland in 1892. the underwear was worn inside the homes of the inuit and under trousers when leaving the settlement.
care quality commission branded hinchingbrooke in cambridgeshire as 'inadequate' and placed it in special measures in january. watchdog ignored a spot check by its own inspectors that found huge improvements in standards. today watchdog will upgrade the finding to'requires improvement' and publish a glowing report. experts say it is evidence inspection was flawed and a stitch-up by labour party activists.
texas trooper abraham martinez was suspended for three days without pay for the unconventional maneuver after he leaped into the air and kicked steven gaydos in 2012. martinez, a 10-year veteran trooper, was chasing gaydos after he ran a stop sign in houston, texas. gaydos, 25, was driving in a suspended license and martinez shot him once in the leg but was not indicted for the incident.
survey found almost half of dog owners did not know ticks can transmit deadly diseases to humans and other dogs. 54 per cent didn't know lyme disease, a potentially fatal illness caught from tick bites, affects their pets as well as themselves. lyme is a bacterial infection spread to humans by infected ticks. experts are urging the public to get their dogs checked out for ticks.
the glasford school in illinois hosted one of several simulations put on by the american red cross to educate students on the dangers of drunk driving. the staged event used student actors playing accident victims and used real local police, fire and rescue personnel responding to the scene.

christopher swain, a clean-water activist, embarked on a 1.8-mile swim in the gowanus canal in brooklyn, new york. he completed only two-thirds of a mile of the waterway to urge environmental clean up. the water has been designated as especially polluted by the environmental protection agency. swain gargled hydrogen peroxide periodically to avoid swallowing contaminated water. he said the water tasted 'like mud, poop, ground-up grass, detergent and gasoline'   an estimated 377million gallons of sewage is poured into the canal every year.

researchers at sun yat-sen university in guangzho tried to tweak the gene responsible for a potentially deadly blood disorder. the announcement confirms rumors that some researchers have been conducting ethically questionable experiments. some scientists have already reacted with horror at the idea, for fear it could be misused to create designer babies. the team used a technique known as crispr/cas9 to change the genes of human embryos.

silicon valley-based start-up is offering an at-home dna saliva test to detect the same gene mutations. it costs $249 (£167) and tests for mutations in brca1 and brca2. test currently costs more than $3,000 (£2,000) but is currently available in 45 states.

fire boat massey shaw was requisitioned from the london fire brigade in 1940 and transported to dunkirk to help with the evacuation of troops. it helped to save 600 british soldiers and returned to london to save st paul's cathedral. it took six years to restore the 80-year-old vessel and volunteers are now hoping to transport it back to the beaches. the boat is still capable of pumping out 3,000 gallons of water every minute - the same as four fire engines.

yamini karanam, 26, a student at indiana university, was diagnosed with a pineal tumour in her brain. she was struggling to understand things she had read and felt lost in conversations. doctors feared the growth was a cancerous tumour but it was in fact a teratoma - a growth containing bone, hair and teeth. she branded the tumour her 'evil twin sister who's been torturing me for 26 years' but tests revealed it was benign and she is recovering well.

the alarm failed at the former president's houston residence in september 2013 and even though the secret service bought a replacement system in january 2014, it took until december to install it. it came despite an agent's recommendation in 2010 that the alarm be replaced. bush and his wife barbara bush did not have a working alarm at their home for 15 months. the oversight is just the latest in a string of blunders by the agency. bush tweeted that he has 'great respect' for the security team.
duke university researchers compared its results to the most severe emissions scenarios outlined by the intergovernmental panel on climate change. it says climate models don't account for natural variability in surface temperatures. these 'climate wiggles' can slow or speed the rate of warming from decade to decade. but they could also cause the planet to warm up much faster than expected. the study compared 1,000 years of temperature records to the ipcc's climate change projections. it found the climate model may have been an over-interpretation of temperature trends.
three men in their 50s arrested on suspicion of murder of missing chef claudia lawrence have been released on bail. all three men are from the york area and were questioned over night by police. miss lawrence was reported missing by her father peter on march 18, 2009. a man in his 50s was arrested in march in connection with the chef's murder but remains on police bail. specialist forensic officers have searched the houses of the three men and their gardens.
air transport safety bureau released its report into the 'wheels up landing' on december 12, 2014 at jabiru airport, southeast of darwin. the pilot was flying a six-seat cessna 310 aircraft when he became distracted by one of his passengers. he blamed the passenger for coughing 'incessantly' into his headset during a short flight in the northern territory . however the report also found the pilot was'relatively new to the c-310' and unfamiliar with the plane equipment. there were no injuries to the pilot or passengers but the aircraft was damaged.

a second eruption from the calbuco volcano in southern chile has covered nearby towns and villages in a thick layer of ash. the volcano erupted unexpectedly on wednesday and sent up to ten billion cubic metres of ash six miles into the air. 4,000 people have been evacuated from cities as far as 18 miles away from the volcano. the first eruption in over four decades sent huge clouds of ash and smoke more than six miles in the air and created a display of lightning and lava.

image shows a giant distant cluster of about 3,000 stars called westerlund 2 inside a stellar 'breeding ground' called gum 29, 20,000 light-years from earth. it was taken by the hubble space telescope to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the launch of the observatory tomorrow. the image shows a cluster of stars in the constellation carina, a giant cluster of newborn stars.
david cameron said he knows that when it comes to immigration, 'fears and worries' remain. he said labour's 'failure on immigration' took 13 years to create. under labour, 90 per cent of job growth was taken up by foreign workers, he said. but under the conservatives, two-thirds of the uk's job growth now benefits british citizens.
an ana figueroa, 55, has spoken out for the first time since her son nicholas, 23, died in a gas explosion on new york city's 2nd avenue last month. the model was on a blind date at a sushi bar when he was killed in the blast on march 26. she said that she still cries every night and that those responsible for the explosion have not reached out to her. the family say that neither the landlord, mayor bill de blasio nor con edison have contacted them with condolences. the figueraas have set up a memorial at the site of the explosion.
scientists at the university of wisconsin-la crosse have warned bikram yoga raises the risk of heat stroke. practice involves performing 26 poses in a room heated to 40°c (105°f) in a 90-minute session. scientists advise that the standard 90 minute class is reduced to just an hour to reduce risks. a male participant recorded the highest core temperature of 40°c (104°f), while seven volunteers' temperatures reached 39°c.
leading psychologist jo lamble says belle gibson's actions point to both a narcissism disorder and anti-social personality disorder. gibson sensationally admitted that her terminal cancer diagnosis was a lie in a tell-all interview. she told the australian women's weekly that 'none of it's true'   lamble believes gibson could be displaying signs of both    she could also be suffering from munchhausen syndrome.   a lack of remorse is a common trait seen in those with anti- social personalities.
paul the apostle converted to christianity after seeing a bright light in the sky and hearing a divine voice. he was blinded for three days after seeing the light and hearing the voice. astronomers say descriptions of paul's experience match accounts of the fireball that exploded above chelyabinsk in russia in 2013.
matt dunford, 30, bombarded brazilian model amanda branco with up to 50 messages a day and tried to blackmail her out of £5,000. fitness fanatic claimed to be 'britain's vainest man' and spent £100,000 on his looks. he set up a fake escort website profile of her and sent it to her mother and sister. dunford was found guilty of two counts of harassment without violence and ordered to carry out 120 hours unpaid work.
amelia morton, 23, from birmingham weighed 12-and-a-half stone and was a size 16. was shocked into a post-graduation diet after being told by her father: 'boys don't fancy fat girls'   she put on three stone in her first few months of university and spent £5,000 a year on pizza. she signed up to the cambridge weight plan and dropped from 12 and a half stone to 9 and half stone. now a consultant, she is helping other people lose weight through the diet plan.
theresa dybalski, a retired insurance company from lackawanna, new york, won $1million off of a $5 scratch-off lottery ticket. the ticket was given to her by a friend during a birthday lunch. her friend has since died, so dybalski plans to share her winnings with the friend's family. she plans to address 'a couple of issues around the house'
fish and chips is partly portuguese and partly belgian. polo was introduced to brits by locals in the indian state of assam. chipped potatoes are believed to have been invented by a belgian woman in 1680. st george's day is to celebrate everything it is to be english. femail reveals the origins of some of our favourite things.
graeme whipps captured this image of the lyrid meteor shower in the skies above pitcaple in aberdeenshire yesterday. the annual celestial event is expected to peak tonight with between 10 and 20 meteors per hour. the meteor shower has been observed for 2,700 years and is most visible in the northern hemisphere.
catholic church figures show number of women taking holy vows has trebled from 15 in 2009 to 45 last year. from a low of seven in 2004, the figure has been rising for the past decade. 14 of the 45 women who entered convents last year were aged 30 or under.
stacey tipler, 33, used her job to steal £642,000 from the royal marsden nhs trust. she and partner scott chaplin, 34, who was the ringleader of the plot, were jailed last summer. judge ordered her to repay £28,737.90 within six months or spend another 18 months in jail. chaplin claimed he'made nothing' from the scam but was ordered to pay back £115,000. the hospital was left £310,000 out of pocket.
45 per cent of britons have lied about their earnings, spending, bills or credit cards. 41 per cent said they were in the dark about their partner's finances. one in five have lied to a partner about what they earn. the main reason for lying was to spare the feelings of a partner who earned less.
robert bates, 73, appeared in tulsa district court on tuesday and pleaded not guilty to second-degree manslaughter over the death of eric harris, 44. reserve deputy claims he mistakenly pulled out his gun instead of his taser and shot dead the man on april 2. investigation in 2009 found that bates was investigated over his questionable training and erratic behavior in the field. other deputies raised concerns about bates' behavior but he told them he could do whatever he wanted. bates shot harris as he fled the scene of an undercover gun-sale operation.
south yorkshire police missed 'intelligence and investigative opportunities' to tackle child sex exploitation in rotherham. failings left gangs free to rape, traffic and sexually abuse at least 1,400 children between 1997 and 2013. national crime agency nca said police force did not use 'alternative strategies' to protect victims or gather evidence. review was launched in the wake of the damning jay report into child sex abuse in the town.

meteor shower, visible around the world but best seen from europe, peaked overnight with between ten and 20 an hour. the lyrid meteor shower has been observed for the past 2,700 years and peaked overnight. the meteor shower is visible in the night sky but is visible from the uk and other parts of the world.

candlestick park has been torn down to make way for houses, a hotel and a shopping center. the iconic sports field was completed in 1960 and was home to the san francisco giants and san francisco 49ers. joe montana led the 49ers to four super bowls while playing at candlestick. the giants left the park at the end of the 1999 season. the park was also home to two world series baseball games and the last appearance of the beatles.

tao wei and yulong zhang from security firm fireeye have discovered a way to intercept a person's fingerprints on a samsung galaxy s5 running android 4.4 and older. the flaw lies in older versions of the android operating system, up to and including android 5.0. a hacker can access the kernel, or core, of the phone to monitor data. when a fingerprint is scanned it is encrypted, but the flaw allows them to collect scans from the sensor before being encrypted. they have not yet tested the flaw on other android phones with fingerprint scanners.
the female elephant was discovered stuck in a muddy quagmire by villagers in rural southern china. she became stuck in the night and was lying on her side in a state of desperation. more than 20 villagers and police officers teamed together to free the wild asian elephant. it took three hours using only ropes and wooden poles to haul the five-ton animal out of the swamp.

researchers at the university of bath and yale university created the invention. it uses a newly designed molecular catalyst to split water in an electrolyser and create clean hydrogen fuel. producing hydrogen requires huge amounts of energy and is difficult to make. the new catalyst could be used to store energy from renewable sources like solar power. this could make hydrogen fuel cells for cars more economical.

russian scientist says the distant ancestor of humans had tentacles. dr elena temereva came to her conclusion by studying the 'living fossil' lingula anatina. she says our ancestors had appendages that were used for movement and food collection. it's likely they also had a complex nervous system like we do today. one theory suggests our ancestors were worm-like creatures with a simple nervous system.

david cameron's party has 36 per cent of the vote compared to ed miliband's labour's 32 per cent, comres poll shows. one in five of those who say they are likely to vote still not sure which party to back. poll shows labour, the liberal democrats and ukip have all slipped in last fortnight. green party has five per cent share of vote, with greens on 5 per cent in tightest race since 1992.
researchers found evidence that neanderthals lived alongside predators in a cave in spain 200,000 years ago. researchers found fossilised remains of cave bears, hyenas, leopards, wolves and badgers in the cave. the cave was found in the foothills of the pyrenees mountains in catalonia .
thibaud jean leon vallet, 24, and his cousin jean mickael batrikian, 18, have been released from jail. the two french men were charged with animal cruelty after setting fire to a quokka. the pair spent seven days in hakea prison after pleading guilty to the crime. the men were ordered to pay a $4000 fine but opted to serve the sentence rather than pay the fine. they cost taxpayers $1810 each day they were in jail. both men were working as cleaners on rottnest island at the time of the incident. the creature survived the incident, but was singed by the flame.

the former cia director was sentenced to two years probation and fined $100,000 for leaking classified material to his mistress paula broadwell. petraeus, 62, was wearing his wedding ring to the court in charlotte, north carolina, on thursday. he apologized for his'mistakes' and said he was 'deeply sorry' for the 'pain' he caused his wife holly. he resigned from the cia in 2012 after it emerged that he had been having an affair with broadwell, who was writing his biography.
clarence david moore, 66, escaped from police custody three times during the 1970s. he was convicted of larceny in north carolina in 1967 and was sentenced to seven years in prison. he escaped from a prison in 1971 and was on the run until 1975. moore has lived in kentucky since at least 2009. his health is poor from a stroke late last year and he has difficulty speaking. he called police this week to surrender but was in a hospital bed and told them he needed medical help.

one in seven u.s. residents will be an immigrant by 2023 and one in five by 2060. immigrants could account for 82 per cent of all population growth in the country. immigration population will grow almost four times faster than native-born population. currently there are 12million undocumented immigrants in the united states. president barack obama is trying to expand immigration policies.

scientists in the netherlands were using the lofar radio telescope. they found it could measure changes in lightning caused by cosmic rays. a storm can have hundreds of millions of volts over multiple kilometres. the method could provide a novel way to understand thunderclouds .
andrew steele had pleaded not guilty by reason of mental disease to two counts of first-degree intentional homicide in the august 22 shooting deaths of his wife, ashlee steele, 39, and her sister, kacee tollefsbol, 38. forty-year-old former wisconsin sheriff's deputy    defense attorneys argued that lou gehrig's disease had damaged steele's brain, making him not criminally responsible for the deaths. a jury deliberated for about 10 hours before agreeing the verdict early on thursday.
britain has long seen prosecco as the second choice to champagne. last year uk sales overtook those of champagne for the first time - £181.8 million compared with £141.3 million. champagne is produced from grapes grown in the champagne region of northern france. while proseccos comes from a particular area of north-eastern italy.
andrew hutchinson raped two patients at john radcliffe hospital oxford and assaulted others. 29-year-old was convicted of 23 separate offences at oxford crown court last month. nurse was reported to hospital trust where he worked for indecent behaviour five years earlier. student nurse reported him for taking inappropriate photographs at the hospital in 2009. oxford university hospitals trust only reported complaint after being told of more serious allegations. he was later convicted of making indecent images of children, voyeurism and rape.
identical twins share 100 per cent of their genes, meaning it has been impossible to tell which sibling a sample comes from. researchers at the university of huddersfield have created a technique which can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins. by heating dna until its bonds break researchers can identify the difference between each twin. the technique is based on the concept of dna methylation - the molecular mechanism that turns genes on and off.
prime minister manuel valls said five terrorist attacks have been foiled in france since charlie hebdo massacre in paris. comments follow arrest of 24-year-old student sid ahmed ghlam who was allegedly preparing to storm catholic churches with assault rifles. he was caught on sunday after shooting himself in the leg after allegedly murdering aurelie chatelain. dna tests reportedly link him to the murder of the mother and fitness instructor, 33, who was shot dead in her car.
volcano calbuco, in southern chile, erupted at around 6pm local time forcing 1,500 people to flee their homes. it is believed to be among the three most dangerous of chile's 90 active volcanoes, but was not under observation. the volcano last erupted in 1972, and the last major eruption was in 1961. the eruption sent a thick plume of ash and smoke up to 100 miles into the sky, and was visible from up to 50 miles away.

carl bradey lost everything he owned in a house fire started by a candle in palmerston north last month. the 25-year-old smashed through a window to rescue a three-year old girl from a raging house fire. he suffered horrific burns to his whole body and is unable to feel anything in his right arm. he has undergone four major operations, including multiple skin grafts and the removal of a damaged vein.
the clinton foundation and the clinton health access initiative under- or over-reported millions of dollars in donations from foreign governments in their tax returns. the charity reported it had received no funds from governments for three years - even though it previously received millions. both charities are refiling at least five years of tax returns and may audit returns as far back as 15 years.
