kate temple was called a 'homewrecker' by victim shelley williams who accused her of having an affair with her partner. temple and her sister louise scollen got into a scuffle at charity event at dawdon cricket club. the 33-year-old tried to buy another drink from the bar but was refused. police found the missing portion of victim's ear the following day. temple admitted inflicting grievous bodily harm and was jailed for 20 months at durham crown court.
arturo vidal scored from the penalty spot after ricardo carvalho gave away a penalty in the champions league quarter-final first leg. the juventus midfielder scored a penalty on 57 minutes after alvaro morata was fouled in the box by monaco's danijel subasic. carlos tevez missed juventus' best chance of the game in the first half as he failed to score from close range.
steve cotterill has taken bristol city to the brink of a championship return after two seasons in league one. the club are eight points clear at the top of league one after a 1-1 draw at preston. owner steve lansdown has backed the club to the hilt with his own personal fortune.
emily clark, morgan bass, abbie deloach, caitlyn baggett, catherine pittman and brittney mcdaniel were all killed in the crash wednesday morning.    the five nursing students were on their way to school when a tractor-trailer plowed into traffic on interstate 16 near savannah. the driver of the truck, 55-year-old john wayne johnston, said he wished he was also killed. the students' families and friends gathered at sweetheart circle on campus for a candlelight vigil and memorial service.
jose mourinho's insistence on promoting young players at chelsea has buoyed the club's academy. john terry is the last player to come through the ranks and become a first-team regular at the club. jay dasilva and two of his brothers are a promising young players on the blues' books.
emmanuel adebayor has spent most of this season on the substitutes' bench for tottenham. the 31-year-old has scored just two goals in the premier league for spurs this season. he has earned £3.4million in wages since his last start for the club back in early november. he travelled to training in a rolls royce phantom drophead coupe earlier this year. adebyor's contract at spurs expires at the end of the current season.
aaron hernandez, 25, was convicted on april 15 of killing 27-year-old odin lloyd in 2013. he was moved wednesday to the maximum-security souza-baranowski correctional center in shirley, massachusetts. hernanderez had been at cedar junction prison in walpole since he was convicted of first-degree murder. the prison is about ten minutes from fort devens, where boston marathon bomber dzhokhar tsarnaev has been held for the last two years.

nigerian muslims on a rubber dinghy carrying around 100 african refugees became angry when one christian passenger began praying for his life. he refused to stop saying 'here, we only pray to allah'   when he refused, the muslim migrants threw 12 christians off the rickety boat. it comes amid reports that 10,000 refugees fleeing war and persecution in africa have been rescued by italian ships in the past week. but over 900 refugees have died or gone missing since the start of the year and 400 migrants died in two shipwrecks.
scott turner schofield will become the first transgender man to have a recurring role on a daytime soap opera when he appears on the bold and the beautiful. he will be playing nick, a mentor of sorts to the character of maya avant, played by karla mosley. it will mark the television acting debut of schofield, a speaker and author known for his one-person shows that address transgender issues.

fulham will sound out brentford manager mark warburton about taking over at craven cottage. owner shahid khan planning to release a budget of £20million to spend on new players. the championship strugglers are deliberating over the future of kit symons. sam allardyce could also be a shock contender to take over at the club.

bader's story predates the break in 1944 immortalised in the great escape starring steve mcqueen and richard attenborough. he was shot down over france in 1941 and ended up in a german prison camp in warburg. bader lost his legs in a flying accident in 1931 and remained in captivity until the end of the war. his life story has already been the subject of a hollywood film called reach for the sky.

leonie granger, 25, targeted playboy mehmet hassan, 56, after spotting him at a casino in london's west end. care assistant used her good looks to befriend the poker player and showered him with gifts. she was found guilty of manslaughter over the death of professional gambler at the old bailey. but after going back to his flat with him she made her excuses and left the door unlocked. her boyfriend and an accomplice kicked him to death as they ransacked his home to steal his winnings. granger was jailed for 16 years after being found guilty by a majority of manslaughter - but not murder.
brent council said it was no longer able to afford to pay for live-in carer for war veteran robert clark. mr clark has spent £50,000 of his life savings paying for his care. he is one of britain's oldest surviving prisoners of war and has lived in his home for 50 years. armed forces charity help for heroes has set up a fund-raising appeal to help keep him in his own home. in just four days the appeal has raised £10,000 to help pay for four to five months of care for the pensioner. but brent council has refused to increase its funding for a carer.
juan cuadrado has failed to impress at chelsea after signing for £23m from fiorentina. wilfried bony has scored only one goal for manchester city this season. mauro zarate is yet to make an impression on loan at loftus road. callum mcmanaman's move to west brom has coincided with the latics' relegation.
a new documentary is about to blow the lid on the illegal organ trade in china. 'human harvest: china’s organ trafficking’ will show how researchers uncovered the gory details. human rights lawyer david matas and former canadian member of parliament david kilgour investigated allegations of organ harvesting of falun gong practitioners. it's claimed that political prisoners are being used as live organ donors. the china organ trade is now allegedly worth a staggering us$1 billion a year. this despite the fact 10,000 organs are transplanted in ch china every year. only a tiny number of people are on the official donor register.
liverpool face aston villa in the fa cup semi-final on sunday. philippe coutinho has been in superb form since the turn of the year. the midfielder has been nominated for the pfa player of theyear awards. coutinho described it as the 'ultimate honour' to speak to brazil legend pele.
mike ashley has never been popular at st james' park but the protests have ramped up recently. newcastle have lost seven straight premier league games under interim manager john carver. the magpies owner looks after the money and is not a football man. ashley's sensitivity to criticism is one of his biggest weaknesses.
real madrid drew 0-0 with atletico madrid in the champions league first leg at the vicente calderon on tuesday night. raphael varane impressed again for real madrid but gareth bale failed to make an impact. jan oblak was brilliant again in goal for diego simeone's side. the keeper made a superb save to deny bale early on in the game.
carter and jack hanson, from raleigh, north carolina, met world war ii veteran robert harding, 89, on board the yorktown aircraft carrier in charleston, south carolina. mr harding served as an aircraft handler on the warship decades before his young friends were born. the three friends had been in contact for about a year via email.
historian stephen chambers has collected more than 100 rare photographs of the gallipoli landings to mark the centenary of the disastrous campaign. the campaign claimed the lives of 140,000 troops in eight months of fighting during world war one. many of the images were taken by soldiers who survived winston churchill's disastrous operation. the images show soldiers preparing for the landings and the moment they made the dash across no man's land.
dougie freedman is on the verge of signing a new two-year deal at nottingham forest. freedman replaced stuart pearce at the city ground in february. forest owners are pleased with freedman's work since replacing the cult hero.

new satellite images reveal that china has built a runway on disputed fiery cross reef in the south china sea. philippines, vietnam, malaysia, brunei and taiwan all claim the disputed territory. china could be planning to build another airstrip in nearby subu reef which could be used for military operations. u.s. president barack obama accused china of bullying others with its'military muscle'   china's building activity in the spratly islands has infuriated neighbouring countries and the united states.
frank ernest shepherd, iii of houston, texas, led police on a 20 minute high-speed chase after being pulled over for a traffic stop. he was shot dead by police after reaching into his backseat and being shot by two officers. shepherd, 41, was a father of three with another baby on the way. the chase ended when he crashed into another car and reached into his car and was shot by police. no weapons were found in the car and it is not known what he was reaching for.
u.s. president barack obama condemned china for building artificial islands in the disputed south china sea. he claimed china was 'using its sheer size and muscle to force countries into subordinate positions' but chinese leadership claimed it is washington which possesses the greatest military muscle. newly-released satellite images show chinese vessels dredging sand onto artificially-built land masses near the spratly islands. china's foreign ministry said the country has 'indisputable rights' to the islands and it was protecting its nation's sovereignty.

zermatt in swiss town of zermatt has banned selfies with st bernard dogs. animal welfare charity alleged the dogs were kept in'miserable conditions' in a condemned building. the dogs are being kept as tourist props by a company that treats them badly. the mayor of the town has imposed the ban after a report from an animal charity.
living near a congested road can increase the chance of developing dementia. researchers examined the brains of more than 900 people aged more than 60 and assessed pollution risk. living near polluted roads can lead to ‘silent strokes’ which cause shrinkage of the brain and other damage.
list is dominated by european nations, particularly those in scandinavia. britons are happier now than they were two years ago, but still ranked at 21st place. icelandic citizens jumped from number nine in 2013 to number two on the 158-nation strong list. world's least happy countries are places ravaged by war and extreme poverty - with syria, burundi and togo at the bottom of the list.

the 1961 ferrari 250 gt swb california spider is regarded by many as the most beautiful convertible ever made. it was used as the car for the famous scene in the 1986 teen comedy ferris bueller's day off. in the film, cameron accidentally crashes the car into the ravine after taking it out for a spin. the car is almost identical to the model driven in the movie and has a guide price of £8million. but it is expected to sell for much more after a model previously owned by alain delon sold for £12.5 million earlier this year.
fossicker ashley manzie unearthed the ww1 war medal in a melbourne park with his metal detector. it belonged to frederick george biddulph, who served with the 23rd australian infantry battalion at gallipolli. the medal is thought to have belonged to his brother, lewis 'bunny' bidulph. he joined the army in his name because he lost two fingers 'blowing up fish' before the war. stephen norton is stephen's great-nephew and has been researching the family history.
the vaccine, known as rts,s, took 30 years to develop and is designed to be used by children in africa. drug firm glaxosmithkline has applied for a licence from european medicines agency. it could be approved by october, making it the first approved malaria vaccine.

anthony trollope, a famous novelist, introduced post boxes to the uk in 1852 after seeing them in france. limited edition sheet of stamps feature images of trollope and his life, including the first post box design. the first boxes were erected in jersey in jersey as a trial before appearing across the country. there are now 115,300 post boxes in the  uk.

jay brittain, 63, was worried that the baby owls at small breeds farm park and owl centre, herefordshire, look so similar at birth that he could end up overfeeding them. so he instructed workers at the farm to varnish the claws of each owlet using nail polish. the first born tawny owl is given orange talons, the second hatched has painted purple and for the third born, pink.
michael hanline, 69, was convicted of murder for the fatal shooting of truck driver jt mcgarry in 1980, and was dismissed of charges on wednesday.    on the day of his release last november, the moment he ate his first burger after being in prison for 36 years was captured on video. he is seen tucking into a bacon cheeseburger at a carl's jr restaurant .  hanline was the longest-serving wrongfully imprisoned inmate in california's history.

punting analyst mike steward has outlined the martingale betting strategy to win at two up. it's a system of betting which originated in france and is used by punters on anzac day. if you lose, you have to double your bet until your coins fall right. the strategy is known as the double-up approach to win and is known to be popular with punters. two up is one of australia's longest lasting traditions and is legal to be played across the country on saturday.
molly parks, 24, was found in the bathroom of the pizza restaurant where she worked in manchester, new hampshire, on april 16 with a needle still in her arm. her father, tom parks, wrote an honest obituary about her struggle with drugs. he pleaded with other families to be supportive and get help for their loved ones with addictions. she had abused alcohol and prescription pills before turning to heroin.

study shows 40 minutes of extra natural light per day could reduce cases of short-sightedness by 26 per cent in chinese children. scientists had thought reading or looking at a screen could cause the condition. lack of natural light is thought to be driving up rates of shortsightedness among the young. two in five adults in britain are shortsighted, and four in five in china.

the anonymous ohio woman and her catholic husband decided to have an abortion at 23 weeks. their unborn daughter had achromosomal defect 'incompatible with life outside the womb'   the woman's daughter had 69 chromosomes instead of the normal 46. the woman was at a higher risk of miscarriage and death if the baby died in the womb. she and her husband chose to terminate the pregnancy.

tv presenter richard wilkins made the pilgrimage to gallipoli on the eve of centenary commemorations. he retraced his grandfather george william thomson's footsteps as part of the new zealand medical corps. wilkins is rarely overcome with emotion despite working in the industry for almost 30 years. standing on anzac cove thinking of what his grandfather had faced 100 years ago, reduced him to tears.
rachael bishop, 19, was working an afternoon shift at the ice cream chain's lynnwood store when a man came in and showed her he had a gun. bishop tried to plead with the man when he ordered her to hand over all the money in the cash register. as the man reached into the till she tried to swat his hand away. the robber punched bishop in the head multiple times and stole $280 from the register. bishop ran after the robber through the parking lot, warning people nearby that he was armed. she said it was 'just a reaction', an instinct to protect the store.

artist frank mckeever from florida created these amazing posters. they show how we could colonise various worlds in the solar system. included are humans skiing on a moon of uranus and living in cities on mars. others show life on europa and near saturn - and a destroyed earth. the posters were created by artist and entrepreneur frankmckeever, 28, from st augustine. he hopes the posters encourage us to expand our presence into the solarsystem.

the number of passenger vehicle teen drivers involved in u.s. fatal crashes decreased from 5,724 to 2,568, per 100,000 people in the last decade. new safety features in cars and graduate license restrictions are among the top reasons for the drop in fatalities. between 2004 and 2013, the number of teen drivers aged 16 to 19 involved in fatal crashes dropped 55 per cent.

the small fort was discovered on top of dunnicaer sea stack on the coast of scotland. it was built by the picts and could only be accessed by climbing up the cliff face with ropes. the fort is thought to date from the 5th to 6th century and was cut off from the land at high tide. it is believed to have been built as a look out post on the top of a 20-foot-high sea stack.

'escort card' was a comical printed card men would hand to women they found attractive in late 19th-century america. collector alan mays has unearthed a treasure trove of these vintage ice-breakers. many of the cards bear phrases such as:'may i escort you home' and 'who the devil are you?'   the cards were used by men seeking the company of women and were a more casual version of business cards.

a supervolcano in yellowstone national park releases around 45,000 metric tonnes of carbon dioxide each day. a magma chamber beneath the surface is not considered large enough to produce these levels. geophysicists tracked seismic waves from 5,000 earthquakes to find the source in a secondary chamber deeper underground. it is so large its partly-molten rock could fill the grand canyon 11 times over. the yellowstone supervol volcano is one of the largest active continental silicic volcanic fields in the world and last erupted 640,000 years ago.
risk for cigar smokers of dying from oral, oesophageal or lung cancer was at least as bad as for cigarettes. news comes as cigar use rises in the us, where study was carried out, and cigarette smoking declines. cigar consumption more than doubled from 2000-2011 - in contrast with a 33 per cent fall for cigarettes .

scientists at university college london studied the brains of 17 professional comedians and a barrister. brain scans revealed differences in the way their brains worked while talking. super speakers were found to have less activity in a key area of the brain involved in speech comprehension. this suggests they put less effort into the basic mechanics of speech.

the dardanelles campaign was one of the most spectacular allied failures of world war i. nearly 400,000 allied soldiers were killed in the disastrous campaign. allied troops landed on the gallipoli peninsula on april 25, 1915, to begin the invasion of turkey. the campaign almost ended the career of winston churchill, the instigator of the campaign. today is the centenary of the start of the allied invasion of the peninsula.

nasa scientists in california have revealed a distant image of curiosity on the surface of mars. it was taken by the mars reconnaissance orbiter from 187 miles up. nasa scientists have revealed that the rover's tracks cannot be seen. this was spotted by the orbiter, but it is the first time in 2015. the rover’s tracks are not visible - possibly because they have been swept away by martian weather. curiosity is parked over dark sand in a valley with light-toned outcrops of rock in gale crater.

wat pha luang ta bua in thailand's western kanchanaburi province - commonly known as 'the tiger temple' - is home to 147 tigers in the care of monks. thai wildlife officials began a headcount on friday after a temple vet complained to authorities that three tigers had recently disappeared from the sanctuary. the temple has long proved a hit among tourists who flock there to visit the monks and their pets.

the last of the woolly mammoths were isolated on an arctic island for around 5,000 years, forcing them to inbreed. genetic analysis of two woolly mammoth remains show that their population became chronically inbred. scientists claim to have inserted a dozen of the creature's genes into the live dna of an elephant. the study raises the prospect of bringing the mammoth back to life using cloning techniques with modern elephants.

the majority of the world’s volcanoes are found deep underwater and now scientists have been able to record one of these eruptions as it happens to discover the sound it makes. underwater volcanoes give off a muted thrum rather than an explosive roar. the research could allow scientists to monitor undersea volcanoes far more effectively. volcanoes lurking hidden under the world's oceans may play a greater role in climate change than previously thought.

hormone replacement therapy increases a woman's risk of breast cancer up to eight years after stopping treatment. women's health initiative in the us and the million women study in the uk both found strong evidence hrt increases risk of the disease. combined hrt users have double the risk of cancer compared to those who don't take the treatment.

a new species of frog has been found in brazil called hylodes japi, it was found to mate underground in secret chambers. males and females typically find a spot to mate in about five minutes. the discovery was made by researchers in the atlantic forest of serra do japi in the state of são paulo, brazil. the males build these secret chambers to avoid predators and cover up the eggs to protect them.

brynn johnson lost her 17-month-old daughter rowyn in september last year after cassie miller accidentally ran over the little girl with her car. cassie was picking up brynn's younger daughter from preschool when she was killed. the two women now run a charity initiative called raise for rowyn to help other families who have experienced a child tragedy.

the bill would prevent adolescents from smoking, buying or possessing both traditional and electronic cigarettes. governor david ige hasn't yet decided whether he will sign the bill. 5,600 kids in hawaii try smoking each year and 90 percent of daily smokers begin the habit before age 19. bill includes a $10 fine for first-time offenders.
dr adrian quarterman, of dundee university, is working on a laser which could convert sun beams into energy. he says it could be used to power homes in the future - but says it is not powerful enough to be used as a weapon. however, he hasn't ruled out the possibility of using them for weapons.

the mistley thorn has been around for ten years and revels in an understated luxury. built as a coaching inn in 1723, the hotel is a two-minute walk from mistley station. mersea oysters are available year-round at the hotel.

manchester university in indiana was on lockdown late friday night after a 'likely prank call' about an armed person near the main administration building. police said they received a phone call from someone saying that they had stabbed their roommate at the university and was armed with a shotgun. manchester university advised students to shelter in place as police and a bomb squad responded to the scene. indiana state police and the bomb squad investigated the incident, though left after deciding it should be investigated as a likely prank call.
boffins are currently working towards digitally recreating the cognitive abilities of the honeybee. their aim is to build a robot that thinks, senses and acts just like a bee. the artificial brain is being created by the green brain project at the universities of sheffield and sussex. scientists have only managed to clone the part of the bee's brain which allows it to see.

starbucks announced late friday night that a computer outage that affected registers at 8,000 stores in the us and canada has now been resolved. the global coffeehouse chain said stores are expected to open for 'business as usual' saturday. starbucks says a sales register computer glitch affected sales at company-operated stores. the company said earlier the outage affected 7,000 of its stores and 1,000 in canada. many starbucks locations closed their doors so as not to give away free drinks during the shutdown.

the nine-gram robots were built by mechanical engineers at stanford university in california. they can haul more than a kilogram up a wall and can drag a weight up to 2000 times heavier. they could be used in emergencies, in factories or on construction sites. geckos have small hairs on their feet to enable them to climb walls without falling off.
sergio gomez has been excavating a tunnel beneath a pre-aztec pyramid in teotihuacan, mexico, for six years. he found 'large quantities' of liquid mercury in a chamber at the end of a tunnel sealed off for more than 1,800 years. gomez hopes that it will lead him to the tomb of the city's king. he is unsure as to why the mercury was in the tunnel, but believes it could have a supernatural significance for ritual ends.

susie clark, of evening shade, arkansas, found the 3.69-carat white diamond in a 37.5-acre search field at crater of diamonds state park. clark first visited the park 33 years ago with her mother and grandmother. she prayed to god as she searched the field and claimed her prayer helped her find the gem. she named the diamond the hallelujah diamond. it is the largest diamond of the 122 found in the park this year.

michael alonso and 1st lt lantz balthazar of malmstrom air force base in montana have been charged. one of their fellow missile officers pleaded guilty to illegal drug use in january and was kicked out of the service. both face hearings to determine whether they will be court-martialed. cases stem from an investigation that led to the disclosure of a separate exam-cheating scandal.
colin shearing, 70, was convicted of indecent assault and sentenced to three years in jail at swansea crown court. he twice assaulted a six-year-old girl in the 1980s and was jailed in his absence. author booked himself into hotel des nations in paris before moving to a second and third hotel to evade police. european arrest warrant has been issued for shearing after he fled across the channel to avoid being jailed. he faces an additional sentence for absconding after being convicted of the attack.
john caudwell, the founder of phones4u, bought the audley street garage in mayfair, central london for £155million. it will include five townhouses, three penthouses, a mews home and 21 luxury flats. the complex is set to rival one hyde park and 199 knightsbridge. but it could face trouble getting planning permission as neighbours may object to four basement levels and nine storeys.
princes charles and harry joined 10,000 people in a dawn pilgrimage at gallipoli to honour the bravery of the allied troops. the queen joined a service of remembrance at westminster abbey, where she laid a wreath at the grave of the unknown warrior. prince charles was in turkey with prince harry for a service at new zealand. the royal family led tributes to those who fought and fell in the ill-fated offensive. queen led the nation at a ceremony at wellington arch and whitehall.
john doyle, 79, was helping two 12-year-old girls cross the road to get to school in timperley, greater manchester. genti rustemi, 45, drove over the crossing point without slowing and attacked lollipop man. mr doyle was left with a broken rib and a punctured lung after being punched in the chest. rustemi escaped a jail sentence after admitting assault causing actual bodily harm and dangerous driving.
rebecca rice, 16, struggled with her nerves ahead of her french oral exam at bodmin college in cornwall. she told her french teacher lorette esteve she had tried everything to calm her nerves. the only thing that made her feel comfortable was her pet dog holly. she was advised to bring the 11-year-old labrador into the gcse oral test.
craig bryson opened the scoring in the third minute for blackpool. tom ince scored his second goal of the night against his former side at the ipro stadium. darren bent added a third goal in the second half after scoring from the penalty spot.
sian harkin, 54, signed cheques totalling £30,000 to cowboy builder lee slocombe claiming work was to be carried out at llwyncelyn primary school in porth, wales. mother-of-two used the school chequebook when she was headteacher and continued to use it when she moved schools. she gave £80,000 worth of work to builder using the money to build rain shelter at her home. harkin even forged the deputy head's name in order to cash one of the cheques.
freddie sears opened the scoring for ipswich after eight minutes against cardiff city. eoin doyle equalised for cardiff in the 13th minute at portman road. cole skuse made it 2-1 in the 29th minute with his first goal for the club. daryl murphy scored a third goal in the 90th minute to make it 3-1.
tony pulis insists west brom chairman jeremy peace has told him takeover will not drag on. peace is open to offers for the club, but wants a deal done by june. the baggies face liverpool at the hawthorns on saturday.
chairman jeremy peace wants to sell west brom for between £150million and £200million. groups from america, australia and the far east have begun due diligence on the club. manager tony pulis has been assured the deal will be done by july. the baggies are currently 13th in the premier league.
liverpool lost to aston villa in the fa cup semi-final on sunday. brendan rodgers is set for his third season without a trophy. rodgers has spent more than £200million since taking charge at liverpool in june 2012. he has signed 22 players but only seven of those have been a success. manchester united and chelsea have spent more but both have won trophies. arsene wenger has spent £183m but won two trophies.
capital one became the first provider to scrap its cashback offer for new customers after announcement of eu cap. company warned existing customers loyalty points they earn will be much lower from june 1. financial experts believe other firms are likely to follow suit. european parliament voted in favour of a cap limiting fees retailers can be charged for processing payments.
north sentinel island has remained untouched by modern civilisation for an estimated 60,000 years. members of a mysterious tribe have rejected modern civilisation and are hostile to outsiders. it is illegal to go within three miles of the island and visitors risk being attacked by members of the tribe. the indian government has established a three-mile exclusion zone to protect the islanders. the sentinelese tribe killed two men who were fishing illegally on the island in 2006.
adriana alvarez, 22, says that even with assistance from food stamps, medicaid, and a child care subsidy, she is barely getting by, despite having worked for mcdonald's for five years. she is a leader with fight for $15, an international movement to raise minimum wage laws and acquire the right to unionize.   she said the first thing she would do with an increased wage would be to find a 'decent place to live' for her three-year-old son manny.
edward moore was working in his first job as assistant director of music at king edward's school in witley, surrey. he had consensual sex with 16-year-old student in his office after she told him she had been abused by another music teacher. moore, 24, was jailed for nine months after admitting two counts of abusing a position of trust and sexual activity with a girl aged 13 to 17.
bristol city became the first side in the football league to win promotion after beating bradford 6-0. the robins reached 92 points with their 27th league victory of the season at valley parade. james tavernier opened the scoring for bristol city in the first half. joe bryan, luke ayling, aden flint and aaron wilbraham also scored for the visitors.
scientists in colorado have found evidence for a new solar season cycle. every two years it appears 'bands' of magnetic field move to the surface of the sun. this combines with the existing 11-year solar cycle, causing mega storms and solar flares. when the two seasons combine, the sun's activity can be amplified.
trials show avastin, which is used in several other cancers, gives women four months’ extra life. drug plus chemotherapy has now been licensed by european regulators. each year an estimated 600 women with advanced cervical cancer could benefit from the drug. nearly 3,000 women are diagnosed with cervical cancer in the uk each year.
thor dalhaug died an hour after birth following a difficult delivery at lincoln county hospital. junior surgeon tried to deliver baby using forceps in 'unorthodox and unacceptable' way. thor died of brain damage as a result of attempts to free the baby's head during delivery. senior managers at the hospital tried to remove the use of forceps from account of birth.
dina amos-larkin was attending sports festival in salou, spain when she fell while talking to her mother on the phone. 21-year-old law student was in medically-induced coma for two weeks after falling from hotel balcony. authorities initially said the fall was a suicide bid, but she was not drunk. she was left paralysed from the neck down after the fall at hotel jaime 1.
philip gigante, 41, whose grandfather vincent 'the chin' gigante was the head of the genovese crime family. he was elected into the positions by residents of airmont, new york. the republican real-estate lawyer will get $25,000 a year for the part time job.
chris, 20, ordered some computer equipment be delivered from griffith university at nathan in brisbane to a parcel locker at sunnybank. the package was sent almost 2000kms away to chullora in new south wales. chris said australia post had not contacted him to apologise for the delay.
protein world's billboard campaign features a svelte bikini-clad model asking 'are you beach body ready?'   company's marketing boss claims the firm is 'just trying to make the nation healthier'    more than 50,000 people sign a petition to have the posters removed and a protest rally is planned for this weekend.   the company has received bomb threats in the wake of the campaign but said it had been 'brilliant' and he didn't see company changing.
tony hunt's daughter's ginger cat harry was hit by a patrol car near his home in derby, derbyshire. police officers knocked on a neighbour's door and asked for a black bin bag to dispose of the pet. mr hunt is demanding an apology from police after a neighbour reported the incident. the three-year-old cat was micro-chipped and police could have contacted the family.
at least one is dead after a powerful storm capsized several sailboats participating in a regatta in dauphin island, alabama. more than 100 sailboats and as many as 200 people were participating in the event. a man was plucked from the waters by the coast guard around 9 p.m. and crews are still searching for at least four people missing in the waters. the storm rolled through the area about 4pm on saturday.
moving nation's nuclear deterrent to the british territory could cost £3billion and take 10 years to complete. snp want to eject trident from scotland, but both the conservatives and labour have committed to retaining the base on the clyde. ministry of defence officials have sounded out gibraltar as an alternative to naval base.
kate, 33, is due to give birth at st mary's hospital in paddington, central london, at the end of april. royal's baby is expected to be born before end of the month - but duchess could be four days overdue. doctors may have already spoken to her about the possibility of being induced this week.
planners in royal borough have allowed two costa cafes less than 500 yards apart in windsor. latest costa will open on site of former dedworth road hsbc branch, last bank in area. it means there will be two costas just a brisk five-minute walk apart, plus costa express at a petrol station between them.
ian brady, 77, wrote letters from his bed at ashworth psychiatric hospital in merseyside. he was jailed for life in 1966 after torturing and killing five children with his then-girlfriend myra hindley. brady wrote the letters from bed at the hospital and thinks david dimbleby is an 'establishment dumpling'   brady murdered five children between 1963 and 1965 along with accomplice hindley, who died in 2002.
eight-minute video appears to be narrated by a british jihadist fighter from the uk. it shows a convoy of fighters celebrating capture of jisr al-shughour, a town in syria. syrian government warplanes carried out more than a dozen air strikes on the city, killing some 20 fighters. the video is believed to be filmed by a young man who has travelled to syria to join the fight.
max azria's home is spread across three acres in holmby hills, one of the city's 'platinum triangle'    the home was built in 1939 by architect paul williams, who built homes for hollywood stars such as frank sinatra and lucille ball. there are 17 bedrooms to choose from and 60 rooms to explore inside the mansion. azria bought the mansion for $14.4million in 2005 and spent $30million on a massive renovation.
perry clawson, a former army colonel, pitched up outside university of florida's zeta beta tau frat house in protest. frat members accused of drunkenly taunting and urinating on servicemen. one veteran said students spat on him and his service dog at warrior beach vacation retreat. the frat has been suspended, and three of its members expelled.
former fbi director louis freeh nearly died last summer when he was involved in a car crash in barnard, vermont. it's believed that he fell asleep behind the wheel while driving at up to 65 mph on august 25, 2014. freeh severed an artery in one of his legs and would have bled to death in 60 seconds if it weren't for the quick response of paramedics and an fbi agent on the scene. eight months later, freeh is still recovering from the crash and walking with the aid of a cane.
simon wood, 38, from oldham won masterchef last friday. everything he knows about cooking is self-taught - he hasn't been on a cookery course. he learned from reading recipe books and watching television shows. practises his cooking skills on his four children - he has always wanted to be a chef.
new nhs guidelines urge gps to draw up end-of-life plans for over-75s and say it will improve patients' care. medical professionals say it is 'blatantly wrong' and will frighten the elderly into thinking they are being 'written off'   nhs says the guidance is 'the thin end of the wedge of assisted suicide'

272 youngsters left disabled by foetal alcohol syndrome were hospitalised in england over the past 12 months. world health organisation says at least one in 100 babies born in uk could suffer learning and behavioural problems. experts warn the actual number affected by mother's drinking could be far greater.
video created by oprah winfrey's own tv, super soul sunday. reveals what children can teach us about anger. children describe their feelings in the midst of a temper tantrum. explain what happens in their minds when they become angry and upset. learn to take a deep breath to help children diffuse their own anger.
six dancers filmed performing 'erotic and sexual twerk dance' in front of malaya zemlya monument in novorossiysk, southern russia. two of the women were jailed for ten days and a third for 15 days for hooliganism. two others were fined, while a sixth dancer escaped punishment as she was under 16. the video was posted to youtube to encourage people to join their dance school. women's sentences come as russia prepares to mark 70th anniversary of second world war victory.
labour leader ed miliband has pledged to introduce mansion tax on homes worth more than £2million. annual levy will be introduced to raise money for the nhs and will hit his own home in north london. estate agents in london are now offering higher 'cameron price' and lower'miliband' price for some of the most expensive homes.
bbc has admitted it 'occasionally' runs out of meeting rooms in its £1billion new broadcasting house. corporation spent £47,198 on booking external spaces nearby during the last financial year. bbc is paying tens of thousands of pounds of taxpayers' money to book meetings in nearby buildings. the bbc's headquarters in central london was opened by the queen in 2013.
dr alex zhavoronkov, an anti-ageing expert, believes medical advances and knowledge of lifestyles will lead to a longer life expectancy. he is following a strict regime of regular exercise combined with drugs and supplements and regular health checks. shunning marriage, children and material assets to focus on research.

university of bristol study of 40 men and women found drinking a glass of wine makes you more attractive to the opposite sex. but too much booze leads to 'excessive and unattractive' changes in facial expressions. study found alcohol has 'positive pulling power' but only if subject isn't too intoxicated.

broccoli chemical sulforaphane is known to block the inflammation and damage to cartilage associated with arthritis. but patients would have to eat several pounds of the vegetable every day to derive significant benefit. natural form of the chemical is too unstable to turn into a medicine. but uk drug company evgen pharma has developed a stable synthetic version of chemical.

more than 2,500 people died in the 7.8 magnitude earthquake which struck nepal's capital kathmandu yesterday morning. the monuments of the capital are recognised as a unesco world heritage site. many of the most recognisable buildings, including towers and temples, have been destroyed by the disaster. the dharahara tower, which was built in 1832, was almost completely obliterated by the quake.
abby lubiewski was born with hallerman-streiff, a rare genetic syndrome that resulted in congenital cataracts. abby can only perceive light and dark when she's not wearing her glasses. her mother amanda was outraged when she found out her daughter was forced to take off her thick glasses for a school portrait. lifetouch school photography has apologized to the family and will re-take abby's school picture for free.

whaling captain george grimes cottage is a heritage-listed colonial georgian residence with three storeys and six bedrooms in millers point, sydney. the home was built by the whaling captain and is set to go under the hammer for $4million. the 416sqm inner city block property boasts stunning views of the harbour bridge and a row of early 1840s terraces. the sandstone and brick home has a formal lounge and dining room with original fireplaces and an open-plan kitchen.

doctors in kurdistan are performing illegal abortions and secret surgeries to'reverse loss of virginity' on young yazidi girls. some of the victims are as young as eight and have been held as sex slaves by isis militants. around 40,000 people were kidnapped at gunpoint when isis fighters attacked yazidis last summer. many of the women and girls have escaped the islamic state and now face being shunned by their religious community. some have returned after falling pregnant by their captors and being forced to marry.

the dragon king dinosaur skull is being sold by hong kong-based experts evolve. it is more than 95 per cent complete bone and is 9.2ft (2.8 metres) long. the fossil was first found in montana in 1992 and is expected to fetch $1.8 million at auction. the skull is known as lung wong, or the dragon king, and is said to be the world's largest intact dinosaur skull. the last time a fossil of this size and quality was sold was a tyrannosaurus rex fossil in 1997.

the horseshoe-shaped glass walkway in chongqing extends 87.5ft from the edge of a cliff and extends over the valley floor 2,350ft below. it is the longest cantilever bridge in the world, beating arizona’s grand canyon skywalk by 16.4ft. located in the longgang national geological park, the bridge can accommodate up to 200 visitors at once. the bridge was designed to withstand an 8.0-magnitude earthquake and level 14 typhoon.
scientists took ct scans of baby teeth found at two sites in north italy and found they belonged to a group of modern humans known as the protoaurignacian culture. the teeth are the oldest modern human remains in europe and are 40,000 years old. they claim the arrival of this modern human culture led to the rapid disappearance of neanderthals .

labour leader wants to bring in 'use it or lose it' powers allowing councils to encourage building by raising tax on unused land. mr miliband wants to impose rent controls and link rents to inflation under three-year contracts. property analysts say move would take britain back to the 'dark days of the seventies'    institute of directors describes the land grab as a'stalinist attack on property rights' andrew percy, tory candidate for brigg and goole, condemns the policy.
jackson was taken into police custody on saturday for assault with a deadly weapon in west lake, la. the 34-year-old is accused of stabbing a man with a knife on friday. the victim told police the man was hobie - jackson played hobie buchannon on baywatch. he is well-known for his troubled personal life. in january the former baywatch star is alleged to have attempted to murder his ex-wife, loni willison, in an attack caught in an audio recording.
john hancock repeatedly called his sister bianca rinehart 'the fat' and 'fatty' in emails tendered to a federal court in sydney. mr hancock was urging his sister to join him in legal action against their mother gina. the siblings are in a bitter trust dispute over the family's trust fund. gina is the richest person in australia and accused of defrauding her children of billions of dollars.
lisa mcelroy, 50, reportedly sent the explicit link to her drexel university students under the subject line 'great article on writing briefs' on march 31. she said she was'mortified' and 'in terrible shape' when she found out she sent the link to students. the professor, a tenured professor at the university, has spoken out about reclaiming her dignity since the public scandal.
john sims, who had burkitt's lymphoma, died on saturday, with his new wife lindsey sims by his side. the pair married march 21 at the university of texas m.d. anderson cancer center after john was told his cancer was terminal. after the wedding they set off on a a cross-country road trip. but john's condition worsened and he died at a hospice in grand junction, colorado.
condemned bali nine member myuran sukumaran has requested to spend his final days painting. his brother chinthu has pleaded with the indonesian president to call off the firing squad. andrew chan has asked to spend last hours in church with his family. the bali 9 pair will be executed just after the stroke of midnight on wednesday.    the pair's lawyer removed four self portrait depicting the artist shot through the heart from the death row inmate's cell.
nicholas pence, 25, and his father david, 56, were shot dead at their home in new orleans, louisiana, on wednesday. had been celebrating a football game in their garage, or'man cave'   found by nicholas's mother, elizabeth, and wife, who called police. dexter allen, 17, and haraqyon degruy, 18, have been charged with the double murder. police believe it was a botched burglary, but no motive has yet been established.
joyce cox was strangled to death on her way home from school in cardiff on september 28, 1939. her body was found dumped by a railway station but her killer has never been caught. four-year-old was just days away from celebrating her fifth birthday. police ordered that the case file be kept secret until 2040 but family are accusing police of a 'cover-up'   force said information could not be released because it is unfair to the mystery suspect.
vladimir bukovsky, 72, has lived in the uk since he fled the soviet union in the 1970s after he was accused of spreading anti-soviet propaganda. he has been summonsed to appear in court next month to be charged with making and possessing indecent images of children. he will appear at cambridge magistrates' court after a police investigation. he denies the allegations and has been charged with five counts of making an indecent photograph of a child. he spent 12 years in prison and forced labour camps after fleeing the communist state.
nursultan nazarbayev has been re-elected as president of kazakhstan with 97 per cent of the vote. the 74-year-old former steel worker has ruled the oil-producing nation since 1989. he said if he had interfered in the vote, it would have been 'undemocratic'   international monitors have voiced concern about the poll saying there was not a genuine choice of other candidates.
the ocean-going tug mv hamal was intercepted by the frigate hms somerset and border force cutter valiant. it was intercepted about 100 miles east of the aberdeenshire coast. nine men were detained for questioning and later charged with drug trafficking offences.
judith russell, whose daughter katherine married tamerlan tsarnaev, took to the stand in the trial of his brother dzhokhar tsarnaev. she told how her daughter converted to islam after meeting her husband . defense lawyers for tsarnaev have said that he should not be put to death because he was forced to help his brother with the boston marathon bombings. he was found guilty earlier this month of killing three people and injuring 264 in the 2013 attacks.
princess leonore, 14-months-old, was visiting the vatican with her mother, princess madeleine, 32. she was playing with her pearl necklace and pouting as she met pope francis. duchess of gotland is six months pregnant with her second child and will give birth this summer. prince carl philip will marry fiancee sofia hellqvist in stockholm on the 13th june.
the us national'speedcubing' champion was at an official rubik's cube event in doylestown, pennsylvania. collin burns shaved 0.3 of a second off the record. previous world record of 5.55 seconds was set by dutchman mats valk.
kayla mooney, 24, was in her first year teaching science at danbury high school in connecticut. she was charged with second-degree sexual assault and distributing alcohol to a minor. mooney was allegedly busted after she complained to school administrators that the boy's girlfriend was harassing her. the boy told police about his sexual relationship with the teacher last year.
paul gilbert joked that he hoped his 'off-piste' comment would not 'find it's way back' to labour leadership. he blasted labour's 'entirely unsatisfactory' policy on tuition fees and said 'i don't like where we are'   labour leader ed miliband has revealed his childhood dream was to become a london bus conductor.
little matilda fitt was born to 34-year-old hannah fitt nine weeks early in barry, south wales, weighing just 2lb 12oz. she played baby julia poldark in the bbc drama and was treated for pneumonia. matilda was chosen to play to julie, who in the tv show died from putrid throat, because of her small size. she was in and out of hospital for check-ups and tests for months after her birth, and her mother said watching death scene brought tears to her eyes.
photographer jeffrey milstein has shot a fascinating project documenting black boxes, shedding light on what happens to the devices after tragic crashes. despite the name, the boxes are usually red to help rescuers spot them among the wreckage of crashed planes and helicopters. mr milstein gained access to air safety storage facilities where data recorders end up following an accident. black boxes record flight data and conversations between pilots and are important for discovering the cause of a plane's crash.
renee bergeron, 38, photographs children with special needs as superheroes for her superhero project. she dresses them up with capes, goggles, and wands to make them feel like they can do anything. mrs. bergerson's first subject was her own son apollo, who has a feeding tube and has multiple brain surgeries.
st patrick's parish in stephensville, wisconsin has discontinued its original pig rassle tournament after 44 years of the tradition . global conservation group, an animal advocacy group, launched an online petition claiming the tournament was inhumane to the pigs. it garnered more than 80,000 signatures in efforts to cancel the event. the church said the pigs were 'punched in the face, kicked, body-slammed, yelled at and jumped on'    during its 45th annual roundup fundraiser this august, the church will be replaced with a human mud foosball tournament.
lib dem sources admit total of 57 mps will be slashed to 'in the thirties' after a catastrophic collapse in support. party is fighting 'tooth and nail' in fewer than a tenth of westminster seats. nick clegg continues tour of 60 seats where party is defending majorities or hope to make gains.
bonnie suchet was described by her husband as 'the love of my life'   she died on april 15 after a decade-long battle with dementia. john suchet, 71, declined to comment, saying it was a 'private family matter'  he has been extremely open about his wife's diagnosis, writing a book and becoming honorary president of dementia uk charity.
celine bisette, a canadian prostitute, says she wishes other people wouldn't make her feel embarrassed about her job. she insists she is neither 'damaged' nor 'deranged' and that she actually enjoys working in the sex industry. celine says she started working as a prostitute when she was 19 to pay for college. she says she has a master's degree in sociology and says she's not uneducated.
dzhokhar tsarnaev killed three people and injured 260 others in the april, 2013 bombings. less than 20 per cent of massachusetts residents believe he should be put to death. 63 per cent said he should spend the rest of his life behind bars. tsarnaev is due back in court today for the penalty phase of his trial. his defence team is set to begin presenting their case.
patricia wilnecker, 81, fell in love with lamorna cove in cornwall in 1948 and has visited it every year since. she moved to nearby town to be closer to beauty spot and wrote a book about it. but owner roy stevenson accused her of deliberately hitting his son daniel, 36, in her car. she denies the claim and says she can return but needs to say sorry to him first.
unruly passenger allegedly threatened to kill other passengers on flight from red sea city of hurghada. he was removed by an armed officer as the plane was taxiing to the runway. the man allegedly punched a bus door and uttered threats before boarding the plane. passengers were delayed for 40 minutes before the plane departed for manchester.
david cameron was giving a campaign speech when he forgot which football team he supported. the prime minister said he was an aston villa fan - but named west ham instead of the club. he flew over upton park ground in east london on way back from clacton, essex, on friday. mr cameron tried to explain away gaffe by saying he had driven by the ground the day before. he insisted he had been 'overcome by something' - but could not remember the year of the gaffe. pm insists he has been a villa fans 'all his life' and became a fan after watching 1982 european cup final.
1.2 million australians either have a secret credit card or hide purchases from a partner. 17 per cent will hide their credit card spending, versus 14 per cent of men. one in ten cardholders admit their spending has lead to an argument with a partner . generation y were found to be the least trustworthy of all age groups when it comes to their spending habits. one of three don’t pay off their bill each month and 96 per cent make at least one unplanned purchase.
brady olson, a teacher at north thurston high school in washington, tackled a 16-year-old student to the ground after he opened fire at the school commons on monday morning. no one was injured after the boy shot twice toward the ceiling in the commons before classes. the boy is in custody at the lacey police station. olson teaches advanced placement government and civics at the high school.
mass cremations have been taking place next to the bagmati river, the waterway which divides kathmandu. with the death toll now standing at more than 4,000, families are desperate to give their loved ones the honourable send-off. the wood necessary to build the pyres has started to run out and is in short supply.
kim kardashian said it was'very disappointing' that president obama did not use the word 'genocide' as he marked the 100th anniversary of the massacre of 1.5 million armenians by ottoman turks. the reality star has used her celebrity to bring awareness to the genocide since at least 2011. kim's armenian heritage comes from her father, the late robert. as a senator and presidential candidate, obama described the killings as genocide. but he has never used the word since taking office.
elizabeth dawes, 39, was told she had breast cancer at new cross hospital in wolverhampton in july 2013. doctors at the hospital told her she needed immediate surgery and chemotherapy. but four days after the operation she was told staff had confused her notes with those of other patients. she was wrongly told she needed a double mastectomy and chemotherapy . the mother-of-one was forced to give up her job as a breast cancer care nurse and is now taking legal action. royal w wolverhampton nhs trust has admitted liability for the misdiagnosis and unnecessary surgery.
signatories said they 'would like to see david cameron and george osborne given the chance to finish what they have started'    a labour government would 'jeopardise' the economic recovery, says perfume entrepreneur jo malone. mr cameron launched the conservatives' small business manifesto this morning. aurum solutions withdraws support after claiming its sales director did not sign letter.
charlotte briggs was refused a place at lydgate junior school in sheffield, even though she can see it from her bedroom window. seven-year-old was offered place at shooters grove primary - more than two miles away. her mother lynne, 49, says she must quit her job to get her daughter to school and back every day. she claims it would require four hours of travelling on the bus and force her to quit job.
auckland coastguards received a call out to a homemade boat race on sunday. about 5 homemade 'boats' were taking part in an annual fishing event. the vessels included a couch strapped to a stack of tyres and a floating subaru car. one vessel capsized outside of the harbour, but no one was injured.
william shatner wants to build a 4ft-wide pipeline from seattle down to california to transport water. he is planning to run a kickstarter campaign and is hoping to raise $30 billion (£20 billion) to build the pipeline. but the proposal has been declared 'highly illogical' by some experts. the former captain of the star trek enterprise wants to run the campaign to raise the money. he has revealed the crowdfunding campaign in an interview with yahoo news.

at least 65 british climbers and holidaymakers feared missing as death toll reaches 2,500. aftershocks set off a series of avalanches on everest base camp, with tents with climbers still inside. up to 18 people were killed and more than 60 injured in the 7.8-magnitude quake.
jay z launched a string of tweets on sunday defending his music streaming service tidal. the rapper and businessman said that big companies are'spending millions on a smear campaign' against tidal. tidal launched last month but has fallen out of apple's top 750 apps. reports claim that apple is trying to stop tidal's growth by delaying updates for its own music streaming app. jay z paid $56 million for tidal in january and relaunched it in march.
sergeant edwin mee, 46, accused of raping and molesting 11 young women who wanted to join the forces. he is accused of abusing his position of power at army careers centre in croydon. women were aged from 15 to their early twenties and were new to the country. mee denies 17 counts of sexual assault and three counts of rape at southwark crown court.   he has served in war zones in iraq and afghanistan and was medically discharged from the army in 2014.

baylie lost a stone and a half in eight weeks on a new doggy diet of raw meat, offal and bones. three-and-a-half-year-old black labrador lost the weight of four chihuahuas. his owners margaret and patrick evans from leeds say he's now 'a different dog' after losing weight. baylie had a hip condition and was unable to move properly due to weight.
kristopher hicks, now 27, was on his way home from a night out in bath, somerset, with his girlfriend. he jumped out of a taxi driven by michael young, 56, five years ago. driver mistakenly believed mr hicks was planning to 'do a runner' and decided to drive him back to the rank. but when he objected, driver continued on for almost a mile, driving at 20mph. he suffered devastating brain injuries, developed epilepsy and now requires round-the-clock care from his mother. his family took driver to the high court, where a judge ruled he had unlawfully imprisoned his passenger.
the 4,000-year-old ashbrittle yew is thought to be britain's oldest living organism. it is in the churchyard of a church in somerset and is 'looking extremely sick'   but tree expert dr owen johnson said the tree could just be going through a bad patch.

mary cowan, 92, taught at george watson's college in edinburgh for 20 years and died in november last year. she asked in her will that £700,000 of her £2million fortune should be left to charity groups. asked for a bursary scheme to be set up in her name to help poorer pupils at the school. ms cowan never married and lived in ed edinburgh her whole adult life and never had children. she retired from the school in 1981 and passed away in a semi-detached home last year .
jane tipper had been walking her dog molly when the eight-year-old chased a lamb over a cliff in eype, dorset. border terrier survived a 250ft fall, including a 100ft vertical drop, but her owner had no way of reaching her. coastguards searched for four hours but were unable to find her. molly was identified by a dog walker three days after going missing on a remote beach.

nearly 1000 bags of the depressant drug kava were seized from a vehicle in katherine, northern territory. four unrestrained children were sitting in the back seat of the unregistered car. a 39-year-old man and a woman were arrested and charged. police found approximately 20 kilograms of kava divided into 862 small bags and a small quantity of cannabis.
elena klimova, 26, runs children 404 - an online support group for lgbt teenagers. she receives hate mail from strangers telling her she's 'disgusting' and should kill herself. she has publicly shamed her trolls by posting their identities online.    she has posted their messages along with photos of each sender to russian equivalent of facebook.

maitland local karen newton performed an impromptu rendition of the last post to stranded residents of gillieston heights. five residents of the isolated town were unable to cross the water to attend an anzac day memorial service. ms newton played the bugle call over the water's edge and remembered flood victim anne jarmain. the video has over 5,000 views on facebook.
presidential candidate hillary clinton has launched campaign to be us president. clinton will be 69 when she takes office in january 2017 and will be the second-oldest ever to be president.   clinton is not the only high-profile woman refusing to change gear as she gets older. dame judi dench, anna wintour and mary berry are some of the world's most influential women.
state-of-the-art south glasgow university hospital opened today complete with a fleet of robots delivering linen. snp leader nicola sturgeon said it proves snp's commitment to the nhs. but ukip said the hospital had been funded with english taxpayers' money'shovelled' to holyrood. public funding north of the border is typically 20 per cent higher than in england.
a sydney family have claimed the body of a baby girl who was found buried on maroubra beach on november 30, 2014. two boys were playing in the sand when they found a baby's body buried under 30 centimetres of sand. filomena d'alessandro and bill green claim the infant's body in order to give her a funeral. they have named the baby girl lily grace. the baby was discovered by two boys aged six and seven who were playing on the beach. nsw police were going to give the baby a 'destitute burial' but the family have raised enough money to claim the body.
miranda ashley calvin, 19, was arrested by gresham police on sunday afternoon after allegedly hitting 49-year-old jerrie ann hornig and fleeing the scene. police were called to the scene at about 8.30pm on saturday night and found her dead. calvin was arrested on manslaughter, felony hit-and-run and reckless driving.

jonathan keats, an experimental philosopher, hopes to capture 1,000 years of changes at a mountain range in massachusetts with his'millennium camera' he intends to mount the camera on a churchless steeple on a college campus. he hopes the resulting photograph will chronicle climate change by taking a picture of the western massachusetts mountain range.

vanessa kennard was suspended in her absence by nursing and midwifery council after failing to turn up at hearing. she was one of three nurses charged with mistreating grant clarke, 45, at rehabilitation unit in kent. father-of-three suffered a brain haemorrhage in may 2012 and was paralysed on his life side. his partner binny moore planted a secret camera in his room to film his treatment. one nurse removed the alarm buzzer from mr clarke's hands and cleaned his feeding tube with a pen. but she told a disciplinary hearing she 'wasn't interested' in the case and was suspended for six months.
survivalists and so-called 'preppers' descended on the salt lake city, utah, suburb of sandy on friday for the nation's first ever preppercon. attendees learned new ways to deal with a zombie apocalypse or natural disaster, learned new methods of storing food and tried out underground bunkers. also met actors from the amc hit show 'the walking dead' and learned about solar-powered flashlights.
broga celebrates the physical over the spiritual, and strength over flexibility. more men are adding yoga to their exercise routines as a cross-training tool for flexibility and recovery time. more gyms are offering classes for men to practice the gentle work-out. broga is becoming increasingly popular thanks to its 'rugged' approach to yoga.
mark lawson, 44, was at a christmas party at diamond tap public house in newbury, berkshire with colleagues. he was angry when colleagues stole his onion rings from his plate and joked about taking more. he then stabbed colleague simon myers in the leg with a steak knife. lawson was spared jail and sentenced to a six-month prison sentence suspended for a year.
william schultz was arrested sunday afternoon, hours after jordan almgren was stabbed in the neck and declared dead in his home in discovery bay. deputies put out an alert for schultz after he got away in a truck outside the home. the day before the stabbing, deputies had also been called to the home on a request for a psychological evaluation of schultz. a nurse who saw media coverage of the case recognized the wanted suspect.

willem-alexander's 48th birthday is a public holiday in the netherlands and is marked with a royal procession. king and queen maxima and their three daughters travelled through the city of dordrecht on a royal barge. the royal couple were joined by prince constantijn and his wife laurentien.
amy-beth ellice, 17, from essex started baking at the age of three and published her first cookbook at age 14. amy's baking year is her second cookbook and she plans to launch her own baking products and become a tv chef.   she counts pixie lott and katherine jenkins among her fans and hosts cupcake-making classes in harrods.
more than 45,000 people have signed a petition calling for protein world weight loss advert to be pulled. poster features a model in a bikini with the question: 'are you beach body ready'   poster has been put up in a number of london underground stations and has attracted complaints. katie hopkins has waded into the row, dubbing those complaining as 'chubsters' on twitter.
a 7.8-magnitude earthquake hit mount everest base camp on saturday, triggering a massive avalanche. four americans, including google executive dan fredinburg, 33, and dr marisa eve girawong, 29, were killed in the avalanche. more than 60 people were injured in the incident. aftershocks followed the avalanche, with a magnitude-6.6 aftershock and a second aftershock.
the russian vessel oleg naydenov was carrying 1,400 tonnes of fuel oil when it caught fire in las palmas port on april 11. it was towed out to sea and sank 15 miles south of gran canaria. three mile long oil slick is threatening tourist spots across the canary islands of tenerife and la gomera. the government has activated an environmental emergency alert and said one beach has been cleared of oil.
pritesh, 36 and mansi gandhi, 35, started trying for a baby ten years ago but repeatedly lost five babies. mansi fell pregnant in 2007 but the baby was so premature he died after a six-month fight for life. pritesh's sister hiral shah, 32, offered to carry the couple's baby after ivf treatment. hiral underwent ivf and gave birth to a baby boy, krish, three weeks ago after a 20 minute labour.
dozens of people have been clambering around the debris of the dharahara tower in kathmandu to take selfies. one rescuer in nepal said those who were taking pictures were not 'understanding the tragedy'   it is unclear how many people were killed in the tower but it was believed to have been filled with tourists. the tower was one of the country's most treasured monuments.
chancellor said he allowed himself one hour a week to watch the hit bbc series during election campaign. mr osborne confessed to a crush on its female lead character demelza, played by eleanor tomlinson. he said the television show was a 'fantastic advert for britain' and cornwall.
hannah wilson, 22, was found dead after leaving a bar in bloomington, indiana, on friday morning. her body was found in rural brown county and daniel messel, 49, has been arrested on suspicion of her murder. her friends said she was last seen at the same bar where lauren spierer vanished in 2011. circumstances of her disappearance are 'eerily similar' to the case of the 20-year-old student. messel was arrested hours later and has been charged with wilson's murder.
mark hawkins, 49, barricaded himself inside greyhound-style bus in parking lot of a walmart in salem, oregon. he was wanted in lane county for failing to appear on a charge of delivery of a controlled substance. hawkins allegedly fired a weapon from front of vehicle, which struck police dog baco in the head. swat officers and police fired more than a dozen rounds of tear gas at the bus, but to no avail. at around 6.30pm, hawkins was shot nine times by police officers, and later died in hospital.
researchers at the swiss federal institute of technology in zurich say 75% of extreme hot weather and 18% of heavy precipitation is being driven by global warming. they warn that as climate change pushes global temperatures higher, humans will be responsible for 40 per cent of extreme rainfall events. the scientists claim it is the rarest and most destructive events that are most responsive to human influence.
at least five tornadoes were spotted across north and central texas sunday evening as part of a severe storm system sweeping the region. the storm started in comanche county, texas and moved northeast towards the dallas/fort worth area. more than five tornados were reported in the region, including a mile-wide tornado over rio vista. high winds over 70 mph and hail the size of golf balls and baseballs were also reported. nearly two dozen counties were on tornado watch sunday night, with the storm system expected to die out by monday.
president obama reportedly granted cia a waiver exempting the spy agency from providing proof of imminent threat to the us ahead of drone strikes. obama's decision could have delayed or even prevented the death of two hostages killed in a botched drone strike in january. dr warren weinstein, a 73-year-old economic adviser from the us, and italian aid worker giovanni lo porto were killed in the attack. the drone strike could have been postponed or prevented if obama had not relaxed the rules on drone policy.
labour leader will insist he offers a 'clear, credible and concrete plan on immigration - not false promises'   but his own shadow home secretary yvette cooper refused at least four times to say labour would put a target on net immigration. during labour's 13 years in power, net migration rose by 3.6million.
ecologists euan ritchie and jen martin's crowdfunding page received a pledge for over $2 billion. within an hour the donation to a kangaroo preservation project vanished. the couple launched the page in a bid to track the numbers of kangaroos in the area. they still hope to reach their goal of $15,000. the website pozible has attempted to track down the mystery pledger.
paul and laura elliott married at the virgin money london marathon on sunday. paul, 41, lost his father to bowel cancer 19 years ago. the couple have raised £7,000 so far to help honour his memory. they ran the first half of the marathon separately before finishing together.
animal welfare charity wood green animal charity has teamed up with cleaning and diy app handy to offer cat fostering service. charity says the presence of a cat and the scent it leaves behind can scare away rodents. the service is only available in london and is available through the handy smartphone app.
researchers from university of vienna found women judged to have pretty faces also have voices regarded by men as appealing. researchers photographed faces and recorded voices of 42 women with average age of 24. those rated highly for looks often scored well for sound too, according to study.
tyrone sevilla hand delivered a poster to immigration minister peter dutton's office on monday begging to stay in australia. the 10-year-old autistic boy has lived in the country with his mother maria for eight years. their visa expires today and they face the very real possibility of being deported back to the philippines. the immigration department rejected maria's visa application 28 days ago because her son's autism would be a 'burden' on the health system.

more than two dozen babies born to surrogate mothers for gay israeli couples are being airlifted out of nepal to safety. infants - some of whom were prematurely born - were evacuated from the country on monday following saturday's devastating earthquake. several premature babies - and some wounded people - were ferried to israel on emergency rescue aircraft. israel told afp that it planned to airlift 25 babies recently born to surrogates out of the country this week. many male couples have traveled to capital of kathmandu to father children with the help of surrogate mothers.

dr xiao-ping zhai says she has used traditional chinese medicine to help a thousand women become pregnant. she runs a fertility clinic in london's famous private medical haven harley street. dr zhai prescribes a bespoke combination of chinese herbs and vitamins to help conceive. one in seven couples suffer with infertility and many turn to alternative therapies.
the keshwa chaca spans the apurimac river near huinchiri, peru, and is the last inca rope bridge in the andes. local villagers rebuild the bridge each year using the same techniques as their inca ancestors. it takes three days to rebuild the 90ft long bridge, which has been there for 500 years.
bruce jenner's first wife chrystie crownover told gma on monday that she watched her ex-husband's abc diane sawyer interview with bruce and their children on friday night. the olympic decathlete revealed he identified as a woman during a prime time interview. bruce, 65, married his college sweetheart and daughter of a mormon minister in 1972. she has known for more than 43 years that bruce believes he is a woman and has kept his secret.

gel contains platelet-rich plasma - a concentrated mix of substances in the blood that play a role in healing. u.s. researchers are testing it as a dressing for burns. sometimes used to treat tendon injuries and for cosmetic procedures. could also act as a barrier against infection and stop wounds getting worse.

craig, 54, is on hormone therapy for prostate cancer, which starves cancer cells by reducing levels of testosterone in the body. 80 per cent of men having hormone therapy will suffer hot flushes. craig was diagnosed with prostate cancer in 2012 and is now well. but he still suffers from the side-effect of hot sweats.

1,000ft of land has emerged along coastline of shiretoko peninsula near rausu, on hokkaido island. geologists believe it is a result of a landslide nearby. local residents say they felt no tremors overnight, or heard any sounds. the land mass measures 1,000- 1,640ft long and 100ft wide.

the st ivan rilski church is the only remaining evidence of the community of zapalnya, bulgaria, where residents were forced to leave their homes in the 1960s. it is at the zhrebchevo reservoir, near the town of tvardica, where the town was submerged in 1965. the crumbling stone structure is the only remaining evidence of the town and surrounding area.

engineers at the dfki robotics centre describe the eossc2 as an 'ultra flexible micro-car for mega cities' and plan on enabling it to drive itself. concept car can turn on the spot, shrink in size and even move sideways, like a crab, to park itself. it is currently being tested in the cities of bremen and dalian, china. the car has a top speed of 40mph (65 km/h) and is designed to connect to others to form a train.
palaeontologists are referring to chilesaurus diegosuarezi as a 'platypus' dinosaur because of its bizarre combination of features. it belongs to the theropod group of dinosaurs, but was a vegetarian. the dinosaur from the late jurassic period, around 145 million years ago, grazed on plants. it has a small skull and feet, which are more like those seen on long-neck dinosaurs.
