betheny coyne, 24, was diagnosed with a rare heart defect before she was born and was never expected to reach her fourth birthday. doctors warned being pregnant could have placed a fatal strain on her heart. but she defied medical predictions and now, aged 24, she is mother to three healthy children. miss coyne was born with a heart condition known as coarctation of the aorta, which caused her to need open heart surgery three times as a baby. fearing her heart is like a 'ticking time bomb', she is getting married in february next year.
toxicology results released monday show linden, new jersey police officer pedro abad had three times the legal limit of alcohol in his system when he crashed his car last month. tests show officer abad's blood alcohol content was 0.24; the legal alcohol limit in new york is 0.08. abad and fellow officer patrik kudlac were critically injured in the wrong-way crash that killed another officer and a friend. officer frank viggiano and friend joe rodriguez were killed in the crash on staten island. just hours before the crash, abad posted a photo of three whiskey shots to his instagram page.
nasa scientists in california have revealed an interactive 3d map for vesta using images from the dawn spacecraft. the map lets you see features on the surface including craters, hills, mountains and even 'canyons'    vesta trek, the interactive programme lets you explore massive craters on the body - which has no atmosphere. you can draw lines on the asteroid to see elevation levels, place a pin to see how the angle of the sun changes. and a 'gaming mode' lets you fly around the largest asteroid in the solar system using the arrow keys.
colin pitchfork was jailed for life in 1988 for raping and killing two schoolgirls in narborough, leicestershire. he strangled 15-year-old lynda mann to death after raping her on a footpath in 1983. three years later he raped and killed dawn ashworth, also 15. he was the first man to be convicted on the basis of dna evidence after being caught two years later. pitchfork's minimum sentence was cut to 28 years in 2009 and he was due to be released next year. the parole board is now reviewing his suitability for release after a review of his case.

spitfire p9374 was among the first built in march 1940 but never made it to the battle of britain as it crash-landed over dunkirk in may 1940. it was once flown by airman involved in the great escape but was captured by the nazis. the fighter plane was being piloted by flying officer peter cazenove when it was hit by a single bullet. the plane was consumed by the sandy beach and remained there for 40 years. in 1980 the wreckage was discovered and bought by american billionaire philanthropist thomas kaplan after it was discovered.

spherical map of galaxy superclusters is the most complete picture of our cosmic neighbourhood to date. it will help astrophysicists understand how matter is distributed in the universe and provide insights into dark matter. the map spans nearly two billion light years from side to side.
some 1,000 carved moai statues of easter island, or rapa nui, line the perimeter of the 12 mile (25km) volcanic island. physicists believe that the hats, or 'pukao', were rolled up ramps to reach the top of the figures' heads. they are made of red stone and are thought to have been worn by the people of the island. experts at the university of oregon believe the rolling of the stones would have been relatively easy.
brenda finn, 30, was diagnosed with alopecia universalis at the age of 14 after her body hair and fingernails fell out. she was bullied at school for wearing a wig and was forced to leave school. she suffered from crippling anxiety and depression after losing her hair. she says having eyebrows tattooed on has given her the confidence to face the world again. miss finn is calling for medical tattooing to become available on the nhs, as it could have saved her years of emotional pain.

jemma gawned appeared on the first australian series of big brother in 2001. the 40-year-old now runs a wildly successful raw food empire called naked treaties. she says the secret to her success is'spreading the vibration of love through food'   she tried to run jemma cosmetics for ten years but hit financial trouble and had to fold. the entrepreneur also opened up about her time on the show and how she was portrayed.

ruth bader ginsburg, 82, is one of four liberal-voting justices on the supreme court. she has spoken out in favour of same sex marriage and even officiated at a gay marriage ceremony.    she has referred to the american public becoming more accepting of gay rights in general. she will be part of a decision on whether states are allowed to ban same-sex marriage. arguments in the case of obergefell v. hodges will be heard from tomorrow and decision is expected this summer.
david curry, 49, was asked to leave the wallow wetherspoon pub in blyth, northumberland, for a family breakfast. he was told to leave because he was wearing a pair of £40 adidas trousers. mr curry had travelled ten miles from home to visit the pub with his wife and stepdaughter. the pub chain has apologised but said a no-tracksuit policy had been in place at the bar since 2013.

greystone park psychiatric center, in new jersey, was built to house mentally ill patients. opened in 1876 and became one of the largest asylums in the us, housing 7,500 patients. it became known for the high number of patients who committed suicide and were raped. the building has been left to fall into disarray and is being demolished. but preservationists are battling to save it and claim the building should be turned into a museum and housing.
the tech giant is now under pressure by top cops to turn off the traffic app's police-tracking function. ismaaiyl brinsley, 28, killed two nypd police officers. he was known to have used the app to monitor the movements of police. several police officers say the app is being used to stalk and plan attacks on law enforcement. waze app allows users to tag the locations of parked police vehicles and accidents. google acquired waze in 2013 for a reported $1.1 billion and has 50million users in 200 countries.
health experts have compared ancient nights out to modern drinking spots. mark bellis is a professor of public health at bangor university. he is giving a talk on the history of binge drinking at a nightlife conference in las vegas. he says modern authorities should take a lead from ancient civilisations.
sharon smith, 43, from halesowen, west midlands, was a bulky size 26 and weighed 18st 6lb at her heaviest. she was forced to stand for 11-hour flight because she was too big to fit in the seat next to her. sharon's weight was down to to commuting to london for her job as a clothes designer. she decided to take up running and lost four-and-a-half stone and is now a healthy 9st 9lb.
sir frank kitson, who is 88, is accused in the case of patrick eugene heenan, a catholic killed by loyalists in 1973. it is the first time a retired senior officer has been personally sued over the troubles. sir frank said he was confused as to why he was being named because he was not even serving in northern ireland at the time.
j. j. giordano, 41-year-old photo editor for baltimore's city paper, was allegedly beaten by police saturday night as he covered protests over the death of freddie gray. he says police'swarmed over' him and pushed him to the ground after a protester threw a rock at a police line and hit an officer's shield. the photographer says he suffered minor injuries to his arm but says he will continue to photograph the protests. another protester was arrested after the incident but later released as police knew he was a journalist.
the orchid has evolved a so-called lip - a large and irregular modified petal - to attract insects. researchers from national chung hsing university in taiwan found its shape is determined by two competing groups of proteins. they converted lips into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the l and sp proteins. orchids are unique among floral plants and have three petals and a lip. lips attract insect pollinators and serve as a landing platform for them.
by 2030 up to 170 million hectares (420 million acres) of forest - equivalent to the combined size of germany, france, spain and portugal - could be lost in just 11 hotspots. research by wildlife charity the wwf identified 11 'deforestation fronts' where 80 per cent of projected global forest losses by 2030 could occur. the areas are the amazon, the atlantic forest and gran chaco, the cerrado and eastern australia. they are being lost to expanding agriculture, including livestock farming, palm oil plantations and soy production.
poppy smart complained to police after accusing builders of sexual harassment for wolf-whistling at her on her way to work. marketing co-ordinator, 23, said men at a construction site in worcester city centre whistled at her for a month. she compared the behaviour to racial discrimination and said it made her walk to work 'awful'   she recorded the constant whistling using her smartphone's video function and contacted the building company and police. west mercia police followed up miss smart's complaint as possible incident of anti-social behaviour.
nicola bonn, 34, from london, started a blog called upfront mama detailing the trials and tribulations of raising poppy, 14 months. wanted to share all the things that she had learnt about motherhood. many of her posts have gone viral and her blog posts are very candid. says she's spent too much time explaining herself and apologising for her decisions.
undersheriff tim albin, of the tulsa county sheriff's office in oklahoma, quit his job monday after new revelations about how the department treated reserve deputy robert bates, 73. bates accidentally shot dead eric harris, 44, after he was tackled to the ground. he mistakenly thought he was holding a taser, not his handgun, and said it was an accident. other deputies in the department had expressed concern about bates' fitness to serve.
the 511 elephant tusks, worth $6million (£4m), were seized at a major port in chonburi province in eastern thailand. the shipment was bound for laos and was shipped out of kenya on march 24. bust came one week after thai customs officials seized four tons of ivory from congo in the nation's biggest ever bust.

harvard-led study has mapped taste buds on a tongue for the first time. scientists examined the different cells used to identify taste and watched these cells capture and process molecules live. it reveals how taste buds have different cells that are used to differentiate between the five basic flavours. the researchers used a microscope system to image single cells on the tongue of a mouse. there are more than 2,000 taste buds that can distinguish at least five tastes.
while the countdown is on for andrew chan and myuran sukumaran's execution, many are still holding a glimmer of hope. over 300 people gathered at sydney harbour for a candlelight vigil for the condemned duo. the two men are set to be executed just after the stroke of midnight on wednesday. brisbane, melbourne and perth also saw nation-wide vigils held to show solidarity for the duo.
